verses.text_en: For silver—the crucible; For gold—the furnace, And the LORD tests the mind.
verses.text_he: מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וּבֹחֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: An evildoer listens to mischievous talk; A liar gives ear to malicious words.
verses.text_he: מֵ֭רַע מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־שְׂפַת־אָ֑וֶן שֶׁ֥קֶר מֵ֝זִ֗ין עַל־לְשׁ֥וֹן הַוֺּֽת׃

verses.text_en: He who mocks the poor affronts his Maker; He who rejoices over another’s misfortune will not go unpunished.
verses.text_he: לֹעֵ֣ג לָ֭רָשׁ חֵרֵ֣ף עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ שָׂמֵ֥חַ לְ֝אֵ֗יד לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: Grandchildren are the crown of their elders, And the glory of children is their parents.
verses.text_he: עֲטֶ֣רֶת זְ֭קֵנִים בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים וְתִפְאֶ֖רֶת בָּנִ֣ים אֲבוֹתָֽם׃

verses.text_en: Lofty words are not fitting for a villain; Much less lying words for a great man.
verses.text_he: לֹא־נָאוָ֣ה לְנָבָ֣ל שְׂפַת־יֶ֑תֶר אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְנָדִ֥יב שְׂפַת־שָֽׁקֶר׃

verses.text_en: A bribe seems like a charm to him who uses it; He succeeds at every turn.
verses.text_he: אֶבֶן־חֵ֣ן הַ֭שֹּׁחַד בְּעֵינֵ֣י בְעָלָ֑יו אֶֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִפְנֶ֣ה יַשְׂכִּֽיל׃

verses.text_en: He who seeks love overlooks faults, But he who harps on a matter alienates his friend.
verses.text_he: מְֽכַסֶּה־פֶּ֭שַׁע מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אַהֲבָ֑ה וְשֹׁנֶ֥ה בְ֝דָבָ֗ר מַפְרִ֥יד אַלּֽוּף׃

verses.text_en: A rebuke works on an intelligent man More than one hundred blows on a fool.
verses.text_he: תֵּ֣חַת גְּעָרָ֣ה בְמֵבִ֑ין מֵהַכּ֖וֹת כְּסִ֣יל מֵאָֽה׃

verses.text_en: An evil man seeks only to rebel; A ruthless messenger will be sent against him.
verses.text_he: אַךְ־מְרִ֥י יְבַקֶּשׁ־רָ֑ע וּמַלְאָ֥ךְ אַ֝כְזָרִ֗י יְשֻׁלַּח־בּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Sooner meet a bereaved she-bear Than a fool with his nonsense.
verses.text_he: פָּג֬וֹשׁ דֹּ֣ב שַׁכּ֣וּל בְּאִ֑ישׁ וְאַל־כְּ֝סִ֗יל בְּאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Evil will never depart from the house Of him who repays good with evil.
verses.text_he: מֵשִׁ֣יב רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה לֹא־[תָמ֥וּשׁ] (תמיש) רָ֝עָ֗ה מִבֵּיתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: To start a quarrel is to open a sluice; Before a dispute flares up, drop it.
verses.text_he: פּ֣וֹטֵֽר מַ֭יִם רֵאשִׁ֣ית מָד֑וֹן וְלִפְנֵ֥י הִ֝תְגַּלַּ֗ע הָרִ֥יב נְטֽוֹשׁ׃

verses.text_en: To acquit the guilty and convict the innocent— Both are an abomination to the LORD.
verses.text_he: מַצְדִּ֣יק רָ֭שָׁע וּמַרְשִׁ֣יעַ צַדִּ֑יק תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: What good is money in the hand of a fool To purchase wisdom, when he has no mind?
verses.text_he: לָמָּה־זֶּ֣ה מְחִ֣יר בְּיַד־כְּסִ֑יל לִקְנ֖וֹת חׇכְמָ֣ה וְלֶב־אָֽיִן׃

verses.text_en: A friend is devoted at all times; A brother is born to share adversity.
verses.text_he: בְּכׇל־עֵ֭ת אֹהֵ֣ב הָרֵ֑עַ וְאָ֥ח לְ֝צָרָ֗ה יִוָּלֵֽד׃

verses.text_en: Devoid of sense is he who gives his hand To stand surety for his fellow.
verses.text_he: אָדָ֣ם חֲסַר־לֵ֭ב תּוֹקֵ֣עַ כָּ֑ף עֹרֵ֥ב עֲ֝רֻבָּ֗ה לִפְנֵ֥י רֵעֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: He who loves transgression loves strife; He who builds a high threshold invites broken bones.
verses.text_he: אֹ֣הֵֽב פֶּ֭שַׁע אֹהֵ֣ב מַצָּ֑ה מַגְבִּ֥יהַּ פִּ֝תְח֗וֹ מְבַקֶּשׁ־שָֽׁבֶר׃

verses.text_en: Man of crooked mind comes to no good, And he who speaks duplicity falls into trouble.
verses.text_he: עִקֶּשׁ־לֵ֭ב לֹ֣א יִמְצָא־ט֑וֹב וְנֶהְפָּ֥ךְ בִּ֝לְשׁוֹנ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃

verses.text_en: One begets a dullard to one’s own grief; The father of a villain has no joy.
verses.text_he: יֹלֵ֣ד כְּ֭סִיל לְת֣וּגָה ל֑וֹ וְלֹא־יִ֝שְׂמַ֗ח אֲבִ֣י נָבָֽל׃

verses.text_en: A joyful heart makes for good health; Despondency dries up the bones.
verses.text_he: לֵ֣ב שָׂ֭מֵחַ יֵיטִ֣יב גֵּהָ֑ה וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה תְּיַבֶּשׁ־גָּֽרֶם׃

verses.text_en: The wicked man draws a bribe out of his bosom To pervert the course of justice.
verses.text_he: שֹׁ֣חַד מֵ֭חֵק רָשָׁ֣ע יִקָּ֑ח לְ֝הַטּ֗וֹת אׇרְח֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: Wisdom lies before the intelligent man; The eyes of the dullard range to the ends of the earth.
verses.text_he: אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י מֵבִ֣ין חׇכְמָ֑ה וְעֵינֵ֥י כְ֝סִ֗יל בִּקְצֵה־אָֽרֶץ׃

verses.text_en: A stupid son is vexation for his father And a heartache for the woman who bore him.
verses.text_he: כַּ֣עַס לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וּ֝מֶ֗מֶר לְיֽוֹלַדְתּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: To punish the innocent is surely not right, Or to flog the great for their uprightness.
verses.text_he: גַּ֤ם עֲנ֣וֹשׁ לַצַּדִּ֣יק לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַכּ֖וֹת נְדִיבִ֣ים עַל־יֹֽשֶׁר׃

verses.text_en: A knowledgeable man is sparing with his words; A man of understanding is reticent.
verses.text_he: חוֹשֵׂ֣ךְ אֲ֭מָרָיו יוֹדֵ֣עַ דָּ֑עַת (וקר) [יְקַר־]ר֝֗וּחַ אִ֣ישׁ תְּבוּנָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Even a fool, if he keeps silent, is deemed wise; Intelligent, if he seals his lips.
verses.text_he: גַּ֤ם אֱוִ֣יל מַ֭חֲרִישׁ חָכָ֣ם יֵחָשֵׁ֑ב אֹטֵ֖ם שְׂפָתָ֣יו נָבֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: He who isolates himself pursues his desires; He disdains all competence.
verses.text_he: לְֽ֭תַאֲוָה יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ נִפְרָ֑ד בְּכׇל־תּ֝וּשִׁיָּ֗ה יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃

verses.text_en: The fool does not desire understanding, But only to air his thoughts.
verses.text_he: לֹא־יַחְפֹּ֣ץ כְּ֭סִיל בִּתְבוּנָ֑ה כִּ֝֗י אִֽם־בְּהִתְגַּלּ֥וֹת לִבּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Comes the wicked man comes derision, And with the rogue, contempt.
verses.text_he: בְּֽבוֹא־רָ֭שָׁע בָּ֣א גַם־בּ֑וּז וְֽעִם־קָל֥וֹן חֶרְפָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: The words a man speaks are deep waters, A flowing stream, a fountain of wisdom.
verses.text_he: מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים דִּבְרֵ֣י פִי־אִ֑ישׁ נַ֥חַל נֹ֝בֵ֗עַ מְק֣וֹר חׇכְמָֽה׃

verses.text_en: It is not right to be partial to the guilty And subvert the innocent in judgment.
verses.text_he: שְׂאֵ֣ת פְּנֵי־רָשָׁ֣ע לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַטּ֥וֹת צַ֝דִּ֗יק בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: The words of a fool lead to strife; His speech invites blows.
verses.text_he: שִׂפְתֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל יָבֹ֣אוּ בְרִ֑יב וּ֝פִ֗יו לְֽמַהֲלֻמ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽא׃

verses.text_en: The fool’s speech is his ruin; His words are a trap for him.
verses.text_he: פִּֽי־כְ֭סִיל מְחִתָּה־ל֑וֹ וּ֝שְׂפָתָ֗יו מוֹקֵ֥שׁ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The words of a querulous man are bruising; They penetrate one’s inmost parts.
verses.text_he: דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃

verses.text_en: One who is slack in his work Is a brother to a vandal.
verses.text_he: גַּ֭ם מִתְרַפֶּ֣ה בִמְלַאכְתּ֑וֹ אָ֥ח ה֝֗וּא לְבַ֣עַל מַשְׁחִֽית׃

verses.text_en: The name of the LORD is a tower of strength To which the righteous man runs and is safe.
verses.text_he: מִגְדַּל־עֹ֭ז שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה בּֽוֹ־יָר֖וּץ צַדִּ֣יק וְנִשְׂגָּֽב׃

verses.text_en: The wealth of a rich man is his fortress; In his fancy it is a protective wall.
verses.text_he: ה֣וֹן עָ֭שִׁיר קִרְיַ֣ת עֻזּ֑וֹ וּכְחוֹמָ֥ה נִ֝שְׂגָּבָ֗ה בְּמַשְׂכִּתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Before ruin a man’s heart is proud; Humility goes before honor.
verses.text_he: לִפְנֵי־שֶׁ֭בֶר יִגְבַּ֣הּ לֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָב֣וֹד עֲנָוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: To answer a man before hearing him out Is foolish and disgraceful.
verses.text_he: מֵשִׁ֣יב דָּ֭בָר בְּטֶ֣רֶם יִשְׁמָ֑ע אִוֶּ֥לֶת הִיא־ל֝֗וֹ וּכְלִמָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: A man’s spirit can sustain him through illness; But low spirits—who can bear them?
verses.text_he: רֽוּחַ־אִ֭ישׁ יְכַלְכֵּ֣ל מַחֲלֵ֑הוּ וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה מִ֣י יִשָּׂאֶֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: The mind of an intelligent man acquires knowledge; The ears of the wise seek out knowledge.
verses.text_he: לֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן יִקְנֶה־דָּ֑עַת וְאֹ֥זֶן חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים תְּבַקֶּשׁ־דָּֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: A man’s gift eases his way And gives him access to the great.
verses.text_he: מַתָּ֣ן אָ֭דָם יַרְחִ֣יב ל֑וֹ וְלִפְנֵ֖י גְדֹלִ֣ים יַנְחֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: The first to plead his case seems right Till the other party examines him.
verses.text_he: צַדִּ֣יק הָרִאשׁ֣וֹן בְּרִיב֑וֹ (יבא) [וּבָֽא־]רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ וַחֲקָרֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The lot puts an end to strife And separates those locked in dispute.
verses.text_he: מִ֭דְיָנִים יַשְׁבִּ֣ית הַגּוֹרָ֑ל וּבֵ֖ין עֲצוּמִ֣ים יַפְרִֽיד׃

verses.text_en: A brother offended is more formidable than a stronghold; Such strife is like the bars of a fortress.
verses.text_he: אָ֗ח נִפְשָׁ֥ע מִקִּרְיַת־עֹ֑ז (ומדונים) [וּ֝מִדְיָנִ֗ים] כִּבְרִ֥יחַ אַרְמֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: A man’s belly is filled by the fruit of his mouth; He will be filled by the produce of his lips.
verses.text_he: מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ תִּשְׂבַּ֣ע בִּטְנ֑וֹ תְּבוּאַ֖ת שְׂפָתָ֣יו יִשְׂבָּֽע׃

verses.text_en: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; Those who love it will eat its fruit.
verses.text_he: מָ֣וֶת וְ֭חַיִּים בְּיַד־לָשׁ֑וֹן וְ֝אֹהֲבֶ֗יהָ יֹאכַ֥ל פִּרְיָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: He who finds a wife has found happiness And has won the favor of the LORD.
verses.text_he: מָצָ֣א אִ֭שָּׁה מָ֣צָא ט֑וֹב וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: The poor man speaks beseechingly; The rich man’s answer is harsh.
verses.text_he: תַּחֲנוּנִ֥ים יְדַבֶּר־רָ֑שׁ וְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר יַעֲנֶ֥ה עַזּֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: There are companions to keep one company, And there is a friend more devoted than a brother.
verses.text_he: אִ֣ישׁ רֵ֭עִים לְהִתְרֹעֵ֑עַ וְיֵ֥שׁ אֹ֝הֵ֗ב דָּבֵ֥ק מֵאָֽח׃

verses.text_en: Better a poor man who lives blamelessly Than one who speaks perversely and is a dullard.
verses.text_he: טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו וְה֣וּא כְסִֽיל׃

verses.text_en: A person without knowledge is surely not good; He who moves hurriedly blunders.
verses.text_he: גַּ֤ם בְּלֹא־דַ֣עַת נֶ֣פֶשׁ לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְאָ֖ץ בְּרַגְלַ֣יִם חוֹטֵֽא׃

verses.text_en: A man’s folly subverts his way, And his heart rages against the LORD.
verses.text_he: אִוֶּ֣לֶת אָ֭דָם תְּסַלֵּ֣ף דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְעַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִזְעַ֥ף לִבּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Wealth makes many friends, But a poor man loses his last friend.
verses.text_he: ה֗וֹן יֹ֭סִיף רֵעִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝דָ֗ל מֵרֵעֵ֥הוּ יִפָּרֵֽד׃

verses.text_en: A false witness will not go unpunished; He who testifies lies will not escape.
verses.text_he: עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֥יחַ כְּ֝זָבִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִמָּלֵֽט׃

verses.text_en: Many court the favor of a great man, And all are the friends of a dispenser of gifts.
verses.text_he: רַ֭בִּים יְחַלּ֣וּ פְנֵֽי־נָדִ֑יב וְכׇל־הָ֝רֵ֗עַ לְאִ֣ישׁ מַתָּֽן׃

verses.text_en: All the brothers of a poor man despise him; How much more is he shunned by his friends! He who pursues words—they are of no avail.
verses.text_he: כׇּ֥ל־אֲחֵי־רָ֨שׁ׀ שְֽׂנֵאֻ֗הוּ אַ֤ף כִּ֣י מְ֭רֵעֵהוּ רָחֲק֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ מְרַדֵּ֖ף אֲמָרִ֣ים (לא) [לוֹ־]הֵֽמָּה׃

verses.text_en: He who acquires wisdom is his own best friend; He preserves understanding and attains happiness.
verses.text_he: קֹֽנֶה־לֵּ֭ב אֹהֵ֣ב נַפְשׁ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֥ר תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה לִמְצֹא־טֽוֹב׃

verses.text_en: A false witness will not go unpunished; He who testifies falsely is doomed.
verses.text_he: עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֖יחַ כְּזָבִ֣ים יֹאבֵֽד׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Luxury is not fitting for a dullard, Much less that a servant rule over princes.
verses.text_he: לֹא־נָאוֶ֣ה לִכְסִ֣יל תַּעֲנ֑וּג אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְעֶ֤בֶד׀ מְשֹׁ֬ל בְּשָׂרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: A man shows intelligence by his forebearance; It is his glory when he overlooks an offense.
verses.text_he: שֵׂ֣כֶל אָ֭דָם הֶאֱרִ֣יךְ אַפּ֑וֹ וְ֝תִפְאַרְתּ֗וֹ עֲבֹ֣ר עַל־פָּֽשַׁע׃

verses.text_en: The rage of a king is like the roar of a lion; His favor is like dew upon the grass.
verses.text_he: נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר זַ֣עַף מֶ֑לֶךְ וּכְטַ֖ל עַל־עֵ֣שֶׂב רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: A stupid son is a calamity to his father; The nagging of a wife is like the endless dripping of water.
verses.text_he: הַוֺּ֣ת לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וְדֶ֥לֶף טֹ֝רֵ֗ד מִדְיְנֵ֥י אִשָּֽׁה׃

verses.text_en: Property and riches are bequeathed by fathers, But an efficient wife comes from the LORD.
verses.text_he: בַּ֣יִת וָ֭הוֹן נַחֲלַ֣ת אָב֑וֹת וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה אִשָּׁ֥ה מַשְׂכָּֽלֶת׃

verses.text_en: Laziness induces sleep, And a negligent person will go hungry.
verses.text_he: עַ֭צְלָה תַּפִּ֣יל תַּרְדֵּמָ֑ה וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ רְמִיָּ֣ה תִרְעָֽב׃

verses.text_en: He who has regard for his life pays regard to commandments; He who is heedless of his ways will die.
verses.text_he: שֹׁמֵ֣ר מִ֭צְוָה שֹׁמֵ֣ר נַפְשׁ֑וֹ בּוֹזֵ֖ה דְרָכָ֣יו (יומת) [יָמֽוּת]׃

verses.text_en: He who is generous to the poor makes a loan to the LORD; He will repay him his due.
verses.text_he: מַלְוֵ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה ח֣וֹנֵֽן דָּ֑ל וּ֝גְמֻל֗וֹ יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Discipline your son while there is still hope, And do not set your heart on his destruction.
verses.text_he: יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ כִּֽי־יֵ֣שׁ תִּקְוָ֑ה וְאֶל־הֲ֝מִית֗וֹ אַל־תִּשָּׂ֥א נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃

verses.text_en: A hot-tempered man incurs punishment; If you try to save him you will only make it worse.
verses.text_he: (גרל) [גְּֽדׇל־]חֵ֭מָה נֹ֣שֵׂא עֹ֑נֶשׁ כִּ֥י אִם־תַּ֝צִּ֗יל וְע֣וֹד תּוֹסִֽף׃

verses.text_en: Listen to advice and accept discipline In order that you may be wise in the end.
verses.text_he: שְׁמַ֣ע עֵ֭צָה וְקַבֵּ֣ל מוּסָ֑ר לְ֝מַ֗עַן תֶּחְכַּ֥ם בְּאַחֲרִיתֶֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Many designs are in a man’s mind, But it is the LORD’s plan that is accomplished.
verses.text_he: רַבּ֣וֹת מַחֲשָׁב֣וֹת בְּלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וַעֲצַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הִ֣יא תָקֽוּם׃

verses.text_en: Greed is a reproach to a man; Better be poor than a liar.
verses.text_he: תַּאֲוַ֣ת אָדָ֣ם חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְטֽוֹב־רָ֝֗שׁ מֵאִ֥ישׁ כָּזָֽב׃

verses.text_en: He who fears the LORD earns life; He shall abide in contentment, Free from misfortune.
verses.text_he: יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה לְחַיִּ֑ים וְשָׂבֵ֥עַ יָ֝לִ֗ין בַּל־יִפָּ֥קֶד רָֽע׃

verses.text_en: The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl; He will not even bring it to his mouth.
verses.text_he: טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת גַּם־אֶל־פִּ֝֗יהוּ לֹ֣א יְשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: Beat the scoffer and the simple will become clever; Reprove an intelligent man and he gains knowledge.
verses.text_he: לֵ֣ץ תַּ֭כֶּה וּפֶ֣תִי יַעְרִ֑ם וְהוֹכִ֥יחַ לְ֝נָב֗וֹן יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: A son who causes shame and disgrace Plunders his father, puts his mother to flight.
verses.text_he: מְֽשַׁדֶּד־אָ֭ב יַבְרִ֣יחַ אֵ֑ם בֵּ֝֗ן מֵבִ֥ישׁ וּמַחְפִּֽיר׃

verses.text_en: My son, cease to stray from words of knowledge And receive discipline.
verses.text_he: חֲֽדַל־בְּ֭נִי לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ מוּסָ֑ר לִ֝שְׁג֗וֹת מֵאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: A malicious witness scoffs at justice, And the speech of the wicked conceals mischief.
verses.text_he: עֵ֣ד בְּ֭לִיַּעַל יָלִ֣יץ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְבַלַּע־אָֽוֶן׃

verses.text_en: Punishments are in store for scoffers And blows for the backs of dullards.
verses.text_he: נָכ֣וֹנוּ לַלֵּצִ֣ים שְׁפָטִ֑ים וּ֝מַהֲלֻמ֗וֹת לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Wine is a scoffer, strong drink a roisterer; He who is muddled by them will not grow wise.
verses.text_he: לֵ֣ץ הַ֭יַּיִן הֹמֶ֣ה שֵׁכָ֑ר וְכׇל־שֹׁ֥גֶה בּ֝֗וֹ לֹ֣א יֶחְכָּֽם׃

verses.text_en: The terror of a king is like the roar of a lion; He who provokes his anger risks his life.
verses.text_he: נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר אֵ֣ימַת מֶ֑לֶךְ מִ֝תְעַבְּר֗וֹ חוֹטֵ֥א נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃

verses.text_en: It is honorable for a man to desist from strife, But every fool becomes embroiled.
verses.text_he: כָּב֣וֹד לָ֭אִישׁ שֶׁ֣בֶת מֵרִ֑יב וְכׇל־אֱ֝וִ֗יל יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃

verses.text_en: In winter the lazy man does not plow; At harvesttime he seeks, and finds nothing.
verses.text_he: מֵ֭חֹרֶף עָצֵ֣ל לֹא־יַחֲרֹ֑שׁ (ישאל) [וְשָׁאַ֖ל] בַּקָּצִ֣יר וָאָֽיִן׃

verses.text_en: The designs in a man’s mind are deep waters, But a man of understanding can draw them out.
verses.text_he: מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים עֵצָ֣ה בְלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּבוּנָ֣ה יִדְלֶֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: He calls many a man his loyal friend, But who can find a faithful man?
verses.text_he: רׇב־אָדָ֗ם יִ֭קְרָא אִ֣ישׁ חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֱ֝מוּנִ֗ים מִ֣י יִמְצָֽא׃

verses.text_en: The righteous man lives blamelessly; Happy are his children who come after him.
verses.text_he: מִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֣וֹ צַדִּ֑יק אַשְׁרֵ֖י בָנָ֣יו אַחֲרָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: The king seated on the throne of judgment Can winnow out all evil by his glance.
verses.text_he: מֶ֗לֶךְ יוֹשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסֵּא־דִ֑ין מְזָרֶ֖ה בְעֵינָ֣יו כׇּל־רָֽע׃

verses.text_en: Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart, I am purged of my sin”?
verses.text_he: מִֽי־יֹ֭אמַר זִכִּ֣יתִי לִבִּ֑י טָ֝הַ֗רְתִּי מֵחַטָּאתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: False weights and false measures, Both are an abomination to the LORD.
verses.text_he: אֶ֣בֶן וָ֭אֶבֶן אֵיפָ֣ה וְאֵיפָ֑ה תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: A child may be dissembling in his behavior Even though his actions are blameless and proper.
verses.text_he: גַּ֣ם בְּ֭מַעֲלָלָיו יִתְנַכֶּר־נָ֑עַר אִם־זַ֖ךְ וְאִם־יָשָׁ֣ר פׇּעֳלֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The ear that hears, the eye that sees— The LORD made them both.
verses.text_he: אֹ֣זֶן שֹׁ֭מַעַת וְעַ֣יִן רֹאָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עָשָׂ֥ה גַם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Do not love sleep lest you be impoverished; Keep your eyes open and you will have plenty of food.
verses.text_he: אַל־תֶּאֱהַ֣ב שֵׁ֭נָה פֶּן־תִּוָּרֵ֑שׁ פְּקַ֖ח עֵינֶ֣יךָ שְֽׂבַֽע־לָֽחֶם׃

verses.text_en: “Bad, bad,” says the buyer, But having moved off, he congratulates himself.
verses.text_he: רַ֣ע רַ֭ע יֹאמַ֣ר הַקּוֹנֶ֑ה וְאֹזֵ֥ל ל֝֗וֹ אָ֣ז יִתְהַלָּֽל׃

verses.text_en: Gold is plentiful, jewels abundant, But wise speech is a precious object.
verses.text_he: יֵ֣שׁ זָ֭הָב וְרׇב־פְּנִינִ֑ים וּכְלִ֥י יְ֝קָ֗ר שִׂפְתֵי־דָֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another; Take it as a pledge, [for he stood surety] for an unfamiliar woman.
verses.text_he: לְֽקַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד (נכרים) [נׇכְרִיָּ֣ה] חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: Bread gained by fraud may be tasty to a man, But later his mouth will be filled with gravel.
verses.text_he: עָרֵ֣ב לָ֭אִישׁ לֶ֣חֶם שָׁ֑קֶר וְ֝אַחַ֗ר יִמָּֽלֵא־פִ֥יהוּ חָצָֽץ׃

verses.text_en: Plans laid in council will succeed; Wage war with stratagems.
verses.text_he: מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת בְּעֵצָ֣ה תִכּ֑וֹן וּ֝בְתַחְבֻּל֗וֹת עֲשֵׂ֣ה מִלְחָמָֽה׃

verses.text_en: He who gives away secrets is a base fellow; Do not take up with a garrulous man.
verses.text_he: גּֽוֹלֶה־סּ֭וֹד הוֹלֵ֣ךְ רָכִ֑יל וּלְפֹתֶ֥ה שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִתְעָרָֽב׃

verses.text_en: One who reviles his father or mother, Light will fail him when darkness comes.
verses.text_he: מְ֭קַלֵּל אָבִ֣יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ יִֽדְעַ֥ךְ נֵ֝ר֗וֹ (באישון) [בֶּאֱשׁ֥וּן] חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃

verses.text_en: An estate acquired in haste at the outset Will not be blessed in the end.
verses.text_he: נַ֭חֲלָה (מבחלת) [מְבֹהֶ֣לֶת] בָּרִאשׁוֹנָ֑ה וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ לֹ֣א תְבֹרָֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: Do not say, “I will requite evil”; Put your hope in the LORD and He will deliver you.
verses.text_he: אַל־תֹּאמַ֥ר אֲשַׁלְּמָה־רָ֑ע קַוֵּ֥ה לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה וְיֹ֣שַֽׁע לָֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: False weights are an abomination to the LORD; Dishonest scales are not right.
verses.text_he: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה אֶ֣בֶן וָאָ֑בֶן וּמֹאזְנֵ֖י מִרְמָ֣ה לֹא־טֽוֹב׃

verses.text_en: A man’s steps are decided by the LORD; What does a man know about his own way?
verses.text_he: מֵיְהֹוָ֥ה מִצְעֲדֵי־גָ֑בֶר וְ֝אָדָ֗ם מַה־יָּבִ֥ין דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: It is a snare for a man to pledge a sacred gift rashly And to give thought to his vows only after they have been made.
verses.text_he: מוֹקֵ֣שׁ אָ֭דָם יָ֣לַע קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְאַחַ֖ר נְדָרִ֣ים לְבַקֵּֽר׃

verses.text_en: A wise king winnows out the wicked, And turns the wheel upon them.
verses.text_he: מְזָרֶ֣ה רְ֭שָׁעִים מֶ֣לֶךְ חָכָ֑ם וַיָּ֖שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם אוֹפָֽן׃

verses.text_en: The lifebreath of man is the lamp of the LORD Revealing all his inmost parts.
verses.text_he: נֵ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה נִשְׁמַ֣ת אָדָ֑ם חֹ֝פֵ֗שׂ כׇּל־חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃

verses.text_en: Faithfulness and loyalty protect the king; He maintains his throne by faithfulness.
verses.text_he: חֶ֣סֶד וֶ֭אֱמֶת יִצְּרוּ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְסָעַ֖ד בַּחֶ֣סֶד כִּסְאֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The glory of youths is their strength; The majesty of old men is their gray hair.
verses.text_he: תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת בַּחוּרִ֣ים כֹּחָ֑ם וַהֲדַ֖ר זְקֵנִ֣ים שֵׂיבָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Bruises and wounds are repayment for evil, Striking at one’s inmost parts.
verses.text_he: חַבֻּר֣וֹת פֶּ֭צַע (תמריק) [תַּמְר֣וּק] בְּרָ֑ע וּ֝מַכּ֗וֹת חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃

verses.text_en: Like channeled water is the mind of the king in the LORD’s hand; He directs it to whatever He wishes.
verses.text_he: פַּלְגֵי־מַ֣יִם לֶב־מֶ֭לֶךְ בְּיַד־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יַחְפֹּ֣ץ יַטֶּֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: All the ways of a man seem right to him, But the LORD probes the mind.
verses.text_he: כׇּֽל־דֶּרֶךְ־אִ֭ישׁ יָשָׁ֣ר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְתֹכֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: To do what is right and just Is more desired by the LORD than sacrifice.
verses.text_he: עֲ֭שֹׂה צְדָקָ֣ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט נִבְחָ֖ר לַיהֹוָ֣ה מִזָּֽבַח׃

verses.text_en: Haughty looks, a proud heart— The tillage of the wicked is sinful.
verses.text_he: רוּם־עֵ֭ינַיִם וּרְחַב־לֵ֑ב נִ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים חַטָּֽאת׃

verses.text_en: The plans of the diligent make only for gain; All rash haste makes only for loss.
verses.text_he: מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת חָ֭רוּץ אַךְ־לְמוֹתָ֑ר וְכׇל־אָ֝֗ץ אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃

verses.text_en: Treasures acquired by a lying tongue Are like driven vapor, heading for extinction.
verses.text_he: פֹּ֣עַל אֹ֭צָרוֹת בִּלְשׁ֣וֹן שָׁ֑קֶר הֶ֥בֶל נִ֝דָּ֗ף מְבַקְשֵׁי־מָֽוֶת׃

verses.text_en: The violence of the wicked sweeps them away, For they refuse to act justly.
verses.text_he: שֹׁד־רְשָׁעִ֥ים יְגוֹרֵ֑ם כִּ֥י מֵ֝אֲנ֗וּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: The way of a man may be tortuous and strange, Though his actions are blameless and proper.
verses.text_he: הֲפַכְפַּ֬ךְ דֶּ֣רֶךְ אִ֣ישׁ וָזָ֑ר וְ֝זַ֗ךְ יָשָׁ֥ר פׇּעֳלֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better Than a contentious wife in a spacious house.
verses.text_he: ט֗וֹב לָשֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃

verses.text_en: The desire of the wicked is set upon evil; His fellowman finds no favor in his eyes.
verses.text_he: נֶ֣פֶשׁ רָ֭שָׁע אִוְּתָה־רָ֑ע לֹֽא־יֻחַ֖ן בְּעֵינָ֣יו רֵעֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: When a scoffer is punished, the simple man is edified; When a wise man is taught, he gains insight.
verses.text_he: בַּֽעֲנׇשׁ־לֵ֭ץ יֶחְכַּם־פֶּ֑תִי וּבְהַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְ֝חָכָ֗ם יִקַּח־דָּֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: The Righteous One observes the house of the wicked man; He subverts the wicked to their ruin.
verses.text_he: מַשְׂכִּ֣יל צַ֭דִּיק לְבֵ֣ית רָשָׁ֑ע מְסַלֵּ֖ף רְשָׁעִ֣ים לָרָֽע׃

verses.text_en: Who stops his ears at the cry of the wretched, He too will call and not be answered.
verses.text_he: אֹטֵ֣ם אׇ֭זְנוֹ מִזַּעֲקַת־דָּ֑ל גַּֽם־ה֥וּא יִ֝קְרָ֗א וְלֹ֣א יֵעָנֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: A gift in secret subdues anger, A present in private, fierce rage.
verses.text_he: מַתָּ֣ן בַּ֭סֵּתֶר יִכְפֶּה־אָ֑ף וְשֹׁ֥חַד בַּ֝חֵ֗ק חֵמָ֥ה עַזָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: Justice done is a joy to the righteous, To evildoers, ruination.
verses.text_he: שִׂמְחָ֣ה לַ֭צַּדִּיק עֲשׂ֣וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝מְחִתָּ֗ה לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃

verses.text_en: A man who strays from the path of prudence Will rest in the company of ghosts.
verses.text_he: אָדָ֗ם תּ֭וֹעֶה מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ הַשְׂכֵּ֑ל בִּקְהַ֖ל רְפָאִ֣ים יָנֽוּחַ׃

verses.text_en: He who loves pleasure comes to want; He who loves wine and oil does not grow rich.
verses.text_he: אִ֣ישׁ מַ֭חְסוֹר אֹהֵ֣ב שִׂמְחָ֑ה אֹהֵ֥ב יַֽיִן־וָ֝שֶׁ֗מֶן לֹ֣א יַעֲשִֽׁיר׃

verses.text_en: The wicked are the ransom of the righteous; The traitor comes in place of the upright.
verses.text_he: כֹּ֣פֶר לַצַּדִּ֣יק רָשָׁ֑ע וְתַ֖חַת יְשָׁרִ֣ים בּוֹגֵֽד׃

verses.text_en: It is better to live in the desert Than with a contentious, vexatious wife.
verses.text_he: ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִדְבָּ֑ר מֵאֵ֖שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִדְיָנִ֣ים] וָכָֽעַס׃

verses.text_en: Precious treasure and oil are in the house of the wise man, And a fool of a man will run through them.
verses.text_he: אוֹצָ֤ר׀ נֶחְמָ֣ד וָ֭שֶׁמֶן בִּנְוֵ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וּכְסִ֖יל אָדָ֣ם יְבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: He who strives to do good and kind deeds Attains life, success, and honor.
verses.text_he: רֹ֭דֵף צְדָקָ֣ה וָחָ֑סֶד יִמְצָ֥א חַ֝יִּ֗ים צְדָקָ֥ה וְכָבֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: One wise man prevailed over a city of warriors And brought down its mighty stronghold.
verses.text_he: עִ֣יר גִּ֭בֹּרִים עָלָ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וַ֝יֹּ֗רֶד עֹ֣ז מִבְטֶחָֽהֿ׃

verses.text_en: He who guards his mouth and tongue Guards himself from trouble.
verses.text_he: שֹׁמֵ֣ר פִּ֭יו וּלְשׁוֹנ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֖ר מִצָּר֣וֹת נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The proud, insolent man, scoffer is his name, Acts in a frenzy of insolence.
verses.text_he: זֵ֣ד יָ֭הִיר לֵ֣ץ שְׁמ֑וֹ ע֝וֹשֶׂ֗ה בְּעֶבְרַ֥ת זָדֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: The craving of a lazy man kills him, For his hands refuse to work.
verses.text_he: תַּאֲוַ֣ת עָצֵ֣ל תְּמִיתֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־מֵאֲנ֖וּ יָדָ֣יו לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃

verses.text_en: All day long he is seized with craving While the righteous man gives without stint.
verses.text_he: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם הִתְאַוָּ֣ה תַאֲוָ֑ה וְצַדִּ֥יק יִ֝תֵּ֗ן וְלֹ֣א יַחְשֹֽׂךְ׃

verses.text_en: The sacrifice of the wicked man is an abomination, The more so as he offers it in depravity.
verses.text_he: זֶ֣בַח רְ֭שָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָ֑ה אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־בְזִמָּ֥ה יְבִיאֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: A false witness is doomed, But one who really heard will testify with success.
verses.text_he: עֵד־כְּזָבִ֥ים יֹאבֵ֑ד וְאִ֥ישׁ שׁ֝וֹמֵ֗עַ לָנֶ֥צַח יְדַבֵּֽר׃

verses.text_en: The wicked man is brazen-faced; The upright man discerns his course.
verses.text_he: הֵעֵ֬ז אִ֣ישׁ רָשָׁ֣ע בְּפָנָ֑יו וְ֝יָשָׁ֗ר ה֤וּא׀ (יכין דרכיו) [יָבִ֬ין דַּרְכּֽוֹ]׃

verses.text_en: No wisdom, no prudence, and no counsel Can prevail against the LORD.
verses.text_he: אֵ֣ין חׇ֭כְמָה וְאֵ֣ין תְּבוּנָ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין עֵ֝צָ֗ה לְנֶ֣גֶד יְהֹוָֽה׃{פ}

verses.text_en: The horse is readied for the day of battle, But victory comes from the LORD.
verses.text_he: ס֗וּס מ֭וּכָן לְי֣וֹם מִלְחָמָ֑ה וְ֝לַיהֹוָ֗ה הַתְּשׁוּעָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Repute is preferable to great wealth, Grace is better than silver and gold.
verses.text_he: נִבְחָ֣ר שֵׁ֭ם מֵעֹ֣שֶׁר רָ֑ב מִכֶּ֥סֶף וּ֝מִזָּהָ֗ב חֵ֣ן טֽוֹב׃

verses.text_en: Rich man and poor man meet; The LORD made them both.
verses.text_he: עָשִׁ֣יר וָרָ֣שׁ נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ עֹשֵׂ֖ה כֻלָּ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover; The simple kept going and paid the penalty.
verses.text_he: עָר֤וּם׀ רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה (ויסתר) [וְנִסְתָּ֑ר] וּ֝פְתָיִ֗ים עָבְר֥וּ וְֽנֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃

verses.text_en: The effect of humility is fear of the LORD, Wealth, honor, and life.
verses.text_he: עֵ֣קֶב עֲ֭נָוָה יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֖שֶׁר וְכָב֣וֹד וְחַיִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: Thorns and snares are in the path of the crooked; He who values his life will keep far from them.
verses.text_he: צִנִּ֣ים פַּ֭חִים בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ עִקֵּ֑שׁ שׁוֹמֵ֥ר נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ יִרְחַ֥ק מֵהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Train a lad in the way he ought to go; He will not swerve from it even in old age.
verses.text_he: חֲנֹ֣ךְ לַ֭נַּעַר עַל־פִּ֣י דַרְכּ֑וֹ גַּ֥ם כִּי־יַ֝זְקִ֗ין לֹא־יָס֥וּר מִמֶּֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: The rich rule the poor, And the borrower is a slave to the lender.
verses.text_he: עָ֭שִׁיר בְּרָשִׁ֣ים יִמְשׁ֑וֹל וְעֶ֥בֶד לֹ֝וֶ֗ה לְאִ֣ישׁ מַלְוֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: He who sows injustice shall reap misfortune; His rod of wrath shall fail.
verses.text_he: זוֹרֵ֣עַ עַ֭וְלָה (יקצור) [יִקְצׇר־]אָ֑וֶן וְשֵׁ֖בֶט עֶבְרָת֣וֹ יִכְלֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: The generous man is blessed, For he gives of his bread to the poor.
verses.text_he: טֽוֹב־עַ֭יִן ה֣וּא יְבֹרָ֑ךְ כִּֽי־נָתַ֖ן מִלַּחְמ֣וֹ לַדָּֽל׃

verses.text_en: Expel the scoffer and contention departs, Quarrel and contumely cease.
verses.text_he: גָּ֣רֵֽשׁ לֵ֭ץ וְיֵצֵ֣א מָד֑וֹן וְ֝יִשְׁבֹּ֗ת דִּ֣ין וְקָלֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: A pure-hearted friend, His speech is gracious; He has the king for his companion.
verses.text_he: אֹהֵ֥ב (טהור) [טְהׇר־]לֵ֑ב חֵ֥ן שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו רֵעֵ֥הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ׃

verses.text_en: The eyes of the LORD watch the wise man; He subverts the words of the treacherous.
verses.text_he: עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה נָ֣צְרוּ דָ֑עַת וַ֝יְסַלֵּ֗ף דִּבְרֵ֥י בֹגֵֽד׃

verses.text_en: The lazy man says, “There’s a lion in the street; I shall be killed if I step outside.”
verses.text_he: אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל אֲרִ֣י בַח֑וּץ בְּת֥וֹךְ רְ֝חֹב֗וֹת אֵרָצֵֽחַ׃

verses.text_en: The mouth of a forbidden woman is a deep pit; He who is doomed by the LORD falls into it.
verses.text_he: שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲ֭מֻקָּה פִּ֣י זָר֑וֹת זְע֥וּם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה (יפול) [יִפׇּל־]שָֽׁם׃

verses.text_en: If folly settles in the heart of a lad, The rod of discipline will remove it.
verses.text_he: אִ֭וֶּלֶת קְשׁוּרָ֣ה בְלֶב־נָ֑עַר שֵׁ֥בֶט מ֝וּסָ֗ר יַרְחִיקֶ֥נָּה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: To profit by withholding what is due to the poor Is like making gifts to the rich—pure loss.
verses.text_he: עֹ֣שֵֽׁק דָּ֭ל לְהַרְבּ֣וֹת ל֑וֹ נֹתֵ֥ן לְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃

verses.text_en: Incline your ear and listen to the words of the sages; Pay attention to my wisdom.
verses.text_he: הַ֥ט אׇזְנְךָ֗ וּ֭שְׁמַע דִּבְרֵ֣י חֲכָמִ֑ים וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ תָּשִׁ֥ית לְדַעְתִּֽי׃

verses.text_en: It is good that you store them inside you, And that all of them be constantly on your lips,
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־נָ֭עִים כִּֽי־תִשְׁמְרֵ֣ם בְּבִטְנֶ֑ךָ יִכֹּ֥נוּ יַ֝חְדָּ֗ו עַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: That you may put your trust in the LORD. I let you know today—yes, you—
verses.text_he: לִֽהְי֣וֹת בַּ֭יהֹוָה מִבְטַחֶ֑ךָ הוֹדַעְתִּ֖יךָ הַיּ֣וֹם אַף־אָֽתָּה׃

verses.text_en: Indeed, I wrote down for you a threefold lore, Wise counsel,
verses.text_he: הֲלֹ֤א כָתַ֣בְתִּֽי לְ֭ךָ (שלשום) [שָׁלִישִׁ֑ים] בְּמֹ֖עֵצ֣וֹת וָדָֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: To let you know truly reliable words, That you may give a faithful reply to him who sent you.
verses.text_he: לְהֽוֹדִיעֲךָ֗ קֹ֭שְׁטְ אִמְרֵ֣י אֱמֶ֑ת לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֲמָרִ֥ים אֱ֝מֶ֗ת לְשֹׁלְחֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: Do not rob the wretched because he is wretched; Do not crush the poor man in the gate;
verses.text_he: אַֽל־תִּגְזׇל־דָּ֭ל כִּ֣י דַל־ה֑וּא וְאַל־תְּדַכֵּ֖א עָנִ֣י בַשָּֽׁעַר׃

verses.text_en: For the LORD will take up their cause And despoil those who despoil them of life.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־יְ֭הֹוָה יָרִ֣יב רִיבָ֑ם וְקָבַ֖ע אֶת־קֹבְעֵיהֶ֣ם נָֽפֶשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Do not associate with an irascible man, Or go about with one who is hot-tempered,
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּ֭תְרַע אֶת־בַּ֣עַל אָ֑ף וְאֶת־אִ֥ישׁ חֵ֝מ֗וֹת לֹ֣א תָבֽוֹא׃

verses.text_en: Lest you learn his ways And find yourself ensnared.
verses.text_he: פֶּן־תֶּאֱלַ֥ף אֹרְחֹתָ֑ו וְלָקַחְתָּ֖ מוֹקֵ֣שׁ לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃

verses.text_en: Do not be one of those who give their hand, Who stand surety for debts,
verses.text_he: אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְתֹֽקְעֵי־כָ֑ף בַּ֝עֹרְבִ֗ים מַשָּׁאֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: Lest your bed be taken from under you When you have no money to pay.
verses.text_he: אִם־אֵֽין־לְךָ֥ לְשַׁלֵּ֑ם לָ֥מָּה יִקַּ֥ח מִ֝שְׁכָּבְךָ֗ מִתַּחְתֶּֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: Do not remove the ancient boundary stone That your ancestors set up.
verses.text_he: אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֲבוֹתֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: See a man skilled at his work— He shall attend upon kings; He shall not attend upon obscure men.
verses.text_he: חָזִ֡יתָ אִ֤ישׁ׀ מָ֘הִ֤יר בִּמְלַאכְתּ֗וֹ לִֽפְנֵי־מְלָכִ֥ים יִתְיַצָּ֑ב בַּל־יִ֝תְיַצֵּ֗ב לִפְנֵ֥י חֲשֻׁכִּֽים׃{פ}

verses.text_en: When you sit down to dine with a ruler, Consider well who is before you.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־תֵ֭שֵׁב לִלְח֣וֹם אֶת־מוֹשֵׁ֑ל בִּ֥ין תָּ֝בִ֗ין אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: Thrust a knife into your gullet If you have a large appetite.
verses.text_he: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ שַׂכִּ֣ין בְּלֹעֶ֑ךָ אִם־בַּ֖עַל נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָֽתָּה׃

verses.text_en: Do not crave for his dainties, For they are counterfeit food.
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּ֭תְאָו לְמַטְעַמּוֹתָ֑יו וְ֝ה֗וּא לֶ֣חֶם כְּזָבִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Do not toil to gain wealth; Have the sense to desist.
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּיגַ֥ע לְֽהַעֲשִׁ֑יר מִֽבִּינָתְךָ֥ חֲדָֽל׃

verses.text_en: You see it, then it is gone; It grows wings and flies away, Like an eagle, heavenward.
verses.text_he: (התעוף) [הֲתָ֤עִיף]־עֵינֶ֥יךָ בּ֗וֹ וְֽאֵ֫ינֶ֥נּוּ כִּ֤י עָשֹׂ֣ה יַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ כְנָפַ֑יִם כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר (ועיף) [יָע֥וּף] הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Do not eat of a stingy man’s food; Do not crave for his dainties;
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּלְחַ֗ם אֶת־לֶ֭חֶם רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְאַל־תִּ֝תְאָ֗ו לְמַטְעַמֹּתָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: He is like one keeping accounts; “Eat and drink,” he says to you, But he does not really mean it.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י׀ כְּמ֥וֹ שָׁעַ֥ר בְּנַפְשׁ֗וֹ כֶּ֫ן־ה֥וּא אֱכ֣וֹל וּ֭שְׁתֵה יֹ֣אמַר לָ֑ךְ וְ֝לִבּ֗וֹ בַּל־עִמָּֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: The morsel you eat you will vomit; You will waste your courteous words.
verses.text_he: פִּֽתְּךָ־אָכַ֥לְתָּ תְקִיאֶ֑נָּה וְ֝שִׁחַ֗תָּ דְּבָרֶ֥יךָ הַנְּעִימִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Do not speak to a dullard, For he will disdain your sensible words.
verses.text_he: בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל אַל־תְּדַבֵּ֑ר כִּי־יָ֝ב֗וּז לְשֵׂ֣כֶל מִלֶּֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: Do not remove ancient boundary stones; Do not encroach upon the field of orphans,
verses.text_he: אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם וּבִשְׂדֵ֥י יְ֝תוֹמִ֗ים אַל־תָּבֹֽא׃

verses.text_en: For they have a mighty Kinsman, And He will surely take up their cause with you.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־גֹאֲלָ֥ם חָזָ֑ק הֽוּא־יָרִ֖יב אֶת־רִיבָ֣ם אִתָּֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: Apply your mind to discipline And your ears to wise sayings.
verses.text_he: הָבִ֣יאָה לַמּוּסָ֣ר לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝אׇזְנֶ֗ךָ לְאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: Do not withhold discipline from a child; If you beat him with a rod he will not die.
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּמְנַ֣ע מִנַּ֣עַר מוּסָ֑ר כִּֽי־תַכֶּ֥נּוּ בַ֝שֵּׁ֗בֶט לֹ֣א יָמֽוּת׃

verses.text_en: Beat him with a rod And you will save him from the grave.
verses.text_he: אַ֭תָּה בַּשֵּׁ֣בֶט תַּכֶּ֑נּוּ וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ מִשְּׁא֥וֹל תַּצִּֽיל׃

verses.text_en: My son, if your mind gets wisdom, My mind, too, will be gladdened.
verses.text_he: בְּ֭נִי אִם־חָכַ֣ם לִבֶּ֑ךָ יִשְׂמַ֖ח לִבִּ֣י גַם־אָֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: I shall rejoice with all my heart When your lips speak right things.
verses.text_he: וְתַעְלֹ֥זְנָה כִלְיוֹתָ֑י בְּדַבֵּ֥ר שְׂ֝פָתֶ֗יךָ מֵישָׁרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Do not envy sinners in your heart, But only God-fearing men, at all times,
verses.text_he: אַל־יְקַנֵּ֣א לִ֭בְּךָ בַּחַטָּאִ֑ים כִּ֥י אִם־בְּיִרְאַת־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃

verses.text_en: For then you will have a future, And your hope will never fail.
verses.text_he: כִּ֭י אִם־יֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃

verses.text_en: Listen, my son, and get wisdom; Lead your mind in a [proper] path.
verses.text_he: שְׁמַע־אַתָּ֣ה בְנִ֣י וַחֲכָ֑ם וְאַשֵּׁ֖ר בַּדֶּ֣רֶךְ לִבֶּֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Do not be of those who guzzle wine, Or glut themselves on meat;
verses.text_he: אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְסֹֽבְאֵי־יָ֑יִן בְּזֹלְלֵ֖י בָשָׂ֣ר לָֽמוֹ׃

verses.text_en: For guzzlers and gluttons will be impoverished, And drowsing will clothe you in tatters.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־סֹבֵ֣א וְ֭זוֹלֵל יִוָּרֵ֑שׁ וּ֝קְרָעִ֗ים תַּלְבִּ֥ישׁ נוּמָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Listen to your father who begot you; Do not disdain your mother when she is old.
verses.text_he: שְׁמַ֣ע לְ֭אָבִיךָ זֶ֣ה יְלָדֶ֑ךָ וְאַל־תָּ֝ב֗וּז כִּֽי־זָקְנָ֥ה אִמֶּֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Buy truth and never sell it, And wisdom, discipline, and understanding.
verses.text_he: אֱמֶ֣ת קְ֭נֵה וְאַל־תִּמְכֹּ֑ר חׇכְמָ֖ה וּמוּסָ֣ר וּבִינָֽה׃

verses.text_en: The father of a righteous man will exult; He who begets a wise son will rejoice in him.
verses.text_he: (גול) [גִּ֣יל] יָ֭גִיל אֲבִ֣י צַדִּ֑יק (יולד) [וְיוֹלֵ֥ד] חָ֝כָ֗ם (וישמח) [יִשְׂמַח־]בּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Your father and mother will rejoice; She who bore you will exult.
verses.text_he: יִֽשְׂמַח־אָבִ֥יךָ וְאִמֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝תָגֵ֗ל יוֹלַדְתֶּֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Give your mind to me, my son; Let your eyes watch my ways.
verses.text_he: תְּנָה־בְנִ֣י לִבְּךָ֣ לִ֑י וְ֝עֵינֶ֗יךָ דְּרָכַ֥י (תרצנה) [תִּצֹּֽרְנָה]׃

verses.text_en: A harlot is a deep pit; A forbidden woman is a narrow well.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲמֻקָּ֣ה זוֹנָ֑ה וּבְאֵ֥ר צָ֝רָ֗ה נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: She too lies in wait as if for prey, And destroys the unfaithful among men.
verses.text_he: אַף־הִ֭יא כְּחֶ֣תֶף תֶּאֱרֹ֑ב וּ֝בוֹגְדִ֗ים בְּאָדָ֥ם תּוֹסִֽף׃

verses.text_en: Who cries, “Woe!” who, “Alas!”; Who has quarrels, who complaints; Who has wounds without cause; Who has bleary eyes?
verses.text_he: לְמִ֨י א֥וֹי לְמִ֪י אֲב֡וֹי לְמִ֤י (מדונים) [מִדְיָנִ֨ים׀] לְמִ֥י שִׂ֗יחַ לְ֭מִי פְּצָעִ֣ים חִנָּ֑ם לְ֝מִ֗י חַכְלִל֥וּת עֵינָֽיִם׃

verses.text_en: Those whom wine keeps till the small hours, Those who gather to drain the cups.
verses.text_he: לַֽמְאַחֲרִ֥ים עַל־הַיָּ֑יִן לַ֝בָּאִ֗ים לַחְקֹ֥ר מִמְסָֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: Do not ogle that red wine As it lends its color to the cup, As it flows on smoothly;
verses.text_he: אַל־תֵּ֥רֶא יַּיִן֮ כִּ֤י יִתְאַ֫דָּ֥ם כִּֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן (בכיס) [בַּכּ֣וֹס] עֵינ֑וֹ יִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בְּמֵֽישָׁרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: In the end, it bites like a snake; It spits like a basilisk.
verses.text_he: אַ֭חֲרִיתוֹ כְּנָחָ֣שׁ יִשָּׁ֑ךְ וּֽכְצִפְעֹנִ֥י יַפְרִֽשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Your eyes will see strange sights; Your heart will speak distorted things.
verses.text_he: עֵ֭ינֶיךָ יִרְא֣וּ זָר֑וֹת וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ יְדַבֵּ֥ר תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: You will be like one lying in bed on high seas, Like one lying on top of the rigging.
verses.text_he: וְ֭הָיִיתָ כְּשֹׁכֵ֣ב בְּלֶב־יָ֑ם וּ֝כְשֹׁכֵ֗ב בְּרֹ֣אשׁ חִבֵּֽל׃

verses.text_en: “They struck me, but I felt no hurt; They beat me, but I was unaware; As often as I wake, I go after it again.”
verses.text_he: הִכּ֥וּנִי בַל־חָלִיתִי֮ הֲלָמ֗וּנִי בַּל־יָ֫דָ֥עְתִּי מָתַ֥י אָקִ֑יץ א֝וֹסִ֗יף אֲבַקְשֶׁ֥נּוּ עֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: Do not envy evil men; Do not desire to be with them;
verses.text_he: אַל־תְּ֭קַנֵּא בְּאַנְשֵׁ֣י רָעָ֑ה וְאַל־תִּ֝תְאָ֗ו לִֽהְי֥וֹת אִתָּֽם׃

verses.text_en: For their hearts talk violence, And their lips speak mischief.
verses.text_he: כִּי־שֹׁ֭ד יֶהְגֶּ֣ה לִבָּ֑ם וְ֝עָמָ֗ל שִׂפְתֵיהֶ֥ם תְּדַבֵּֽרְנָה׃

verses.text_en: A house is built by wisdom, And is established by understanding;
verses.text_he: בְּ֭חׇכְמָה יִבָּ֣נֶה בָּ֑יִת וּ֝בִתְבוּנָ֗ה יִתְכּוֹנָֽן׃

verses.text_en: By knowledge are its rooms filled With all precious and beautiful things.
verses.text_he: וּ֭בְדַעַת חֲדָרִ֣ים יִמָּלְא֑וּ כׇּל־ה֖וֹן יָקָ֣ר וְנָעִֽים׃

verses.text_en: A wise man is strength; A knowledgeable man exerts power;
verses.text_he: גֶּבֶר־חָכָ֥ם בַּע֑וֹז וְאִֽישׁ־דַּ֝֗עַת מְאַמֶּץ־כֹּֽחַ׃

verses.text_en: For by stratagems you wage war, And victory comes with much planning.
verses.text_he: כִּ֣י בְ֭תַחְבֻּלוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֣ מִלְחָמָ֑ה וּ֝תְשׁוּעָ֗ה בְּרֹ֣ב יוֹעֵֽץ׃

verses.text_en: Wisdom is too lofty for a fool; He does not open his mouth in the gate.
verses.text_he: רָאמ֣וֹת לֶאֱוִ֣יל חׇכְמ֑וֹת בַּ֝שַּׁ֗עַר לֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּֽיהוּ׃

verses.text_en: He who lays plans to do harm Is called by men a schemer.
verses.text_he: מְחַשֵּׁ֥ב לְהָרֵ֑עַ ל֝֗וֹ בַּעַל־מְזִמּ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽאוּ׃

verses.text_en: The schemes of folly are sin, And a scoffer is an abomination to men.
verses.text_he: זִמַּ֣ת אִוֶּ֣לֶת חַטָּ֑את וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת לְאָדָ֣ם לֵֽץ׃

verses.text_en: If you showed yourself slack in time of trouble, Wanting in power,
verses.text_he: הִ֭תְרַפִּיתָ בְּי֥וֹם צָרָ֗ה צַ֣ר כֹּחֶֽכָה׃

verses.text_en: If you refrained from rescuing those taken off to death, Those condemned to slaughter—
verses.text_he: הַ֭צֵּל לְקֻחִ֣ים לַמָּ֑וֶת וּמָטִ֥ים לַ֝הֶ֗רֶג אִם־תַּחְשֽׂוֹךְ׃

verses.text_en: If you say, “We knew nothing of it,” Surely He who fathoms hearts will discern [the truth], He who watches over your life will know it, And He will pay each man as he deserves.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־תֹאמַ֗ר הֵן֮ לֹא־יָדַ֢עְנ֫וּ זֶ֥ה הֲֽלֹא־תֹ֘כֵ֤ן לִבּ֨וֹת׀ הֽוּא־יָבִ֗ין וְנֹצֵ֣ר נַ֭פְשְׁךָ ה֣וּא יֵדָ֑ע וְהֵשִׁ֖יב לְאָדָ֣ם כְּפׇעֳלֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: My son, eat honey, for it is good; Let its sweet drops be on your palate.
verses.text_he: אֱכׇל־בְּנִ֣י דְבַ֣שׁ כִּי־ט֑וֹב וְנֹ֥פֶת מָ֝ת֗וֹק עַל־חִכֶּֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Know: such is wisdom for your soul; If you attain it, there is a future; Your hope will not be cut off.
verses.text_he: כֵּ֤ן׀ דְּעֶ֥ה חׇכְמָ֗ה לְנַ֫פְשֶׁ֥ךָ אִם־מָ֭צָאתָ וְיֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Wicked man! Do not lurk by the home of the righteous man; Do no violence to his dwelling.
verses.text_he: אַל־תֶּאֱרֹ֣ב רָ֭שָׁע לִנְוֵ֣ה צַדִּ֑יק אַֽל־תְּשַׁדֵּ֥ד רִבְצֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Seven times the righteous man falls and gets up, While the wicked are tripped by one misfortune.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י שֶׁ֨בַע׀ יִפּ֣וֹל צַדִּ֣יק וָקָ֑ם וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים יִכָּשְׁל֥וּ בְרָעָֽה׃

verses.text_en: If your enemy falls, do not exult; If he trips, let your heart not rejoice,
verses.text_he: בִּנְפֹ֣ל (אויביך) [א֭וֹיִבְךָ] אַל־תִּשְׂמָ֑ח וּ֝בִכָּשְׁל֗וֹ אַל־יָגֵ֥ל לִבֶּֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Lest the LORD see it and be displeased, And avert His wrath from him.
verses.text_he: פֶּן־יִרְאֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה וְרַ֣ע בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְהֵשִׁ֖יב מֵעָלָ֣יו אַפּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Do not be vexed by evildoers; Do not be incensed by the wicked;
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּתְחַ֥ר בַּמְּרֵעִ֑ים אַל־תְּ֝קַנֵּ֗א בָּֽרְשָׁעִֽים׃

verses.text_en: For there is no future for the evil man; The lamp of the wicked goes out.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י׀ לֹא־תִהְיֶ֣ה אַחֲרִ֣ית לָרָ֑ע נֵ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: Fear the LORD, my son, and the king, And do not mix with dissenters,
verses.text_he: יְרָא־אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּנִ֣י וָמֶ֑לֶךְ עִם־שׁ֝וֹנִ֗ים אַל־תִּתְעָרָֽב׃

verses.text_en: For disaster comes from them suddenly; The doom both decree who can foreknow?
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־פִ֭תְאֹם יָק֣וּם אֵידָ֑ם וּפִ֥יד שְׁ֝נֵיהֶ֗ם מִ֣י יוֹדֵֽעַ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: These also are by the sages: It is not right to be partial in judgment.
verses.text_he: גַּם־אֵ֥לֶּה לַחֲכָמִ֑ים הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֖ים בְּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט בַּל־טֽוֹב׃

verses.text_en: He who says to the guilty, “You are innocent,” Shall be cursed by peoples, Damned by nations;
verses.text_he: אֹ֤מֵ֨ר׀ לְרָשָׁע֮ צַדִּ֢יק אָ֥֫תָּה יִקְּבֻ֥הוּ עַמִּ֑ים יִזְעָמ֥וּהוּ לְאֻמִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: But it shall go well with them who decide justly; Blessings of good things will light upon them.
verses.text_he: וְלַמּוֹכִיחִ֥ים יִנְעָ֑ם וַ֝עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם תָּב֥וֹא בִרְכַּת־טֽוֹב׃

verses.text_en: Giving a straightforward reply Is like giving a kiss.
verses.text_he: שְׂפָתַ֥יִם יִשָּׁ֑ק מֵ֝שִׁ֗יב דְּבָרִ֥ים נְכֹחִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Put your external affairs in order, Get ready what you have in the field, Then build yourself a home.
verses.text_he: הָ֘כֵ֤ן בַּח֨וּץ׀ מְלַאכְתֶּ֗ךָ וְעַתְּדָ֣הּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֣ה לָ֑ךְ אַ֝חַ֗ר וּבָנִ֥יתָ בֵיתֶֽךָ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Do not be a witness against your fellow without good cause; Would you mislead with your speech?
verses.text_he: אַל־תְּהִ֣י עֵד־חִנָּ֣ם בְּרֵעֶ֑ךָ וַ֝הֲפִתִּ֗יתָ בִּשְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: Do not say, “I will do to him what he did to me; I will pay the man what he deserves.”
verses.text_he: אַל־תֹּאמַ֗ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָֽשָׂה־לִ֭י כֵּ֤ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לּ֑וֹ אָשִׁ֖יב לָאִ֣ישׁ כְּפׇעֳלֽוֹ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: I passed by the field of a lazy man, By the vineyard of a man lacking sense.
verses.text_he: עַל־שְׂדֵ֣ה אִישׁ־עָצֵ֣ל עָבַ֑רְתִּי וְעַל־כֶּ֝֗רֶם אָדָ֥ם חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃

verses.text_en: It was all overgrown with thorns; Its surface was covered with chickweed, And its stone fence lay in ruins.
verses.text_he: וְהִנֵּ֨ה עָ֘לָ֤ה כֻלּ֨וֹ׀ קִמְּשֹׂנִ֗ים כׇּסּ֣וּ פָנָ֣יו חֲרֻלִּ֑ים וְגֶ֖דֶר אֲבָנָ֣יו נֶהֱרָֽסָה׃

verses.text_en: I observed and took it to heart; I saw it and learned a lesson.
verses.text_he: וָאֶחֱזֶ֣ה אָ֭נֹכִי אָשִׁ֣ית לִבִּ֑י רָ֝אִ֗יתִי לָקַ֥חְתִּי מוּסָֽר׃

verses.text_en: A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber, A bit more hugging yourself in bed,
verses.text_he: מְעַ֣ט שֵׁ֭נוֹת מְעַ֣ט תְּנוּמ֑וֹת מְעַ֓ט׀ חִבֻּ֖ק יָדַ֣יִם לִשְׁכָּֽב׃

verses.text_en: And poverty will come calling upon you, And want, like a man with a shield.
verses.text_he: וּבָֽא־מִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ רֵישֶׁ֑ךָ וּ֝מַחְסֹרֶ֗יךָ כְּאִ֣ישׁ מָגֵֽן׃{פ}

verses.text_en: These too are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of King Hezekiah of Judah copied:
verses.text_he: גַּם־אֵ֭לֶּה מִשְׁלֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶ֝עְתִּ֗יקוּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י׀ חִזְקִיָּ֬ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃

verses.text_en: It is the glory of God to conceal a matter, And the glory of a king to plumb a matter.
verses.text_he: כְּבֹ֣ד אֱ֭לֹהִים הַסְתֵּ֣ר דָּבָ֑ר וּכְבֹ֥ד מְ֝לָכִ֗ים חֲקֹ֣ר דָּבָֽר׃

verses.text_en: Like the heavens in their height, like the earth in its depth, Is the mind of kings—unfathomable.
verses.text_he: שָׁמַ֣יִם לָ֭רוּם וָאָ֣רֶץ לָעֹ֑מֶק וְלֵ֥ב מְ֝לָכִ֗ים אֵ֣ין חֵֽקֶר׃

verses.text_en: The dross having been separated from the silver, A vessel emerged for the smith.
verses.text_he: הָג֣וֹ סִיגִ֣ים מִכָּ֑סֶף וַיֵּצֵ֖א לַצֹּרֵ֣ף כֶּֽלִי׃

verses.text_en: Remove the wicked from the king’s presence, And his throne will be established in justice.
verses.text_he: הָג֣וֹ רָ֭שָׁע לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְיִכּ֖וֹן בַּצֶּ֣דֶק כִּסְאֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Do not exalt yourself in the king’s presence; Do not stand in the place of nobles.
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּתְהַדַּ֥ר לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבִמְק֥וֹם גְּ֝דֹלִ֗ים אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹֽד׃

verses.text_en: For it is better to be told, “Step up here,” Than to be degraded in the presence of the great. Do not let what your eyes have seen
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י ט֥וֹב אֲמׇר־לְךָ֗ עֲֽלֵ֫ה־הֵ֥נָּה מֵ֭הַשְׁפִּ֣ילְךָ לִפְנֵ֣י נָדִ֑יב אֲשֶׁ֖ר רָא֣וּ עֵינֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: Be vented rashly in a quarrel; Think of what it will effect in the end, When your fellow puts you to shame.
verses.text_he: אַל־תֵּצֵ֥א לָרִ֗ב מַ֫הֵ֥ר פֶּ֣ן מַה־תַּ֭עֲשֶׂה בְּאַחֲרִיתָ֑הּ בְּהַכְלִ֖ים אֹתְךָ֣ רֵעֶֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Defend your right against your fellow, But do not give away the secrets of another,
verses.text_he: רִ֭יבְךָ רִ֣יב אֶת־רֵעֶ֑ךָ וְס֖וֹד אַחֵ֣ר אַל־תְּגָֽל׃

verses.text_en: Lest he who hears it reproach you, And your bad repute never end.
verses.text_he: פֶּֽן־יְחַסֶּדְךָ֥ שֹׁמֵ֑עַ וְ֝דִבָּתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תָשֽׁוּב׃

verses.text_en: Like golden apples in silver showpieces Is a phrase well turned.
verses.text_he: תַּפּוּחֵ֣י זָ֭הָב בְּמַשְׂכִּיּ֣וֹת כָּ֑סֶף דָּ֝בָ֗ר דָּבֻ֥ר עַל־אׇפְנָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: Like a ring of gold, a golden ornament, Is a wise man’s reproof in a receptive ear.
verses.text_he: נֶ֣זֶם זָ֭הָב וַחֲלִי־כָ֑תֶם מוֹכִ֥יחַ חָ֝כָ֗ם עַל־אֹ֥זֶן שֹׁמָֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: Like the coldness of snow at harvesttime Is a trusty messenger to those who send him; He lifts his master’s spirits.
verses.text_he: כְּצִנַּת־שֶׁ֨לֶג׀ בְּי֬וֹם קָצִ֗יר צִ֣יר נֶ֭אֱמָן לְשֹׁלְחָ֑יו וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ אֲדֹנָ֣יו יָשִֽׁיב׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Like clouds, wind—but no rain— Is one who boasts of gifts not given.
verses.text_he: נְשִׂיאִ֣ים וְ֭רוּחַ וְגֶ֣שֶׁם אָ֑יִן אִ֥ישׁ מִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ל בְּמַתַּת־שָֽׁקֶר׃

verses.text_en: Through forbearance a ruler may be won over; A gentle tongue can break bones.
verses.text_he: בְּאֹ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם יְפֻתֶּ֣ה קָצִ֑ין וְלָשׁ֥וֹן רַ֝כָּ֗ה תִּשְׁבׇּר־גָּֽרֶם׃

verses.text_en: If you find honey, eat only what you need, Lest, surfeiting yourself, you throw it up.
verses.text_he: דְּבַ֣שׁ מָ֭צָאתָ אֱכֹ֣ל דַּיֶּ֑ךָּ פֶּן־תִּ֝שְׂבָּעֶ֗נּוּ וַהֲקֵאתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Visit your neighbor sparingly, Lest he have his surfeit of you and loathe you.
verses.text_he: הֹקַ֣ר רַ֭גְלְךָ מִבֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ פֶּן־יִ֝שְׂבָּעֲךָ֗ וּשְׂנֵאֶֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Like a club, a sword, a sharpened arrow, Is a man who testifies falsely against his fellow.
verses.text_he: מֵפִ֣יץ וְ֭חֶרֶב וְחֵ֣ץ שָׁנ֑וּן אִ֥ישׁ עֹנֶ֥ה בְ֝רֵעֵ֗הוּ עֵ֣ד שָֽׁקֶר׃

verses.text_en: Like a loose tooth and an unsteady leg, Is a treacherous support in time of trouble.
verses.text_he: שֵׁ֣ן רֹ֭עָה וְרֶ֣גֶל מוּעָ֑דֶת מִבְטָ֥ח בּ֝וֹגֵ֗ד בְּי֣וֹם צָרָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Disrobing on a chilly day, Like vinegar on natron, Is one who sings songs to a sorrowful soul.
verses.text_he: מַ֥עֲדֶה־בֶּ֨גֶד׀ בְּי֣וֹם קָ֭רָה חֹ֣מֶץ עַל־נָ֑תֶר וְשָׁ֥ר בַּ֝שִּׁרִ֗ים עַ֣ל לֶב־רָֽע׃{פ}

verses.text_en: If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat; If he is thirsty, give him water to drink.
verses.text_he: אִם־רָעֵ֣ב שֹׂ֭נַאֲךָ הַאֲכִלֵ֣הוּ לָ֑חֶם וְאִם־צָ֝מֵ֗א הַשְׁקֵ֥הוּ מָֽיִם׃

verses.text_en: You will be heaping live coals on his head, And the LORD will reward you.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י גֶחָלִ֗ים אַ֭תָּה חֹתֶ֣ה עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה יְשַׁלֶּם־לָֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: A north wind produces rain, And whispered words, a glowering face.
verses.text_he: ר֣וּחַ צָ֭פוֹן תְּח֣וֹלֵֽל גָּ֑שֶׁם וּפָנִ֥ים נִ֝זְעָמִ֗ים לְשׁ֣וֹן סָֽתֶר׃

verses.text_en: Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better Than a contentious woman in a spacious house.
verses.text_he: ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃

verses.text_en: Like cold water to a parched throat Is good news from a distant land.
verses.text_he: מַ֣יִם קָ֭רִים עַל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ עֲיֵפָ֑ה וּשְׁמוּעָ֥ה ט֝וֹבָ֗ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מֶרְחָֽק׃

verses.text_en: Like a muddied spring, a ruined fountain, Is a righteous man fallen before a wicked one.
verses.text_he: מַעְיָ֣ן נִ֭רְפָּשׂ וּמָק֣וֹר מׇשְׁחָ֑ת צַ֝דִּ֗יק מָ֣ט לִפְנֵֽי־רָשָֽׁע׃

verses.text_en: It is not good to eat much honey, Nor is it honorable to search for honor.
verses.text_he: אָ֘כֹ֤ל דְּבַ֣שׁ הַרְבּ֣וֹת לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְחֵ֖קֶר כְּבֹדָ֣ם כָּבֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: Like an open city without walls Is a man whose temper is uncurbed.
verses.text_he: עִ֣יר פְּ֭רוּצָה אֵ֣ין חוֹמָ֑ה אִ֝֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵ֖ין מַעְצָ֣ר לְרוּחֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Like snow in summer and rain at harvesttime, So honor is not fitting for a dullard.
verses.text_he: כַּשֶּׁ֤לֶג׀ בַּקַּ֗יִץ וְכַמָּטָ֥ר בַּקָּצִ֑יר כֵּ֤ן לֹֽא־נָאוֶ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: As a sparrow must flit and a swallow fly, So a gratuitous curse must backfire.
verses.text_he: כַּצִּפּ֣וֹר לָ֭נוּד כַּדְּר֣וֹר לָע֑וּף כֵּ֥ן קִֽלְלַ֥ת חִ֝נָּ֗ם (לא) [ל֣וֹ] תָבֹֽא׃

verses.text_en: A whip for a horse and a bridle for a donkey, And a rod for the back of dullards.
verses.text_he: שׁ֣וֹט לַ֭סּוּס מֶ֣תֶג לַחֲמ֑וֹר וְ֝שֵׁ֗בֶט לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Do not answer a dullard in accord with his folly, Else you will become like him.
verses.text_he: אַל־תַּ֣עַן כְּ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּֽן־תִּשְׁוֶה־לּ֥וֹ גַם־אָֽתָּה׃

verses.text_en: Answer a dullard in accord with his folly, Else he will think himself wise.
verses.text_he: עֲנֵ֣ה כְ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֖ה חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: He who sends a message by a dullard Will wear out legs and must put up with lawlessness.
verses.text_he: מְקַצֶּ֣ה רַ֭גְלַיִם חָמָ֣ס שֹׁתֶ֑ה שֹׁלֵ֖חַ דְּבָרִ֣ים בְּיַד־כְּסִֽיל׃

verses.text_en: As legs hang limp on a cripple, So is a proverb in the mouth of dullards.
verses.text_he: דַּלְי֣וּ שֹׁ֭קַיִם מִפִּסֵּ֑חַ וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Like a pebble in a sling, So is paying honor to a dullard.
verses.text_he: כִּצְר֣וֹר אֶ֭בֶן בְּמַרְגֵּמָ֑ה כֵּן־נוֹתֵ֖ן לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: As a thorn comes to the hand of a drunkard, So a proverb to the mouth of a dullard.
verses.text_he: ח֭וֹחַ עָלָ֣ה בְיַד־שִׁכּ֑וֹר וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃

verses.text_en: A master can produce anything, But he who hires a dullard is as one who hires transients.
verses.text_he: רַ֥ב מְחוֹלֵֽל־כֹּ֑ל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר כְּ֝סִ֗יל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר עֹבְרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: As a dog returns to his vomit, So a dullard repeats his folly.
verses.text_he: כְּ֭כֶלֶב שָׁ֣ב עַל־קֵא֑וֹ כְּ֝סִ֗יל שׁוֹנֶ֥ה בְאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: If you see a man who thinks himself wise, There is more hope for a dullard than for him.
verses.text_he: רָאִ֗יתָ אִ֭ישׁ חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָ֑יו תִּקְוָ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: A lazy man says, “There’s a cub on the road, a lion in the squares.”
verses.text_he: אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל שַׁ֣חַל בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ אֲ֝רִ֗י בֵּ֣ין הָרְחֹבֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: The door turns on its hinge, And the lazy man on his bed.
verses.text_he: הַ֭דֶּלֶת תִּסּ֣וֹב עַל־צִירָ֑הּ וְ֝עָצֵ֗ל עַל־מִטָּתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl; He will not even bring it to his mouth.
verses.text_he: טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת נִ֝לְאָ֗ה לַהֲשִׁיבָ֥הּ אֶל־פִּֽיו׃

verses.text_en: The lazy man thinks himself wiser Than seven men who give good advice.
verses.text_he: חָכָ֣ם עָצֵ֣ל בְּעֵינָ֑יו מִ֝שִּׁבְעָ֗ה מְשִׁ֣יבֵי טָֽעַם׃

verses.text_en: A passerby who gets embroiled in someone else’s quarrel Is like one who seizes a dog by its ears.
verses.text_he: מַחֲזִ֥יק בְּאׇזְנֵי־כָ֑לֶב עֹבֵ֥ר מִ֝תְעַבֵּ֗ר עַל־רִ֥יב לֹּא־לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Like a madman scattering deadly firebrands, arrows,
verses.text_he: כְּֽ֭מִתְלַהְלֵהַּ הַיֹּרֶ֥ה זִקִּ֗ים חִצִּ֥ים וָמָֽוֶת׃

verses.text_en: Is one who cheats his fellow and says, “I was only joking.”
verses.text_he: כֵּֽן־אִ֭ישׁ רִמָּ֣ה אֶת־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אָמַ֗ר הֲֽלֹא־מְשַׂחֵ֥ק אָֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: For lack of wood a fire goes out, And without a querulous man contention is stilled.
verses.text_he: בְּאֶ֣פֶס עֵ֭צִים תִּכְבֶּה־אֵ֑שׁ וּבְאֵ֥ין נִ֝רְגָּ֗ן יִשְׁתֹּ֥ק מָדֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: Charcoal for embers and wood for a fire And a contentious man for kindling strife.
verses.text_he: פֶּחָ֣ם לְ֭גֶחָלִים וְעֵצִ֣ים לְאֵ֑שׁ וְאִ֥ישׁ (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] לְחַרְחַר־רִֽיב׃{פ}

verses.text_en: The words of a querulous man are bruising; They penetrate one’s inmost parts.
verses.text_he: דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃

verses.text_en: Base silver laid over earthenware Are ardent lips with an evil mind.
verses.text_he: כֶּ֣סֶף סִ֭יגִים מְצֻפֶּ֣ה עַל־חָ֑רֶשׂ שְׂפָתַ֖יִם דֹּלְקִ֣ים וְלֶב־רָֽע׃

verses.text_en: An enemy dissembles with his speech, Inwardly he harbors deceit.
verses.text_he: בִּ֭שְׂפָתָו יִנָּכֵ֣ר שׂוֹנֵ֑א וּ֝בְקִרְבּ֗וֹ יָשִׁ֥ית מִרְמָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Though he be fair-spoken do not trust him, For seven abominations are in his mind.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־יְחַנֵּ֣ן ק֭וֹלוֹ אַל־תַּאֲמֶן־בּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י שֶׁ֖בַע תּוֹעֵב֣וֹת בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: His hatred may be concealed by dissimulation, But his evil will be exposed to public view.
verses.text_he: תִּכַּסֶּ֣ה שִׂ֭נְאָה בְּמַשָּׁא֑וֹן תִּגָּלֶ֖ה רָעָת֣וֹ בְקָהָֽל׃

verses.text_en: He who digs a pit will fall in it, And whoever rolls a stone, it will roll back on him.
verses.text_he: כֹּֽרֶה־שַּׁ֭חַת בָּ֣הּ יִפּ֑וֹל וְג֥וֹלֵֽל אֶ֝֗בֶן אֵלָ֥יו תָּשֽׁוּב׃

verses.text_en: A lying tongue hates those crushed by it; Smooth speech throws one down.
verses.text_he: לְֽשׁוֹן־שֶׁ֭קֶר יִשְׂנָ֣א דַכָּ֑יו וּפֶ֥ה חָ֝לָ֗ק יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה מִדְחֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: Do not boast of tomorrow, For you do not know what the day will bring.
verses.text_he: אַֽל־תִּ֭תְהַלֵּל בְּי֣וֹם מָחָ֑ר כִּ֤י לֹֽא־תֵ֝דַ֗ע מַה־יֵּ֥לֶד יֽוֹם׃

verses.text_en: Let the mouth of another praise you, not yours, The lips of a stranger, not your own.
verses.text_he: יְהַלֶּלְךָ֣ זָ֣ר וְלֹא־פִ֑יךָ נׇ֝כְרִ֗י וְאַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: A stone has weight, sand is heavy, But a fool’s vexation outweighs them both.
verses.text_he: כֹּֽבֶד־אֶ֭בֶן וְנֵ֣טֶל הַח֑וֹל וְכַ֥עַס אֱ֝וִ֗יל כָּבֵ֥ד מִשְּׁנֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: There is the cruelty of fury, the overflowing of anger, But who can withstand jealousy?
verses.text_he: אַכְזְרִיּ֣וּת חֵ֭מָה וְשֶׁ֣טֶף אָ֑ף וּמִ֥י יַ֝עֲמֹ֗ד לִפְנֵ֥י קִנְאָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Open reproof is better than concealed love.
verses.text_he: ט֭וֹבָה תּוֹכַ֣חַת מְגֻלָּ֑ה מֵאַהֲבָ֥ה מְסֻתָּֽרֶת׃

verses.text_en: Wounds by a loved one are long lasting; The kisses of an enemy are profuse.
verses.text_he: נֶ֭אֱמָנִים פִּצְעֵ֣י אוֹהֵ֑ב וְ֝נַעְתָּר֗וֹת נְשִׁיק֥וֹת שׂוֹנֵֽא׃

verses.text_en: A sated person disdains honey, But to a hungry man anything bitter seems sweet.
verses.text_he: נֶ֣פֶשׁ שְׂ֭בֵעָה תָּב֣וּס נֹ֑פֶת וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ רְ֝עֵבָ֗ה כׇּל־מַ֥ר מָתֽוֹק׃

verses.text_en: Like a sparrow wandering from its nest Is a man who wanders from his home.
verses.text_he: כְּ֭צִפּוֹר נוֹדֶ֣דֶת מִן־קִנָּ֑הּ כֵּֽן־אִ֝֗ישׁ נוֹדֵ֥ד מִמְּקוֹמֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Oil and incense gladden the heart, And the sweetness of a friend is better than one’s own counsel.
verses.text_he: שֶׁ֣מֶן וּ֭קְטֹרֶת יְשַׂמַּֽח־לֵ֑ב וּמֶ֥תֶק רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ מֵעֲצַת־נָֽפֶשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Do not desert your friend and your father’s friend; Do not enter your brother’s house in your time of misfortune; A close neighbor is better than a distant brother.
verses.text_he: רֵ֥עֲךָ֨ (ורעה) [וְרֵ֪עַ] אָבִ֡יךָ אַֽל־תַּעֲזֹ֗ב וּבֵ֥ית אָחִ֗יךָ אַל־תָּ֭בוֹא בְּי֣וֹם אֵידֶ֑ךָ ט֥וֹב שָׁכֵ֥ן קָ֝ר֗וֹב מֵאָ֥ח רָחֽוֹק׃

verses.text_en: Get wisdom, my son, and gladden my heart, That I may have what to answer those who taunt me.
verses.text_he: חֲכַ֣ם בְּ֭נִי וְשַׂמַּ֣ח לִבִּ֑י וְאָשִׁ֖יבָה חֹרְפִ֣י דָבָֽר׃

verses.text_en: The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover; The simple kept going and paid the penalty.
verses.text_he: עָר֤וּם׀ רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה נִסְתָּ֑ר פְּ֝תָאיִ֗ם עָבְר֥וּ נֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃

verses.text_en: Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another; Take it as a pledge, [for he stood surety] for an unfamiliar woman.
verses.text_he: קַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד נׇכְרִיָּ֣ה חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: He who greets his fellow loudly early in the morning Shall have it reckoned to him as a curse.
verses.text_he: מְבָ֘רֵ֤ךְ רֵעֵ֨הוּ׀ בְּק֣וֹל גָּ֭דוֹל בַּבֹּ֣קֶר הַשְׁכֵּ֑ים קְ֝לָלָ֗ה תֵּחָ֥שֶׁב לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: An endless dripping on a rainy day And a contentious wife are alike;
verses.text_he: דֶּ֣לֶף ט֭וֹרֵד בְּי֣וֹם סַגְרִ֑יר וְאֵ֥שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] נִשְׁתָּוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: As soon repress her as repress the wind, Or declare one’s right hand to be oil.
verses.text_he: צֹפְנֶ֥יהָ צָפַן־ר֑וּחַ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן יְמִינ֣וֹ יִקְרָֽא׃

verses.text_en: As iron sharpens iron So a man sharpens the wit of his friend.
verses.text_he: בַּרְזֶ֣ל בְּבַרְזֶ֣ל יָ֑חַד וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ יַ֣חַד פְּנֵֽי־רֵעֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: He who tends a fig tree will enjoy its fruit, And he who cares for his master will be honored.
verses.text_he: נֹצֵ֣ר תְּ֭אֵנָה יֹאכַ֣ל פִּרְיָ֑הּ וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣יו יְכֻבָּֽד׃

verses.text_en: As face answers to face in water, So does one man’s heart to another.
verses.text_he: כַּ֭מַּיִם הַפָּנִ֣ים לַפָּנִ֑ים כֵּ֤ן לֵֽב־הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לָאָדָֽם׃

verses.text_en: Sheol and Abaddon cannot be satisfied, Nor can the eyes of man be satisfied.
verses.text_he: שְׁא֣וֹל וַ֭אֲבַדֹּה לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּ֑עְנָה וְעֵינֵ֥י הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּֽעְנָה׃

verses.text_en: For silver—the crucible, for gold—the furnace, And a man is tested by his praise.
verses.text_he: מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ לְפִ֣י מַהֲלָלֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Even if you pound the fool in a mortar With a pestle along with grain, His folly will not leave him.
verses.text_he: אִ֥ם־תִּכְתּֽוֹשׁ־אֶת־הָאֱוִ֨יל׀ בַּ֥מַּכְתֵּ֡שׁ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָ֭רִיפוֹת בַּעֱלִ֑י לֹא־תָס֥וּר מֵ֝עָלָ֗יו אִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Mind well the looks of your flock; Pay attention to your herds;
verses.text_he: יָדֹ֣עַ תֵּ֭דַע פְּנֵ֣י צֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁ֥ית לִ֝בְּךָ֗ לַעֲדָרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: For property does not last forever, Or a crown for all generations.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א לְעוֹלָ֣ם חֹ֑סֶן וְאִם־נֵ֝֗זֶר לְד֣וֹר (דור) [וָדֽוֹר]׃

verses.text_en: Grass vanishes, new grass appears, And the herbage of the hills is gathered in.
verses.text_he: גָּלָ֣ה חָ֭צִיר וְנִרְאָה־דֶ֑שֶׁא וְ֝נֶאֶסְפ֗וּ עִשְּׂב֥וֹת הָרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: The lambs will provide you with clothing, The he-goats, the price of a field.
verses.text_he: כְּבָשִׂ֥ים לִלְבוּשֶׁ֑ךָ וּמְחִ֥יר שָׂ֝דֶ֗ה עַתּוּדִֽים׃

verses.text_en: The goats’ milk will suffice for your food, The food of your household, And the maintenance of your maids.
verses.text_he: וְדֵ֤י׀ חֲלֵ֬ב עִזִּ֗ים לְֽ֭לַחְמְךָ לְלֶ֣חֶם בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְ֝חַיִּ֗ים לְנַעֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: The wicked flee though no one gives chase, But the righteous are as confident as a lion.
verses.text_he: נָ֣סוּ וְאֵין־רֹדֵ֣ף רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים כִּכְפִ֥יר יִבְטָֽח׃

verses.text_en: When there is rebellion in the land, many are its rulers; But with a man who has understanding and knowledge, stability will last.
verses.text_he: בְּפֶ֣שַֽׁע אֶ֭רֶץ רַבִּ֣ים שָׂרֶ֑יהָ וּבְאָדָ֥ם מֵבִ֥ין יֹ֝דֵ֗עַ כֵּ֣ן יַאֲרִֽיךְ׃

verses.text_en: A poor man who withholds what is due to the wretched Is like a destructive rain that leaves no food.
verses.text_he: גֶּֽבֶר־רָ֭שׁ וְעֹשֵׁ֣ק דַּלִּ֑ים מָטָ֥ר סֹ֝חֵ֗ף וְאֵ֣ין לָֽחֶם׃

verses.text_en: Those who forsake instruction praise the wicked, But those who heed instruction fight them.
verses.text_he: עֹזְבֵ֣י ת֭וֹרָה יְהַלְל֣וּ רָשָׁ֑ע וְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י ת֝וֹרָ֗ה יִתְגָּ֥רוּ בָֽם׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Evil men cannot discern judgment, But those who seek the LORD discern all things.
verses.text_he: אַנְשֵׁי־רָ֭ע לֹא־יָבִ֣ינוּ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּמְבַקְשֵׁ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יָבִ֥ינוּ כֹֽל׃

verses.text_en: Better is a poor man who lives blamelessly Than a rich man whose ways are crooked.
verses.text_he: טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם וְה֣וּא עָשִֽׁיר׃

verses.text_en: An intelligent son heeds instruction, But he who keeps company with gluttons disgraces his father.
verses.text_he: נוֹצֵ֣ר תּ֭וֹרָה בֵּ֣ן מֵבִ֑ין וְרֹעֶ֥ה ז֝וֹלְלִ֗ים יַכְלִ֥ים אָבִֽיו׃

verses.text_en: He who increases his wealth by loans at discount or interest Amasses it for one who is generous to the poor.
verses.text_he: מַרְבֶּ֣ה ה֭וֹנוֹ בְּנֶ֣שֶׁךְ (ובתרבית) [וְתַרְבִּ֑ית] לְחוֹנֵ֖ן דַּלִּ֣ים יִקְבְּצֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: He who turns a deaf ear to instruction— His prayer is an abomination.
verses.text_he: מֵסִ֣יר אׇ֭זְנוֹ מִשְּׁמֹ֣עַ תּוֹרָ֑ה גַּ֥ם תְּ֝פִלָּת֗וֹ תּוֹעֵבָֽה׃

verses.text_en: He who misleads the upright into an evil course Will fall into his own pit, But the blameless will prosper.
verses.text_he: מַשְׁגֶּ֤ה יְשָׁרִ֨ים׀ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ רָ֗ע בִּשְׁחוּת֥וֹ הֽוּא־יִפּ֑וֹל וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים יִנְחֲלוּ־טֽוֹב׃{פ}

verses.text_en: A rich man is clever in his own eyes, But a perceptive poor man can see through him.
verses.text_he: חָכָ֣ם בְּ֭עֵינָיו אִ֣ישׁ עָשִׁ֑יר וְדַ֖ל מֵבִ֣ין יַחְקְרֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: When the righteous exult there is great glory, But when the wicked rise up men make themselves scarce.
verses.text_he: בַּעֲלֹ֣ץ צַ֭דִּיקִים רַבָּ֣ה תִפְאָ֑רֶת וּבְק֥וּם רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְחֻפַּ֥שׂ אָדָֽם׃

verses.text_en: He who covers up his faults will not succeed; He who confesses and gives them up will find mercy.
verses.text_he: מְכַסֶּ֣ה פְ֭שָׁעָיו לֹ֣א יַצְלִ֑יחַ וּמוֹדֶ֖ה וְעֹזֵ֣ב יְרֻחָֽם׃

verses.text_en: Happy is the man who is anxious always, But he who hardens his heart falls into misfortune.
verses.text_he: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם מְפַחֵ֣ד תָּמִ֑יד וּמַקְשֶׁ֥ה לִ֝בּ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃

verses.text_en: A roaring lion and a prowling bear Is a wicked man ruling a helpless people.
verses.text_he: אֲֽרִי־נֹ֭הֵם וְדֹ֣ב שׁוֹקֵ֑ק מוֹשֵׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע עַ֣ל עַם־דָּֽל׃

verses.text_en: A prince who lacks understanding is very oppressive; He who spurns ill-gotten gains will live long.
verses.text_he: נָגִ֗יד חֲסַ֣ר תְּ֭בוּנוֹת וְרַ֥ב מַעֲשַׁקּ֑וֹת (שנאי) [שֹׂ֥נֵא] בֶ֝֗צַע יַאֲרִ֥יךְ יָמִֽים׃{פ}

verses.text_en: A man oppressed by bloodguilt will flee to a pit; Let none give him support.
verses.text_he: אָ֭דָם עָשֻׁ֣ק בְּדַם־נָ֑פֶשׁ עַד־בּ֥וֹר יָ֝נ֗וּס אַל־יִתְמְכוּ־בֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He who lives blamelessly will be delivered, But he who is crooked in his ways will fall all at once.
verses.text_he: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ תָּ֭מִים יִוָּשֵׁ֑עַ וְנֶעְקַ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם יִפּ֥וֹל בְּאֶחָֽת׃

verses.text_en: He who tills his land will have food in plenty, But he who pursues vanities will have poverty in plenty.
verses.text_he: עֹבֵ֣ד אַ֭דְמָתוֹ יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָ֑חֶם וּמְרַדֵּ֥ף רֵ֝יקִ֗ים יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־רִֽישׁ׃

verses.text_en: A dependable man will receive many blessings, But one in a hurry to get rich will not go unpunished.
verses.text_he: אִ֣ישׁ אֱ֭מוּנוֹת רַב־בְּרָכ֑וֹת וְאָ֥ץ לְ֝הַעֲשִׁ֗יר לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: To be partial is not right; A man may do wrong for a piece of bread.
verses.text_he: הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֥ים לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְעַל־פַּת־לֶ֝֗חֶם יִפְשַׁע־גָּֽבֶר׃

verses.text_en: A miserly man runs after wealth; He does not realize that loss will overtake it.
verses.text_he: נִ֥בְהָֽל־לַה֗וֹן אִ֭ישׁ רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְלֹא־יֵ֝דַ֗ע כִּי־חֶ֥סֶר יְבֹאֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: He who reproves a man will in the end Find more favor than he who flatters him.
verses.text_he: מ֘וֹכִ֤יחַ אָדָ֣ם אַ֭חֲרַי חֵ֣ן יִמְצָ֑א מִֽמַּחֲלִ֥יק לָשֽׁוֹן׃

verses.text_en: He who robs his father and mother and says, “It is no offense,” Is a companion to vandals.
verses.text_he: גּוֹזֵ֤ל׀ אָ֘בִ֤יו וְאִמּ֗וֹ וְאֹמֵ֥ר אֵֽין־פָּ֑שַׁע חָבֵ֥ר ה֝֗וּא לְאִ֣ישׁ מַשְׁחִֽית׃

verses.text_en: A greedy man provokes quarrels, But he who trusts the LORD shall enjoy prosperity.
verses.text_he: רְחַב־נֶ֭פֶשׁ יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וּבֹטֵ֖חַ עַל־יְהֹוָ֣ה יְדֻשָּֽׁן׃

verses.text_en: He who trusts his own instinct is a dullard, But he who lives by wisdom shall escape.
verses.text_he: בּוֹטֵ֣חַ בְּ֭לִבּוֹ ה֣וּא כְסִ֑יל וְהוֹלֵ֥ךְ בְּ֝חׇכְמָ֗ה ה֣וּא יִמָּלֵֽט׃

verses.text_en: He who gives to the poor will not be in want, But he who shuts his eyes will be roundly cursed.
verses.text_he: נוֹתֵ֣ן לָ֭רָשׁ אֵ֣ין מַחְס֑וֹר וּמַעְלִ֥ים עֵ֝ינָ֗יו רַב־מְאֵרֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: When the wicked rise up, men go into hiding, But when they perish the righteous increase.
verses.text_he: בְּק֣וּם רְ֭שָׁעִים יִסָּתֵ֣ר אָדָ֑ם וּ֝בְאׇבְדָ֗ם יִרְבּ֥וּ צַדִּיקִֽים׃

verses.text_en: One oft reproved may become stiffnecked, But he will be suddenly broken beyond repair.
verses.text_he: אִ֣ישׁ תּ֭וֹכָחוֹת מַקְשֶׁה־עֹ֑רֶף פֶּ֥תַע יִ֝שָּׁבֵ֗ר וְאֵ֣ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃

verses.text_en: When the righteous become great the people rejoice, But when the wicked dominate the people groan.
verses.text_he: בִּרְב֣וֹת צַ֭דִּיקִים יִשְׂמַ֣ח הָעָ֑ם וּבִמְשֹׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע יֵאָ֥נַֽח עָֽם׃

verses.text_en: A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father, But he who keeps company with harlots will lose his wealth.
verses.text_he: אִישׁ־אֹהֵ֣ב חׇ֭כְמָה יְשַׂמַּ֣ח אָבִ֑יו וְרֹעֶ֥ה ז֝וֹנ֗וֹת יְאַבֶּד־הֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: By justice a king sustains the land, But a fraudulent man tears it down.
verses.text_he: מֶ֗לֶךְ בְּ֭מִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִ֣יד אָ֑רֶץ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּרוּמ֣וֹת יֶהֶרְסֶֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: A man who flatters his fellow Spreads a net for his feet.
verses.text_he: גֶּ֭בֶר מַחֲלִ֣יק עַל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ רֶ֝֗שֶׁת פּוֹרֵ֥שׂ עַל־פְּעָמָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: An evil man’s offenses are a trap for himself, But the righteous sing out joyously.
verses.text_he: בְּפֶ֤שַֽׁע אִ֣ישׁ רָ֣ע מוֹקֵ֑שׁ וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק יָר֥וּן וְשָׂמֵֽחַ׃

verses.text_en: A righteous man is concerned with the cause of the wretched; A wicked man cannot understand such concern.
verses.text_he: יֹדֵ֣עַ צַ֭דִּיק דִּ֣ין דַּלִּ֑ים רָ֝שָׁ֗ע לֹא־יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃

verses.text_en: Scoffers inflame a city, But the wise allay anger.
verses.text_he: אַנְשֵׁ֣י לָ֭צוֹן יָפִ֣יחוּ קִרְיָ֑ה וַ֝חֲכָמִ֗ים יָשִׁ֥יבוּ אָֽף׃

verses.text_en: When a wise man enters into litigation with a fool There is ranting and ridicule, but no satisfaction.
verses.text_he: אִֽישׁ־חָכָ֗ם נִ֭שְׁפָּט אֶת־אִ֣ישׁ אֱוִ֑יל וְרָגַ֥ז וְ֝שָׂחַ֗ק וְאֵ֣ין נָֽחַת׃

verses.text_en: Bloodthirsty men detest the blameless, But the upright seek them out.
verses.text_he: אַנְשֵׁ֣י דָ֭מִים יִשְׂנְאוּ־תָ֑ם וִ֝ישָׁרִ֗ים יְבַקְשׁ֥וּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃

verses.text_en: A dullard vents all his rage, But a wise man calms it down.
verses.text_he: כׇּל־ר֭וּחוֹ יוֹצִ֣יא כְסִ֑יל וְ֝חָכָ֗ם בְּאָח֥וֹר יְשַׁבְּחֶֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: A ruler who listens to lies, All his ministers will be wicked.
verses.text_he: מֹ֭שֵׁל מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־דְּבַר־שָׁ֑קֶר כׇּֽל־מְשָׁרְתָ֥יו רְשָׁעִֽים׃

verses.text_en: A poor man and a fraudulent man meet; The LORD gives luster to the eyes of both.
verses.text_he: רָ֤שׁ וְאִ֣ישׁ תְּכָכִ֣ים נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ מֵ֤אִיר־עֵינֵ֖י שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: A king who judges the wretched honestly, His throne will be established forever.
verses.text_he: מֶ֤לֶךְ שׁוֹפֵ֣ט בֶּאֱמֶ֣ת דַּלִּ֑ים כִּ֝סְא֗וֹ לָעַ֥ד יִכּֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: Rod and reproof produce wisdom, But a lad out of control is a disgrace to his mother.
verses.text_he: שֵׁ֣בֶט וְ֭תוֹכַחַת יִתֵּ֣ן חׇכְמָ֑ה וְנַ֥עַר מְ֝שֻׁלָּ֗ח מֵבִ֥ישׁ אִמּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: When the wicked increase, offenses increase, But the righteous will see their downfall.
verses.text_he: בִּרְב֣וֹת רְ֭שָׁעִים יִרְבֶּה־פָּ֑שַׁע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים בְּֽמַפַּלְתָּ֥ם יִרְאֽוּ׃

verses.text_en: Discipline your son and he will give you peace; He will gratify you with dainties.
verses.text_he: יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ וִינִיחֶ֑ךָ וְיִתֵּ֖ן מַעֲדַנִּ֣ים לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: For lack of vision a people lose restraint, But happy is he who heeds instruction.
verses.text_he: בְּאֵ֣ין חָ֭זוֹן יִפָּ֣רַֽע עָ֑ם וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹרָ֣ה אַשְׁרֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: A slave cannot be disciplined by words; Though he may comprehend, he does not respond.
verses.text_he: בִּ֭דְבָרִים לֹא־יִוָּ֣סֶר עָ֑בֶד כִּי־יָ֝בִ֗ין וְאֵ֣ין מַעֲנֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: If you see a man hasty in speech, There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.text_he: חָזִ֗יתָ אִ֭ישׁ אָ֣ץ בִּדְבָרָ֑יו תִּקְוָ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: A slave pampered from youth Will come to a bad end.
verses.text_he: מְפַנֵּ֣ק מִנֹּ֣עַר עַבְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝אַחֲרִית֗וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה מָנֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: An angry man provokes a quarrel; A hot-tempered man commits many offenses.
verses.text_he: אִֽישׁ־אַ֭ף יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וּבַ֖עַל חֵמָ֣ה רַב־פָּֽשַׁע׃

verses.text_en: A man’s pride will humiliate him, But a humble man will obtain honor.
verses.text_he: גַּאֲוַ֣ת אָ֭דָם תַּשְׁפִּילֶ֑נּוּ וּשְׁפַל־ר֝֗וּחַ יִתְמֹ֥ךְ כָּבֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: He who shares with a thief is his own enemy; He hears the imprecation and does not tell.
verses.text_he: חוֹלֵ֣ק עִם־גַּ֭נָּב שׂוֹנֵ֣א נַפְשׁ֑וֹ אָלָ֥ה יִ֝שְׁמַ֗ע וְלֹ֣א יַגִּֽיד׃

verses.text_en: A man’s fears become a trap for him, But he who trusts in the LORD shall be safeguarded.
verses.text_he: חֶרְדַּ֣ת אָ֭דָם יִתֵּ֣ן מוֹקֵ֑שׁ וּבוֹטֵ֖חַ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה יְשֻׂגָּֽב׃

verses.text_en: Many seek audience with a ruler, But it is from the LORD that a man gets justice.
verses.text_he: רַ֭בִּים מְבַקְשִׁ֣ים פְּנֵֽי־מוֹשֵׁ֑ל וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה מִשְׁפַּט־אִֽישׁ׃

verses.text_en: The unjust man is an abomination to the righteous, And he whose way is straight is an abomination to the wicked.
verses.text_he: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת צַ֭דִּיקִים אִ֣ישׁ עָ֑וֶל וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע יְשַׁר־דָּֽרֶךְ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: The words of Agur son of Jakeh, [man of] Massa; The speech of the man to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:
verses.text_he: דִּבְרֵ֤י׀ אָג֥וּר בִּן־יָקֶ֗ה הַמַּ֫שָּׂ֥א נְאֻ֣ם הַ֭גֶּבֶר לְאִיתִיאֵ֑ל לְאִ֖יתִיאֵ֣ל וְאֻכָֽל׃

verses.text_en: I am brutish, less than a man; I lack common sense.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י בַ֣עַר אָנֹכִ֣י מֵאִ֑ישׁ וְלֹֽא־בִינַ֖ת אָדָ֣ם לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: I have not learned wisdom, Nor do I possess knowledge of the Holy One.
verses.text_he: וְלֹֽא־לָמַ֥דְתִּי חׇכְמָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת קְדֹשִׁ֣ים אֵדָֽע׃

verses.text_en: Who has ascended heaven and come down? Who has gathered up the wind in the hollow of his hand? Who has wrapped the waters in his garment? Who has established all the extremities of the earth? What is his name or his son’s name, if you know it?
verses.text_he: מִ֤י עָלָֽה־שָׁמַ֨יִם׀ וַיֵּרַ֡ד מִ֤י אָֽסַף־ר֨וּחַ׀ בְּחׇפְנָ֡יו מִ֤י צָֽרַר־מַ֨יִם׀ בַּשִּׂמְלָ֗ה מִ֭י הֵקִ֣ים כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ מַה־שְּׁמ֥וֹ וּמַֽה־שֶּׁם־בְּ֝נ֗וֹ כִּ֣י תֵדָֽע׃

verses.text_en: Every word of God is pure, A shield to those who take refuge in Him.
verses.text_he: כׇּל־אִמְרַ֣ת אֱל֣וֹהַּ צְרוּפָ֑ה מָגֵ֥ן ה֝֗וּא לַחֹסִ֥ים בּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Do not add to His words, Lest He indict you and you be proved a liar.
verses.text_he: אַל־תּ֥וֹסְףְּ עַל־דְּבָרָ֑יו פֶּן־יוֹכִ֖יחַ בְּךָ֣ וְנִכְזָֽבְתָּ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Two things I ask of You; do not deny them to me before I die:
verses.text_he: שְׁ֭תַּיִם שָׁאַ֣לְתִּי מֵאִתָּ֑ךְ אַל־תִּמְנַ֥ע מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי בְּטֶ֣רֶם אָמֽוּת׃

verses.text_en: Keep lies and false words far from me; Give me neither poverty nor riches, But provide me with my daily bread,
verses.text_he: שָׁ֤וְא׀ וּֽדְבַר־כָּזָ֡ב הַרְחֵ֬ק מִמֶּ֗נִּי רֵ֣אשׁ וָ֭עֹשֶׁר אַל־תִּֽתֶּן־לִ֑י הַ֝טְרִיפֵ֗נִי לֶ֣חֶם חֻקִּֽי׃

verses.text_en: Lest, being sated, I renounce, saying, “Who is the LORD?” Or, being impoverished, I take to theft And profane the name of my God.
verses.text_he: פֶּ֥ן־אֶשְׂבַּ֨ע׀ וְכִחַשְׁתִּי֮ וְאָמַ֗רְתִּי מִ֥י־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה וּפֶֽן־אִוָּרֵ֥שׁ וְגָנַ֑בְתִּי וְ֝תָפַ֗שְׂתִּי שֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהָֽי׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Do not inform on a slave to his master, Lest he curse you and you incur guilt.
verses.text_he: אַל־תַּלְשֵׁ֣ן עֶ֭בֶד אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֑ו פֶּֽן־יְקַלֶּלְךָ֥ וְאָשָֽׁמְתָּ׃

verses.text_en: There is a breed of men that brings a curse on its fathers And brings no blessing to its mothers,
verses.text_he: דּ֭וֹר אָבִ֣יו יְקַלֵּ֑ל וְאֶת־אִ֝מּ֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְבָרֵֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: A breed that thinks itself pure, Though it is not washed of its filth;
verses.text_he: דּ֭וֹר טָה֣וֹר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וּ֝מִצֹּאָת֗וֹ לֹ֣א רֻחָֽץ׃

verses.text_en: A breed so haughty of bearing, so supercilious;
verses.text_he: דּ֭וֹר מָה־רָמ֣וּ עֵינָ֑יו וְ֝עַפְעַפָּ֗יו יִנָּשֵֽׂאוּ׃

verses.text_en: A breed whose teeth are swords, Whose jaws are knives, Ready to devour the poor of the land, The needy among men.
verses.text_he: דּ֤וֹר׀ חֲרָב֣וֹת שִׁנָּיו֮ וּֽמַאֲכָל֢וֹת מְֽתַלְּעֹ֫תָ֥יו לֶאֱכֹ֣ל עֲנִיִּ֣ים מֵאֶ֑רֶץ וְ֝אֶבְיוֹנִ֗ים מֵאָדָֽם׃{פ}

verses.text_en: The leech has two daughters, “Give!” and “Give!” Three things are insatiable; Four never say, “Enough!”:
verses.text_he: לַ֥עֲלוּקָ֨ה׀ שְׁתֵּ֥י בָנוֹת֮ הַ֤ב׀ הַ֥֫ב שָׁל֣וֹשׁ הֵ֭נָּה לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּ֑עְנָה אַ֝רְבַּ֗ע לֹא־אָ֥מְרוּ הֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: Sheol, a barren womb, Earth that cannot get enough water, And fire which never says, “Enough!”
verses.text_he: שְׁאוֹל֮ וְעֹ֢צֶ֫ר רָ֥חַם אֶ֭רֶץ לֹא־שָׂ֣בְעָה מַּ֑יִם וְ֝אֵ֗שׁ לֹא־אָ֥מְרָה הֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: The eye that mocks a father And disdains the homage due a mother— The ravens of the brook will gouge it out, Young eagles will devour it.
verses.text_he: עַ֤יִן׀ תִּ֥לְעַ֣ג לְאָב֮ וְתָבֻ֢ז לִֽיקְּהַ֫ת־אֵ֥ם יִקְּר֥וּהָ עֹֽרְבֵי־נַ֑חַל וְֽיֹאכְל֥וּהָ בְנֵי־נָֽשֶׁר׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Three things are beyond me; Four I cannot fathom:
verses.text_he: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה הֵ֭מָּה נִפְלְא֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נִּי (וארבע) [וְ֝אַרְבָּעָ֗ה] לֹ֣א יְדַעְתִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: How an eagle makes its way over the sky; How a snake makes its way over a rock; How a ship makes its way through the high seas; How a man has his way with a maiden.
verses.text_he: דֶּ֤רֶךְ הַנֶּ֨שֶׁר׀ בַּשָּׁמַיִם֮ דֶּ֥רֶךְ נָחָ֗שׁ עֲלֵ֫י־צ֥וּר דֶּרֶךְ־אֳנִיָּ֥ה בְלֶב־יָ֑ם וְדֶ֖רֶךְ גֶּ֣בֶר בְּעַלְמָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Such is the way of an adulteress: She eats, wipes her mouth, And says, “I have done no wrong.”
verses.text_he: כֵּ֤ן׀ דֶּ֥רֶךְ אִשָּׁ֗ה מְנָ֫אָ֥פֶת אָ֭כְלָה וּמָ֣חֲתָה פִ֑יהָ וְ֝אָמְרָ֗ה לֹא־פָעַ֥לְתִּי אָֽוֶן׃{פ}

verses.text_en: The earth shudders at three things, At four which it cannot bear:
verses.text_he: תַּ֣חַת שָׁ֭לוֹשׁ רָ֣גְזָה אֶ֑רֶץ וְתַ֥חַת אַ֝רְבַּ֗ע לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל שְׂאֵֽת׃

verses.text_en: A slave who becomes king; A scoundrel sated with food;
verses.text_he: תַּֽחַת־עֶ֭בֶד כִּ֣י יִמְל֑וֹךְ וְ֝נָבָ֗ל כִּ֣י יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָֽחֶם׃

verses.text_en: A loathsome woman who gets married; A slave-girl who supplants her mistress.
verses.text_he: תַּ֣חַת שְׂ֭נוּאָה כִּ֣י תִבָּעֵ֑ל וְ֝שִׁפְחָ֗ה כִּֽי־תִירַ֥שׁ גְּבִרְתָּֽהּ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Four are among the tiniest on earth, Yet they are the wisest of the wise:
verses.text_he: אַרְבָּ֣עָה הֵ֭ם קְטַנֵּי־אָ֑רֶץ וְ֝הֵ֗מָּה חֲכָמִ֥ים מְחֻכָּמִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Ants are a folk without power, Yet they prepare food for themselves in summer;
verses.text_he: הַ֭נְּמָלִים עַ֣ם לֹא־עָ֑ז וַיָּכִ֖ינוּ בַקַּ֣יִץ לַחְמָֽם׃

verses.text_en: The badger is a folk without strength, Yet it makes its home in the rock;
verses.text_he: שְׁ֭פַנִּים עַ֣ם לֹא־עָצ֑וּם וַיָּשִׂ֖ימוּ בַסֶּ֣לַע בֵּיתָֽם׃

verses.text_en: The locusts have no king, Yet they all march forth in formation;
verses.text_he: מֶ֭לֶךְ אֵ֣ין לָאַרְבֶּ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֖א חֹצֵ֣ץ כֻּלּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: You can catch the lizard in your hand, Yet it is found in royal palaces.
verses.text_he: שְׂ֭מָמִית בְּיָדַ֣יִם תְּתַפֵּ֑שׂ וְ֝הִ֗יא בְּהֵ֣יכְלֵי מֶֽלֶךְ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: There are three that are stately of stride, Four that carry themselves well:
verses.text_he: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה הֵ֭מָּה מֵיטִ֣יבֵי צָ֑עַד וְ֝אַרְבָּעָ֗ה מֵיטִ֥בֵי לָֽכֶת׃

verses.text_en: The lion is mightiest among the beasts, And recoils before none;
verses.text_he: לַ֭יִשׁ גִּבּ֣וֹר בַּבְּהֵמָ֑ה וְלֹא־יָ֝שׁ֗וּב מִפְּנֵי־כֹֽל׃

verses.text_en: The greyhound, the he-goat, The king whom none dares resist.
verses.text_he: זַרְזִ֣יר מׇתְנַ֣יִם אוֹ־תָ֑יִשׁ וּ֝מֶ֗לֶךְ אַלְק֥וּם עִמּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: If you have been scandalously arrogant, If you have been a schemer, Then clap your hand to your mouth.
verses.text_he: אִם־נָבַ֥לְתָּ בְהִתְנַשֵּׂ֑א וְאִם־זַ֝מּ֗וֹתָ יָ֣ד לְפֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: As milk under pressure produces butter, And a nose under pressure produces blood, So patience under pressure produces strife.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י מִ֪יץ חָלָ֡ב י֘וֹצִ֤יא חֶמְאָ֗ה וּֽמִיץ־אַ֭ף י֣וֹצִיא דָ֑ם וּמִ֥יץ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם י֣וֹצִיא רִֽיב׃{פ}

verses.text_en: The words of Lemuel, king of Massa, with which his mother admonished him:
verses.text_he: דִּ֭בְרֵי לְמוּאֵ֣ל מֶ֑לֶךְ מַ֝שָּׂ֗א אֲֽשֶׁר־יִסְּרַ֥תּוּ אִמּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: No, my son! No, O son of my womb! No, O son of my vows!
verses.text_he: מַה־בְּ֭רִי וּמַֽה־בַּר־בִּטְנִ֑י וּ֝מֶ֗ה בַּר־נְדָרָֽי׃

verses.text_en: Do not give your strength to women, Your vigor, to those who destroy kings.
verses.text_he: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן לַנָּשִׁ֣ים חֵילֶ֑ךָ וּ֝דְרָכֶ֗יךָ לַֽמְח֥וֹת מְלָכִֽין׃

verses.text_en: Wine is not for kings, O Lemuel; Not for kings to drink, Nor any strong drink for princes,
verses.text_he: אַ֤ל לַֽמְלָכִ֨ים׀ לְֽמוֹאֵ֗ל אַ֣ל לַֽמְלָכִ֣ים שְׁתוֹ־יָ֑יִן וּ֝לְרוֹזְנִ֗ים (או) [אֵ֣י] שֵׁכָֽר׃

verses.text_en: Lest they drink and forget what has been ordained, And infringe on the rights of the poor.
verses.text_he: פֶּן־יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח מְחֻקָּ֑ק וִ֝ישַׁנֶּ֗ה דִּ֣ין כׇּל־בְּנֵי־עֹֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: Give strong drink to the hapless And wine to the embittered.
verses.text_he: תְּנוּ־שֵׁכָ֥ר לְאוֹבֵ֑ד וְ֝יַ֗יִן לְמָ֣רֵי נָֽפֶשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Let them drink and forget their poverty, And put their troubles out of mind.
verses.text_he: יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח רִישׁ֑וֹ וַ֝עֲמָל֗וֹ לֹ֣א יִזְכׇּר־עֽוֹד׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Speak up for the dumb, For the rights of all the unfortunate.
verses.text_he: פְּתַח־פִּ֥יךָ לְאִלֵּ֑ם אֶל־דִּ֝֗ין כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י חֲלֽוֹף׃

verses.text_en: Speak up, judge righteously, Champion the poor and the needy.
verses.text_he: פְּתַח־פִּ֥יךָ שְׁפׇט־צֶ֑דֶק וְ֝דִ֗ין עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְיֽוֹן׃{פ}

verses.text_en: What a rare find is a capable wife! Her worth is far beyond that of rubies.
verses.text_he: אֵֽשֶׁת־חַ֭יִל מִ֣י יִמְצָ֑א וְרָחֹ֖ק מִפְּנִינִ֣ים מִכְרָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: Her husband puts his confidence in her, And lacks no good thing.
verses.text_he: בָּ֣טַח בָּ֭הּ לֵ֣ב בַּעְלָ֑הּ וְ֝שָׁלָ֗ל לֹ֣א יֶחְסָֽר׃

verses.text_en: She is good to him, never bad, All the days of her life.
verses.text_he: גְּמָלַ֣תְהוּ ט֣וֹב וְלֹא־רָ֑ע כֹּ֝֗ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּֽיהָ׃

verses.text_en: She looks for wool and flax, And sets her hand to them with a will.
verses.text_he: דָּ֭רְשָׁה צֶ֣מֶר וּפִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַ֝תַּ֗עַשׂ בְּחֵ֣פֶץ כַּפֶּֽיהָ׃

verses.text_en: She is like a merchant fleet, Bringing her food from afar.
verses.text_he: הָ֭יְתָה כׇּאֳנִיּ֣וֹת סוֹחֵ֑ר מִ֝מֶּרְחָ֗ק תָּבִ֥יא לַחְמָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: She rises while it is still night, And supplies provisions for her household, The daily fare of her maids.
verses.text_he: וַתָּ֤קׇם׀ בְּע֬וֹד לַ֗יְלָה וַתִּתֵּ֣ן טֶ֣רֶף לְבֵיתָ֑הּ וְ֝חֹ֗ק לְנַעֲרֹתֶֽיהָ׃

verses.text_en: She sets her mind on an estate and acquires it; She plants a vineyard by her own labors.
verses.text_he: זָמְמָ֣ה שָׂ֭דֶה וַתִּקָּחֵ֑הוּ מִפְּרִ֥י כַ֝פֶּ֗יהָ (נטע) [נָ֣טְעָה] כָּֽרֶם׃

verses.text_en: She girds herself with strength, And performs her tasks with vigor.
verses.text_he: חָֽגְרָ֣ה בְע֣וֹז מׇתְנֶ֑יהָ וַ֝תְּאַמֵּ֗ץ זְרוֹעֹתֶֽיהָ׃

verses.text_en: She sees that her business thrives; Her lamp never goes out at night.
verses.text_he: טָ֭עֲמָה כִּי־ט֣וֹב סַחְרָ֑הּ לֹא־יִכְבֶּ֖ה (בליל) [בַלַּ֣יְלָה] נֵרָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: She sets her hand to the distaff; Her fingers work the spindle.
verses.text_he: יָ֭דֶיהָ שִׁלְּחָ֣ה בַכִּישׁ֑וֹר וְ֝כַפֶּ֗יהָ תָּ֣מְכוּ פָֽלֶךְ׃

verses.text_en: She gives generously to the poor; Her hands are stretched out to the needy.
