verses.text_en: His iniquitous strides are hobbled; His schemes overthrow him.
verses.text_he: יֵ֭צְרוּ צַעֲדֵ֣י אוֹנ֑וֹ וְֽתַשְׁלִיכֵ֥הוּ עֲצָתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He is led by his feet into the net; He walks onto the toils.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־שֻׁלַּ֣ח בְּרֶ֣שֶׁת בְּרַגְלָ֑יו וְעַל־שְׂ֝בָכָ֗ה יִתְהַלָּֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: The trap seizes his heel; The noose tightens on him.
verses.text_he: יֹאחֵ֣ז בְּעָקֵ֣ב פָּ֑ח יַחֲזֵ֖ק עָלָ֣יו צַמִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: The rope for him lies hidden on the ground; His snare, on the path.
verses.text_he: טָמ֣וּן בָּאָ֣רֶץ חַבְל֑וֹ וּ֝מַלְכֻּדְתּ֗וֹ עֲלֵ֣י נָתִֽיב׃

verses.text_en: Terrors assault him on all sides And send his feet flying.
verses.text_he: סָ֭בִיב בִּעֲתֻ֣הוּ בַלָּה֑וֹת וֶהֱפִיצֻ֥הוּ לְרַגְלָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: His progeny hunger; Disaster awaits his wife.
verses.text_he: יְהִי־רָעֵ֥ב אֹנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֵ֗יד נָכ֥וֹן לְצַלְעֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The tendons under his skin are consumed; Death’s first-born consumes his tendons.
verses.text_he: יֹ֭אכַל בַּדֵּ֣י עוֹר֑וֹ יֹאכַ֥ל בַּ֝דָּ֗יו בְּכ֣וֹר מָֽוֶת׃

verses.text_en: He is torn from the safety of his tent; Terror marches him to the king.
verses.text_he: יִנָּתֵ֣ק מֵ֭אׇהֳלוֹ מִבְטַח֑וֹ וְ֝תַצְעִדֵ֗הוּ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ בַּלָּהֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: It lodges in his desolate tent; Sulfur is strewn upon his home.
verses.text_he: תִּשְׁכּ֣וֹן בְּ֭אׇהֳלוֹ מִבְּלִיל֑וֹ יְזֹרֶ֖ה עַל־נָוֵ֣הוּ גׇפְרִֽית׃

verses.text_en: His roots below dry up, And above, his branches wither.
verses.text_he: מִ֭תַּחַת שׇׁרָשָׁ֣יו יִבָ֑שׁוּ וּ֝מִמַּ֗עַל יִמַּ֥ל קְצִירֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: All mention of him vanishes from the earth; He has no name abroad.
verses.text_he: זִֽכְרוֹ־אָ֭בַד מִנִּי־אָ֑רֶץ וְלֹא־שֵׁ֥ם ל֝֗וֹ עַל־פְּנֵי־חֽוּץ׃

verses.text_en: He is thrust from light to darkness, Driven from the world.
verses.text_he: יֶ֭הְדְּפֻהוּ מֵא֣וֹר אֶל־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וּֽמִתֵּבֵ֥ל יְנִדֻּֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: He has no seed or breed among his people, No survivor where he once lived.
verses.text_he: לֹ֘א־נִ֤ין ל֣וֹ וְלֹא־נֶ֣כֶד בְּעַמּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ין שָׂ֝רִ֗יד בִּמְגוּרָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: Generations to come will be appalled at his fate, As the previous ones are seized with horror.
verses.text_he: עַל־י֭וֹמוֹ נָשַׁ֣מּוּ אַחֲרֹנִ֑ים וְ֝קַדְמֹנִ֗ים אָ֣חֲזוּ שָֽׂעַר׃

verses.text_en: “These were the haunts of the wicked; Here was the place of him who knew not God.”
verses.text_he: אַךְ־אֵ֭לֶּה מִשְׁכְּנ֣וֹת עַוָּ֑ל וְ֝זֶ֗ה מְק֣וֹם לֹֽא־יָדַֽע־אֵֽל׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Job said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: How long will you grieve my spirit, And crush me with words?
verses.text_he: עַד־אָ֭נָה תּוֹגְי֣וּן נַפְשִׁ֑י וּֽתְדַכּאוּנַ֥נִי בְמִלִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: Time and again you humiliate me, And are not ashamed to abuse me.
verses.text_he: זֶ֤ה עֶ֣שֶׂר פְּ֭עָמִים תַּכְלִימ֑וּנִי לֹֽא־תֵ֝בֹ֗שׁוּ תַּהְכְּרוּ־לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: If indeed I have erred, My error remains with me.
verses.text_he: וְאַף־אׇמְנָ֥ם שָׁגִ֑יתִי אִ֝תִּ֗י תָּלִ֥ין מְשׁוּגָתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Though you are overbearing toward me, Reproaching me with my disgrace,
verses.text_he: אִם־אׇ֭מְנָם עָלַ֣י תַּגְדִּ֑ילוּ וְתוֹכִ֥יחוּ עָ֝לַ֗י חֶרְפָּתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Yet know that God has wronged me; He has thrown up siege works around me.
verses.text_he: דְּֽעוּ־אֵ֭פוֹ כִּֽי־אֱל֣וֹהַּ עִוְּתָ֑נִי וּ֝מְצוּד֗וֹ עָלַ֥י הִקִּֽיף׃

verses.text_en: I cry, “Violence!” but am not answered; I shout, but can get no justice.
verses.text_he: הֵ֤ן אֶצְעַ֣ק חָ֭מָס וְלֹ֣א אֵעָנֶ֑ה אֲ֝שַׁוַּ֗ע וְאֵ֣ין מִשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: He has barred my way; I cannot pass; He has laid darkness upon my path.
verses.text_he: אׇרְחִ֣י גָ֭דַר וְלֹ֣א אֶעֱב֑וֹר וְעַ֥ל נְ֝תִיבוֹתַ֗י חֹ֣שֶׁךְ יָשִֽׂים׃

verses.text_en: He has stripped me of my glory, Removed the crown from my head.
verses.text_he: כְּ֭בוֹדִי מֵעָלַ֣י הִפְשִׁ֑יט וַ֝יָּ֗סַר עֲטֶ֣רֶת רֹאשִֽׁי׃

verses.text_en: He tears down every part of me; I perish; He uproots my hope like a tree.
verses.text_he: יִתְּצֵ֣נִי סָ֭בִיב וָאֵלַ֑ךְ וַיַּסַּ֥ע כָּ֝עֵ֗ץ תִּקְוָתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: He kindles His anger against me; He regards me as one of His foes.
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֣חַר עָלַ֣י אַפּ֑וֹ וַיַּחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי ל֣וֹ כְצָרָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: His troops advance together; They build their road toward me And encamp around my tent.
verses.text_he: יַ֤חַד׀ יָ֘בֹ֤אוּ גְדוּדָ֗יו וַיָּסֹ֣לּוּ עָלַ֣י דַּרְכָּ֑ם וַיַּחֲנ֖וּ סָבִ֣יב לְאׇהֳלִֽי׃

verses.text_en: He alienated my kin from me; My acquaintances disown me.
verses.text_he: אַ֭חַי מֵעָלַ֣י הִרְחִ֑יק וְ֝יֹדְעַ֗י אַךְ־זָ֥רוּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃

verses.text_en: My relatives are gone; My friends have forgotten me.
verses.text_he: חָדְל֥וּ קְרוֹבָ֑י וּֽמְיֻדָּעַ֥י שְׁכֵחֽוּנִי׃

verses.text_en: My dependents and maidservants regard me as a stranger; I am an outsider to them.
verses.text_he: גָּ֘רֵ֤י בֵיתִ֣י וְ֭אַמְהֹתַי לְזָ֣ר תַּחְשְׁבֻ֑נִי נׇ֝כְרִ֗י הָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: I summon my servant but he does not respond; I must myself entreat him.
verses.text_he: לְעַבְדִּ֣י קָ֭רָאתִי וְלֹ֣א יַעֲנֶ֑ה בְּמוֹ־פִ֝֗י אֶתְחַנֶּן־לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: My odor is repulsive to my wife; I am loathsome to my children.
verses.text_he: ר֭וּחִי זָ֣רָה לְאִשְׁתִּ֑י וְ֝חַנֹּתִ֗י לִבְנֵ֥י בִטְנִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Even youngsters disdain me; When I rise, they speak against me.
verses.text_he: גַּם־עֲ֭וִילִים מָ֣אֲסוּ בִ֑י אָ֝ק֗וּמָה וַיְדַבְּרוּ־בִֽי׃

verses.text_en: All my bosom friends detest me; Those I love have turned against me.
verses.text_he: תִּ֭עֲבוּנִי כׇּל־מְתֵ֣י סוֹדִ֑י וְזֶה־אָ֝הַ֗בְתִּי נֶהְפְּכוּ־בִֽי׃

verses.text_en: My bones stick to my skin and flesh; I escape with the skin of my teeth.
verses.text_he: בְּעוֹרִ֣י וּ֭בִבְשָׂרִי דָּבְקָ֣ה עַצְמִ֑י וָ֝אֶתְמַלְּטָ֗ה בְּע֣וֹר שִׁנָּֽי׃

verses.text_en: Pity me, pity me! You are my friends; For the hand of God has struck me!
verses.text_he: חׇנֻּ֬נִי חׇנֻּ֣נִי אַתֶּ֣ם רֵעָ֑י כִּ֥י יַד־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ נָ֣גְעָה בִּֽי׃

verses.text_en: Why do you pursue me like God, Maligning me insatiably?
verses.text_he: לָ֭מָּה תִּרְדְּפֻ֣נִי כְמוֹ־אֵ֑ל וּ֝מִבְּשָׂרִ֗י לֹ֣א תִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃

verses.text_en: O that my words were written down; Would they were inscribed in a record,
verses.text_he: מִי־יִתֵּ֣ן אֵ֭פוֹ וְיִכָּתְב֣וּן מִלָּ֑י מִי־יִתֵּ֖ן בַּסֵּ֣פֶר וְיֻחָֽקוּ׃

verses.text_en: Incised on a rock forever With iron stylus and lead!
verses.text_he: בְּעֵט־בַּרְזֶ֥ל וְעֹפָ֑רֶת לָ֝עַ֗ד בַּצּ֥וּר יֵחָצְבֽוּן׃

verses.text_en: But I know that my Vindicator lives; In the end He will testify on earth—
verses.text_he: וַאֲנִ֣י יָ֭דַעְתִּי גֹּ֣אֲלִי חָ֑י וְ֝אַחֲר֗וֹן עַל־עָפָ֥ר יָקֽוּם׃

verses.text_en: This, after my skin will have been peeled off. But I would behold God while still in my flesh,
verses.text_he: וְאַחַ֣ר ע֭וֹרִי נִקְּפוּ־זֹ֑את וּ֝מִבְּשָׂרִ֗י אֶחֱזֶ֥ה אֱלֽוֹהַּ׃

verses.text_en: I myself, not another, would behold Him; Would see with my own eyes: My heart pines within me.
verses.text_he: אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִ֨י׀ אֶחֱזֶה־לִּ֗י וְעֵינַ֣י רָא֣וּ וְלֹא־זָ֑ר כָּל֖וּ כִלְיֹתַ֣י בְּחֵקִֽי׃

verses.text_en: You say, “How do we persecute him? The root of the matter is in him.”
verses.text_he: כִּ֣י תֹ֭אמְרוּ מַה־נִּרְדׇּף־ל֑וֹ וְשֹׁ֥רֶשׁ דָּ֝בָ֗ר נִמְצָא־בִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Be in fear of the sword, For [your] fury is iniquity worthy of the sword; Know there is a judgment!
verses.text_he: גּ֤וּרוּ לָכֶ֨ם׀ מִפְּנֵי־חֶ֗רֶב כִּֽי־חֵ֭מָה עֲוֺנ֣וֹת חָ֑רֶב לְמַ֖עַן תֵּדְע֣וּן (שדין) [שַׁדּֽוּן]׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Zophar the Naamathite said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַ֭יַּעַן צֹפַ֥ר הַֽנַּעֲמָתִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: In truth, my thoughts urge me to answer (It is because of my feelings
verses.text_he: לָ֭כֵן שְׂעִפַּ֣י יְשִׁיב֑וּנִי וּ֝בַעֲב֗וּר ח֣וּשִׁי בִֽי׃

verses.text_en: When I hear reproof that insults me); A spirit out of my understanding makes me reply:
verses.text_he: מוּסַ֣ר כְּלִמָּתִ֣י אֶשְׁמָ֑ע וְ֝ר֗וּחַ מִֽבִּינָתִ֥י יַעֲנֵֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: Do you not know this, that from time immemorial, Since man was set on earth,
verses.text_he: הֲזֹ֣את יָ֭דַעְתָּ מִנִּי־עַ֑ד מִנִּ֤י שִׂ֖ים אָדָ֣ם עֲלֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃

verses.text_en: The joy of the wicked has been brief, The happiness of the impious, fleeting?
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י רִנְנַ֣ת רְ֭שָׁעִים מִקָּר֑וֹב וְשִׂמְחַ֖ת חָנֵ֣ף עֲדֵי־רָֽגַע׃

verses.text_en: Though he grows as high as the sky, His head reaching the clouds,
verses.text_he: אִם־יַעֲלֶ֣ה לַשָּׁמַ֣יִם שִׂיא֑וֹ וְ֝רֹאשׁ֗וֹ לָעָ֥ב יַגִּֽיעַ׃

verses.text_en: He perishes forever, like his dung; Those who saw him will say, “Where is he?”
verses.text_he: כְּֽ֭גֶלְלוֹ לָנֶ֣צַח יֹאבֵ֑ד רֹ֝אָ֗יו יֹאמְר֥וּ אַיּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He flies away like a dream and cannot be found; He is banished like a night vision.
verses.text_he: כַּחֲל֣וֹם יָ֭עוּף וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָא֑וּהוּ וְ֝יֻדַּ֗ד כְּחֶזְי֥וֹן לָֽיְלָה׃

verses.text_en: Eyes that glimpsed him do so no more; They cannot see him in his place any longer.
verses.text_he: עַ֣יִן שְׁ֭זָפַתּוּ וְלֹ֣א תוֹסִ֑יף וְלֹֽא־ע֝֗וֹד תְּשׁוּרֶ֥נּוּ מְקוֹמֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: His sons ingratiate themselves with the poor; His own hands must give back his wealth.
verses.text_he: בָּ֭נָיו יְרַצּ֣וּ דַלִּ֑ים וְ֝יָדָ֗יו תָּשֵׁ֥בְנָה אוֹנֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: His bones, still full of vigor, Lie down in the dust with him.
verses.text_he: עַ֭צְמוֹתָיו מָלְא֣וּ עֲלוּמָ֑ו וְ֝עִמּ֗וֹ עַל־עָפָ֥ר תִּשְׁכָּֽב׃

verses.text_en: Though evil is sweet to his taste, And he conceals it under his tongue;
verses.text_he: אִם־תַּמְתִּ֣יק בְּפִ֣יו רָעָ֑ה יַ֝כְחִידֶ֗נָּה תַּ֣חַת לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Though he saves it, does not let it go, Holds it inside his mouth,
verses.text_he: יַחְמֹ֣ל עָ֭לֶיהָ וְלֹ֣א יַעַזְבֶ֑נָּה וְ֝יִמְנָעֶ֗נָּה בְּת֣וֹךְ חִכּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: His food in his bowels turns Into asps’ venom within him.
verses.text_he: לַ֭חְמוֹ בְּמֵעָ֣יו נֶהְפָּ֑ךְ מְרוֹרַ֖ת פְּתָנִ֣ים בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: The riches he swallows he vomits; God empties it out of his stomach.
verses.text_he: חַ֣יִל בָּ֭לַע וַיְקִאֶ֑נּוּ מִ֝בִּטְנ֗וֹ יֹרִשֶׁ֥נּוּ אֵֽל׃

verses.text_en: He sucks the poison of asps; The tongue of the viper kills him.
verses.text_he: רֹאשׁ־פְּתָנִ֥ים יִינָ֑ק תַּ֝הַרְגֵ֗הוּ לְשׁ֣וֹן אֶפְעֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: Let him not enjoy the streams, The rivers of honey, the brooks of cream.
verses.text_he: אַל־יֵ֥רֶא בִפְלַגּ֑וֹת נַהֲרֵ֥י נַ֝חֲלֵ֗י דְּבַ֣שׁ וְחֶמְאָֽה׃

verses.text_en: He will give back the goods unswallowed; The value of the riches, undigested.
verses.text_he: מֵשִׁ֣יב יָ֭גָע וְלֹ֣א יִבְלָ֑ע כְּחֵ֥יל תְּ֝מוּרָת֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲלֹֽס׃

verses.text_en: Because he crushed and tortured the poor, He will not build up the house he took by force.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־רִ֭צַּץ עָזַ֣ב דַּלִּ֑ים בַּ֥יִת גָּ֝זַ֗ל וְלֹ֣א יִבְנֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: He will not see his children tranquil; He will not preserve one of his dear ones.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י׀ לֹא־יָדַ֣ע שָׁלֵ֣ו בְּבִטְנ֑וֹ בַּ֝חֲמוּד֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּֽט׃

verses.text_en: With no survivor to enjoy it, His fortune will not prosper.
verses.text_he: אֵין־שָׂרִ֥יד לְאׇכְל֑וֹ עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן לֹא־יָחִ֥יל טוּבֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: When he has all he wants, trouble will come; Misfortunes of all kinds will batter him.
verses.text_he: בִּמְלֹ֣אות שִׂ֭פְקוֹ יֵ֣צֶר ל֑וֹ כׇּל־יַ֖ד עָמֵ֣ל תְּבֹאֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: Let that fill his belly; Let Him loose His burning anger at him, And rain down His weapons upon him.
verses.text_he: יְהִ֤י׀ לְמַלֵּ֬א בִטְנ֗וֹ יְֽשַׁלַּח־בּ֭וֹ חֲר֣וֹן אַפּ֑וֹ וְיַמְטֵ֥ר עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ בִּלְחוּמֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Fleeing from iron arrows, He is shot through from a bow of bronze.
verses.text_he: יִ֭בְרַח מִנֵּ֣שֶׁק בַּרְזֶ֑ל תַּ֝חְלְפֵ֗הוּ קֶ֣שֶׁת נְחוּשָֽׁה׃

verses.text_en: Brandished and run through his body, The blade, through his gall, Strikes terror into him.
verses.text_he: שָׁלַף֮ וַיֵּצֵ֢א מִגֵּ֫וָ֥ה וּ֭בָרָק מִֽמְּרֹרָת֥וֹ יַהֲלֹ֗ךְ עָלָ֥יו אֵמִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Utter darkness waits for his treasured ones; A fire fanned by no man will consume him; Who survives in his tent will be crushed.
verses.text_he: כׇּל־חֹשֶׁךְ֮ טָמ֢וּן לִצְפּ֫וּנָ֥יו תְּ֭אׇכְלֵהוּ אֵ֣שׁ לֹא־נֻפָּ֑ח יֵ֖רַע שָׂרִ֣יד בְּאׇהֳלֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Heaven will expose his iniquity; Earth will rise up against him.
verses.text_he: יְגַלּ֣וּ שָׁמַ֣יִם עֲוֺנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֶ֗רֶץ מִתְקוֹמָ֘מָ֥ה לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: His household will be cast forth by a flood, Spilled out on the day of His wrath.
verses.text_he: יִ֭גֶל יְב֣וּל בֵּית֑וֹ נִ֝גָּר֗וֹת בְּי֣וֹם אַפּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: This is the wicked man’s portion from God, The lot God has ordained for him.
verses.text_he: זֶ֤ה׀ חֵלֶק־אָדָ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע מֵאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְנַחֲלַ֖ת אִמְר֣וֹ מֵאֵֽל׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Job said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: Listen well to what I say, And let that be your consolation.
verses.text_he: שִׁמְע֣וּ שָׁ֭מוֹעַ מִלָּתִ֑י וּתְהִי־זֹ֝֗את תַּנְח֥וּמֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Bear with me while I speak, And after I have spoken, you may mock.
verses.text_he: שָׂ֭אוּנִי וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְאַחַ֖ר דַּבְּרִ֣י תַלְעִֽיג׃

verses.text_en: Is my complaint directed toward a man? Why should I not lose my patience?
verses.text_he: הֶ֭אָנֹכִי לְאָדָ֣ם שִׂיחִ֑י וְאִם־מַ֝דּ֗וּעַ לֹֽא־תִקְצַ֥ר רוּחִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Look at me and be appalled, And clap your hand to your mouth.
verses.text_he: פְּנוּ־אֵלַ֥י וְהָשַׁ֑מּוּ וְשִׂ֖ימוּ יָ֣ד עַל־פֶּֽה׃

verses.text_en: When I think of it I am terrified; My body is seized with shuddering.
verses.text_he: וְאִם־זָכַ֥רְתִּי וְנִבְהָ֑לְתִּי וְאָחַ֥ז בְּ֝שָׂרִ֗י פַּלָּצֽוּת׃

verses.text_en: Why do the wicked live on, Prosper and grow wealthy?
verses.text_he: מַ֭דּוּעַ רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִֽחְי֑וּ עָ֝תְק֗וּ גַּם־גָּ֥בְרוּ חָֽיִל׃

verses.text_en: Their children are with them always, And they see their children’s children.
verses.text_he: זַרְעָ֤ם נָכ֣וֹן לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם עִמָּ֑ם וְ֝צֶאֱצָאֵיהֶ֗ם לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Their homes are secure, without fear; They do not feel the rod of God.
verses.text_he: בָּתֵּיהֶ֣ם שָׁל֣וֹם מִפָּ֑חַד וְלֹ֤א שֵׁ֖בֶט אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Their bull breeds and does not fail; Their cow calves and never miscarries;
verses.text_he: שׁוֹר֣וֹ עִ֭בַּר וְלֹ֣א יַגְעִ֑ל תְּפַלֵּ֥ט פָּ֝רָת֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א תְשַׁכֵּֽל׃

verses.text_en: They let their infants run loose like sheep, And their children skip about.
verses.text_he: יְשַׁלְּח֣וּ כַ֭צֹּאן עֲוִילֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝יַלְדֵיהֶ֗ם יְרַקֵּדֽוּן׃

verses.text_en: They sing to the music of timbrel and lute, And revel to the tune of the pipe;
verses.text_he: יִ֭שְׂאוּ כְּתֹ֣ף וְכִנּ֑וֹר וְ֝יִשְׂמְח֗וּ לְק֣וֹל עוּגָֽב׃

verses.text_en: They spend their days in happiness, And go down to Sheol in peace.
verses.text_he: (יבלו) [יְכַלּ֣וּ] בַטּ֣וֹב יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וּ֝בְרֶ֗גַע שְׁא֣וֹל יֵחָֽתּוּ׃

verses.text_en: They say to God, “Leave us alone, We do not want to learn Your ways;
verses.text_he: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לָ֭אֵל ס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְדַ֥עַת דְּ֝רָכֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א חָפָֽצְנוּ׃

verses.text_en: What is Shaddai that we should serve Him? What will we gain by praying to Him?”
verses.text_he: מַה־שַּׁדַּ֥י כִּֽי־נַעַבְדֶ֑נּוּ וּמַה־נּ֝וֹעִ֗יל כִּ֣י נִפְגַּע־בּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Their happiness is not their own doing. (The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!)
verses.text_he: הֵ֤ן לֹ֣א בְיָדָ֣ם טוּבָ֑ם עֲצַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים רָ֣חֲקָה מֶֽנִּי׃

verses.text_en: How seldom does the lamp of the wicked fail, Does the calamity they deserve befall them, Does He apportion [their] lot in anger!
verses.text_he: כַּמָּ֤ה׀ נֵר־רְשָׁ֘עִ֤ים יִדְעָ֗ךְ וְיָבֹ֣א עָלֵ֣ימוֹ אֵידָ֑ם חֲ֝בָלִ֗ים יְחַלֵּ֥ק בְּאַפּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Let them become like straw in the wind, Like chaff carried off by a storm.
verses.text_he: יִֽהְי֗וּ כְּתֶ֥בֶן לִפְנֵי־ר֑וּחַ וּ֝כְמֹ֗ץ גְּנָבַ֥תּוּ סוּפָֽה׃

verses.text_en: [You say,] “God is reserving his punishment for his sons”; Let it be paid back to him that he may feel it,
verses.text_he: אֱל֗וֹהַּ יִצְפֹּן־לְבָנָ֥יו אוֹנ֑וֹ יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם אֵלָ֣יו וְיֵדָֽע׃

verses.text_en: Let his eyes see his ruin, And let him drink the wrath of Shaddai!
verses.text_he: יִרְא֣וּ עֵינָ֣ו כִּיד֑וֹ וּמֵחֲמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י יִשְׁתֶּֽה׃

verses.text_en: For what does he care about the fate of his family, When his number of months runs out?
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י מַה־חֶפְצ֣וֹ בְּבֵית֣וֹ אַחֲרָ֑יו וּמִסְפַּ֖ר חֳדָשָׁ֣יו חֻצָּֽצוּ׃

verses.text_en: Can God be instructed in knowledge, He who judges from such heights?
verses.text_he: הַלְאֵ֥ל יְלַמֶּד־דָּ֑עַת וְ֝ה֗וּא רָמִ֥ים יִשְׁפּֽוֹט׃

verses.text_en: One man dies in robust health, All tranquil and untroubled;
verses.text_he: זֶ֗ה יָ֭מוּת בְּעֶ֣צֶם תֻּמּ֑וֹ כֻּ֝לּ֗וֹ שַׁלְאֲנַ֥ן וְשָׁלֵֽיו׃

verses.text_en: His pails are full of milk; The marrow of his bones is juicy.
verses.text_he: עֲ֭טִינָיו מָלְא֣וּ חָלָ֑ב וּמֹ֖חַ עַצְמוֹתָ֣יו יְשֻׁקֶּֽה׃

verses.text_en: Another dies embittered, Never having tasted happiness.
verses.text_he: וְזֶ֗ה יָ֭מוּת בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ מָרָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־אָ֝כַ֗ל בַּטּוֹבָֽה׃

verses.text_en: They both lie in the dust And are covered with worms.
verses.text_he: יַ֭חַד עַל־עָפָ֣ר יִשְׁכָּ֑בוּ וְ֝רִמָּ֗ה תְּכַסֶּ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Oh, I know your thoughts, And the tactics you will devise against me.
verses.text_he: הֵ֣ן יָ֭דַעְתִּי מַחְשְׁבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וּ֝מְזִמּ֗וֹת עָלַ֥י תַּחְמֹֽסוּ׃

verses.text_en: You will say, “Where is the house of the great man— And where the tent in which the wicked dwelled?”
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י תֹאמְר֗וּ אַיֵּ֥ה בֵית־נָדִ֑יב וְ֝אַיֵּ֗ה אֹ֤הֶל׀ מִשְׁכְּנ֬וֹת רְשָׁעִֽים׃

verses.text_en: You must have consulted the wayfarers; You cannot deny their evidence.
verses.text_he: הֲלֹ֣א שְׁ֭אֶלְתֶּם ע֣וֹבְרֵי דָ֑רֶךְ וְ֝אֹתֹתָ֗ם לֹ֣א תְנַכֵּֽרוּ׃

verses.text_en: For the evil man is spared on the day of calamity, On the day when wrath is led forth.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י לְי֣וֹם אֵ֭יד יֵחָ֣שֶׂךְ רָ֑ע לְי֖וֹם עֲבָר֣וֹת יוּבָֽלוּ׃

verses.text_en: Who will upbraid him to his face? Who will requite him for what he has done?
verses.text_he: מִֽי־יַגִּ֣יד עַל־פָּנָ֣יו דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְהוּא־עָ֝שָׂ֗ה מִ֣י יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He is brought to the grave, While a watch is kept at his tomb.
verses.text_he: וְ֭הוּא לִקְבָר֣וֹת יוּבָ֑ל וְֽעַל־גָּדִ֥ישׁ יִשְׁקֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: The clods of the wadi are sweet to him, Everyone follows behind him, Innumerable are those who precede him.
verses.text_he: מָֽתְקוּ־ל֗וֹ רִגְבֵ֫י־נָ֥חַל וְ֭אַחֲרָיו כׇּל־אָדָ֣ם יִמְשׁ֑וֹךְ וּ֝לְפָנָ֗יו אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּֽר׃

verses.text_en: Why then do you offer me empty consolation? Of your replies only the perfidy remains.
verses.text_he: וְ֭אֵיךְ תְּנַחֲמ֣וּנִי הָ֑בֶל וּ֝תְשׁ֥וּבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם נִשְׁאַר־מָֽעַל׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַ֭יַּעַן אֱלִיפַ֥ז הַֽתֵּמָנִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: Can a man be of use to God, A wise man benefit Him?
verses.text_he: הַלְאֵ֥ל יִסְכׇּן־גָּ֑בֶר כִּֽי־יִסְכֹּ֖ן עָלֵ֣ימוֹ מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃

verses.text_en: Does Shaddai gain if you are righteous? Does He profit if your conduct is blameless?
verses.text_he: הַחֵ֣פֶץ לְ֭שַׁדַּי כִּ֣י תִצְדָּ֑ק וְאִם־בֶּ֝֗צַע כִּֽי־תַתֵּ֥ם דְּרָכֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: Is it because of your piety that He arraigns you, And enters into judgment with you?
verses.text_he: הֲֽ֭מִיִּרְאָ֣תְךָ יֹכִיחֶ֑ךָ יָב֥וֹא עִ֝מְּךָ֗ בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: You know that your wickedness is great, And that your iniquities have no limit.
verses.text_he: הֲלֹ֣א רָעָתְךָ֣ רַבָּ֑ה וְאֵֽין־קֵ֝֗ץ לַעֲוֺנֹתֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: You exact pledges from your fellows without reason, And leave them naked, stripped of their clothes;
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־תַחְבֹּ֣ל אַחֶ֣יךָ חִנָּ֑ם וּבִגְדֵ֖י עֲרוּמִּ֣ים תַּפְשִֽׁיט׃

verses.text_en: You do not give the thirsty water to drink; You deny bread to the hungry.
verses.text_he: לֹא־מַ֭יִם עָיֵ֣ף תַּשְׁקֶ֑ה וּ֝מֵרָעֵ֗ב תִּֽמְנַֽע־לָֽחֶם׃

verses.text_en: The land belongs to the strong; The privileged occupy it.
verses.text_he: וְאִ֣ישׁ זְ֭רוֹעַ ל֣וֹ הָאָ֑רֶץ וּנְשׂ֥וּא פָ֝נִ֗ים יֵ֣שֶׁב בָּֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: You have sent away widows empty-handed; The strength of the fatherless is broken.
verses.text_he: אַ֭לְמָנוֹת שִׁלַּ֣חְתָּ רֵיקָ֑ם וּזְרֹע֖וֹת יְתֹמִ֣ים יְדֻכָּֽא׃

verses.text_en: Therefore snares are all around you, And sudden terrors frighten you,
verses.text_he: עַל־כֵּ֭ן סְבִיבוֹתֶ֣יךָ פַחִ֑ים וִ֝יבַהֶלְךָ֗ פַּ֣חַד פִּתְאֹֽם׃

verses.text_en: Or darkness, so you cannot see; A flood of waters covers you.
verses.text_he: אוֹ־חֹ֥שֶׁךְ לֹֽא־תִרְאֶ֑ה וְֽשִׁפְעַת־מַ֥יִם תְּכַסֶּֽךָּ׃

verses.text_en: God is in the heavenly heights; See the highest stars, how lofty!
verses.text_he: הֲֽלֹא־אֱ֭לוֹהַּ גֹּ֣בַהּ שָׁמָ֑יִם וּרְאֵ֤ה רֹ֖אשׁ כּוֹכָבִ֣ים כִּי־רָֽמּוּ׃

verses.text_en: You say, “What can God know? Can He govern through the dense cloud?
verses.text_he: וְֽ֭אָמַרְתָּ מַה־יָּ֣דַֽע אֵ֑ל הַבְעַ֖ד עֲרָפֶ֣ל יִשְׁפּֽוֹט׃

verses.text_en: The clouds screen Him so He cannot see As He moves about the circuit of heaven.”
verses.text_he: עָבִ֣ים סֵֽתֶר־ל֭וֹ וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֶ֑ה וְח֥וּג שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם יִתְהַלָּֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: Have you observed the immemorial path That evil men have trodden;
verses.text_he: הַאֹ֣רַח עוֹלָ֣ם תִּשְׁמ֑וֹר אֲשֶׁ֖ר דָּרְכ֣וּ מְתֵי־אָֽוֶן׃

verses.text_en: How they were shriveled up before their time And their foundation poured out like a river?
verses.text_he: אֲשֶֽׁר־קֻמְּט֥וּ וְלֹא־עֵ֑ת נָ֝הָ֗ר יוּצַ֥ק יְסוֹדָֽם׃

verses.text_en: They said to God, “Leave us alone; What can Shaddai do about it?”
verses.text_he: הָאֹמְרִ֣ים לָ֭אֵל ס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וּמַה־יִּפְעַ֖ל שַׁדַּ֣י לָֽמוֹ׃

verses.text_en: But it was He who filled their houses with good things. (The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!)
verses.text_he: וְה֤וּא מִלֵּ֣א בָתֵּיהֶ֣ם ט֑וֹב וַעֲצַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים רָ֣חֲקָה מֶֽנִּי׃

verses.text_en: The righteous, seeing it, rejoiced; The innocent laughed with scorn.
verses.text_he: יִרְא֣וּ צַדִּיקִ֣ים וְיִשְׂמָ֑חוּ וְ֝נָקִ֗י יִלְעַג־לָֽמוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Surely their substance was destroyed, And their remnant consumed by fire.
verses.text_he: אִם־לֹ֣א נִכְחַ֣ד קִימָ֑נוּ וְ֝יִתְרָ֗ם אָ֣כְלָה אֵֽשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Be close to Him and wholehearted; Good things will come to you thereby.
verses.text_he: הַסְכֶּן־נָ֣א עִמּ֣וֹ וּשְׁלָ֑ם בָּ֝הֶ֗ם תְּֽבוֹאַתְךָ֥ טוֹבָֽה׃

verses.text_en: Accept instruction from His mouth; Lay up His words in your heart.
verses.text_he: קַח־נָ֣א מִפִּ֣יו תּוֹרָ֑ה וְשִׂ֥ים אֲ֝מָרָ֗יו בִּלְבָבֶֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: If you return to Shaddai you will be restored, If you banish iniquity from your tent;
verses.text_he: אִם־תָּשׁ֣וּב עַד־שַׁ֭דַּי תִּבָּנֶ֑ה תַּֽרְחִ֥יק עַ֝וְלָ֗ה מֵאׇהֳלֶֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: If you regard treasure as dirt, Ophir-gold as stones of the wadi,
verses.text_he: וְשִׁית־עַל־עָפָ֥ר בָּ֑צֶר וּכְצ֖וּר נְחָלִ֣ים אוֹפִֽיר׃

verses.text_en: And Shaddai be your treasure And precious silver for you,
verses.text_he: וְהָיָ֣ה שַׁדַּ֣י בְּצָרֶ֑יךָ וְכֶ֖סֶף תּוֹעָפ֣וֹת לָֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: When you seek the favor of Shaddai, And lift up your face to God,
verses.text_he: כִּי־אָ֭ז עַל־שַׁדַּ֣י תִּתְעַנָּ֑ג וְתִשָּׂ֖א אֶל־אֱל֣וֹהַּ פָּנֶֽיךָ׃

verses.text_en: You will pray to Him, and He will listen to you, And you will pay your vows.
verses.text_he: תַּעְתִּ֣יר אֵ֭לָיו וְיִשְׁמָעֶ֑ךָּ וּנְדָרֶ֥יךָ תְשַׁלֵּֽם׃

verses.text_en: You will decree and it will be fulfilled, And light will shine upon your affairs.
verses.text_he: וְֽתִגְזַר־אֹ֭מֶר וְיָ֣קׇם־לָ֑ךְ וְעַל־דְּ֝רָכֶ֗יךָ נָ֣גַהּ אֽוֹר׃

verses.text_en: When others sink low, you will say it is pride; For He saves the humble.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־הִ֭שְׁפִּילוּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר גֵּוָ֑ה וְשַׁ֖ח עֵינַ֣יִם יוֹשִֽׁעַ׃

verses.text_en: He will deliver the guilty; He will be delivered through the cleanness of your hands.
verses.text_he: יְמַלֵּ֥ט אִֽי־נָקִ֑י וְ֝נִמְלַ֗ט בְּבֹ֣ר כַּפֶּֽיךָ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Job said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: Today again my complaint is bitter; My strength is spent on account of my groaning.
verses.text_he: גַּם־הַ֭יּוֹם מְרִ֣י שִׂחִ֑י יָ֝דִ֗י כָּבְדָ֥ה עַל־אַנְחָתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Would that I knew how to reach Him, How to get to His dwelling-place.
verses.text_he: מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן יָ֭דַעְתִּי וְאֶמְצָאֵ֑הוּ אָ֝ב֗וֹא עַד־תְּכוּנָתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: I would set out my case before Him And fill my mouth with arguments.
verses.text_he: אֶעֶרְכָ֣ה לְפָנָ֣יו מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝פִ֗י אֲמַלֵּ֥א תוֹכָחֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: I would learn what answers He had for me And know how He would reply to me.
verses.text_he: אֵ֭דְעָה מִלִּ֣ים יַעֲנֵ֑נִי וְ֝אָבִ֗ינָה מַה־יֹּ֥אמַר לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Would He contend with me overbearingly? Surely He would not accuse me!
verses.text_he: הַבְּרׇב־כֹּ֭חַ יָרִ֣יב עִמָּדִ֑י לֹ֥א אַךְ־ה֝֗וּא יָשִׂ֥ם בִּֽי׃

verses.text_en: There the upright would be cleared by Him, And I would escape forever from my judge.
verses.text_he: שָׁ֗ם יָ֭שָׁר נוֹכָ֣ח עִמּ֑וֹ וַאֲפַלְּטָ֥ה לָ֝נֶ֗צַח מִשֹּׁפְטִֽי׃

verses.text_en: But if I go East—He is not there; West—I still do not perceive Him;
verses.text_he: הֵ֤ן קֶ֣דֶם אֶהֱלֹ֣ךְ וְאֵינֶ֑נּוּ וְ֝אָח֗וֹר וְֽלֹא־אָבִ֥ין לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: North—since He is concealed, I do not behold Him; South—He is hidden, and I cannot see Him.
verses.text_he: שְׂמֹ֣אול בַּעֲשֹׂת֣וֹ וְלֹא־אָ֑חַז יַעְטֹ֥ף יָ֝מִ֗ין וְלֹ֣א אֶרְאֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: But He knows the way I take; Would He assay me, I should emerge pure as gold.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־יָ֭דַע דֶּ֣רֶךְ עִמָּדִ֑י בְּ֝חָנַ֗נִי כַּזָּהָ֥ב אֵצֵֽא׃

verses.text_en: I have followed in His tracks, Kept His way without swerving,
verses.text_he: בַּ֭אֲשֻׁרוֹ אָחֲזָ֣ה רַגְלִ֑י דַּרְכּ֖וֹ שָׁמַ֣רְתִּי וְלֹא־אָֽט׃

verses.text_en: I have not deviated from what His lips commanded; I have treasured His words more than my daily bread.
verses.text_he: מִצְוַ֣ת שְׂ֭פָתָיו וְלֹ֣א אָמִ֑ישׁ מֵ֝חֻקִּ֗י צָפַ֥נְתִּי אִמְרֵי־פִֽיו׃

verses.text_en: He is one; who can dissuade Him? Whatever He desires, He does.
verses.text_he: וְה֣וּא בְ֭אֶחָד וּמִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ אִוְּתָ֣ה וַיָּֽעַשׂ׃

verses.text_en: For He will bring my term to an end, But He has many more such at His disposal.
verses.text_he: כִּ֭י יַשְׁלִ֣ים חֻקִּ֑י וְכָהֵ֖נָּה רַבּ֣וֹת עִמּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Therefore I am terrified at His presence; When I consider, I dread Him.
verses.text_he: עַל־כֵּ֭ן מִפָּנָ֣יו אֶבָּהֵ֑ל אֶ֝תְבּוֹנֵ֗ן וְאֶפְחַ֥ד מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: God has made me fainthearted; Shaddai has terrified me.
verses.text_he: וְ֭אֵל הֵרַ֣ךְ לִבִּ֑י וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י הִבְהִילָֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: Yet I am not cut off by the darkness; He has concealed the thick gloom from me.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־לֹ֣א נִ֭צְמַתִּי מִפְּנֵי־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וּ֝מִפָּנַ֗י כִּסָּה־אֹֽפֶל׃

verses.text_en: Why are times for judgment not reserved by Shaddai? Even those close to Him cannot foresee His actions.
verses.text_he: מַדּ֗וּעַ מִ֭שַּׁדַּי לֹא־נִצְפְּנ֣וּ עִתִּ֑ים וְ֝יֹדְעָ֗ו לֹא־חָ֥זוּ יָמָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: People remove boundary-stones; They carry off flocks and pasture them;
verses.text_he: גְּבֻל֥וֹת יַשִּׂ֑יגוּ עֵ֥דֶר גָּ֝זְל֗וּ וַיִּרְעֽוּ׃

verses.text_en: They lead away the donkeys of the fatherless, And seize the widow’s bull as a pledge;
verses.text_he: חֲמ֣וֹר יְתוֹמִ֣ים יִנְהָ֑גוּ יַ֝חְבְּל֗וּ שׁ֣וֹר אַלְמָנָֽה׃

verses.text_en: They chase the needy off the roads; All the poor of the land are forced into hiding.
verses.text_he: יַטּ֣וּ אֶבְיֹנִ֣ים מִדָּ֑רֶךְ יַ֥חַד חֻ֝בְּא֗וּ עֲנִיֵּי־אָֽרֶץ׃

verses.text_en: Like the wild asses of the wilderness, They go about their tasks, seeking food; The wilderness provides each with food for his lads;
verses.text_he: הֵ֤ן פְּרָאִ֨ים׀ בַּ֥מִּדְבָּ֗ר יָצְא֣וּ בְּ֭פׇעֳלָם מְשַׁחֲרֵ֣י לַטָּ֑רֶף עֲרָבָ֥ה ל֥וֹ לֶ֝֗חֶם לַנְּעָרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: They harvest fodder in the field, And glean the late grapes in the vineyards of the wicked.
verses.text_he: בַּ֭שָּׂדֶה בְּלִיל֣וֹ (יקצירו) [יִקְצ֑וֹרוּ] וְכֶ֖רֶם רָשָׁ֣ע יְלַקֵּֽשׁוּ׃

verses.text_en: They pass the night naked for lack of clothing, They have no covering against the cold;
verses.text_he: עָר֣וֹם יָ֭לִינוּ מִבְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת בַּקָּרָֽה׃

verses.text_en: They are drenched by the mountain rains, And huddle against the rock for lack of shelter.
verses.text_he: מִזֶּ֣רֶם הָרִ֣ים יִרְטָ֑בוּ וּֽמִבְּלִ֥י מַ֝חְסֶ֗ה חִבְּקוּ־צֽוּר׃

verses.text_en: They snatch the fatherless infant from the breast, And seize the child of the poor as a pledge.
verses.text_he: יִ֭גְזְלוּ מִשֹּׁ֣ד יָת֑וֹם וְֽעַל־עָנִ֥י יַחְבֹּֽלוּ׃

verses.text_en: They go about naked for lack of clothing, And, hungry, carry sheaves;
verses.text_he: עָר֣וֹם הִ֭לְּכוּ בְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וּ֝רְעֵבִ֗ים נָ֣שְׂאוּ עֹֽמֶר׃

verses.text_en: Between rows [of olive trees] they make oil, And, thirsty, they tread the winepresses.
verses.text_he: בֵּין־שׁוּרֹתָ֥ם יַצְהִ֑ירוּ יְקָבִ֥ים דָּ֝רְכ֗וּ וַיִּצְמָֽאוּ׃

verses.text_en: Men groan in the city; The souls of the dying cry out; Yet God does not regard it as a reproach.
verses.text_he: מֵ֘עִ֤יר מְתִ֨ים׀ יִנְאָ֗קוּ וְנֶֽפֶשׁ־חֲלָלִ֥ים תְּשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וֶ֝אֱל֗וֹהַּ לֹֽא־יָשִׂ֥ים תִּפְלָֽה׃

verses.text_en: They are rebels against the light; They are strangers to its ways, And do not stay in its path.
verses.text_he: הֵ֤מָּה׀ הָיוּ֮ בְּֽמֹרְדֵ֫י־א֥וֹר לֹא־הִכִּ֥ירוּ דְרָכָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יָ֝שְׁב֗וּ בִּנְתִיבֹתָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: The murderer arises in the evening To kill the poor and needy, And at night he acts the thief.
verses.text_he: לָא֡וֹר יָ֘ק֤וּם רוֹצֵ֗חַ יִֽקְטׇל־עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְי֑וֹן וּ֝בַלַּ֗יְלָה יְהִ֣י כַגַּנָּֽב׃

verses.text_en: The eyes of the adulterer watch for twilight, Thinking, “No one will glimpse me then.” He masks his face.
verses.text_he: וְעֵ֤ין נֹאֵ֨ף׀ שָׁ֤מְרָֽה־נֶ֣שֶׁף לֵ֭אמֹר לֹא־תְשׁוּרֵ֣נִי עָ֑יִן וְסֵ֖תֶר פָּנִ֣ים יָשִֽׂים׃

verses.text_en: In the dark they break into houses; By day they shut themselves in; They do not know the light.
verses.text_he: חָתַ֥ר בַּחֹ֗שֶׁךְ בָּ֫תִּ֥ים יוֹמָ֥ם חִתְּמוּ־לָ֗מוֹ לֹא־יָ֥דְעוּ אֽוֹר׃

verses.text_en: For all of them morning is darkness; It is then that they discern the terror of darkness.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י יַחְדָּ֨ו׀ בֹּ֣קֶר לָ֣מוֹ צַלְמָ֑וֶת כִּֽי־יַ֝כִּ֗יר בַּלְה֥וֹת צַלְמָֽוֶת׃

verses.text_en: May they be flotsam on the face of the water; May their portion in the land be cursed; May none turn aside by way of their vineyards.
verses.text_he: קַל־ה֤וּא׀ עַל־פְּנֵי־מַ֗יִם תְּקֻלַּ֣ל חֶלְקָתָ֣ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ לֹא־יִ֝פְנֶ֗ה דֶּ֣רֶךְ כְּרָמִֽים׃

verses.text_en: May drought and heat snatch away their snow waters, And Sheol, those who have sinned.
verses.text_he: צִיָּ֤ה גַם־חֹ֗ם יִגְזְל֥וּ מֵֽימֵי־שֶׁ֗לֶג שְׁא֣וֹל חָטָֽאוּ׃

verses.text_en: May the womb forget him; May he be sweet to the worms; May he be no longer remembered; May wrongdoers be broken like a tree.
verses.text_he: יִשְׁכָּ֘חֵ֤הוּ רֶ֨חֶם׀ מְתָ֘ק֤וֹ רִמָּ֗ה ע֥וֹד לֹֽא־יִזָּכֵ֑ר וַתִּשָּׁבֵ֖ר כָּעֵ֣ץ עַוְלָֽה׃

verses.text_en: May he consort with a barren woman who bears no child, Leave his widow deprived of good.
verses.text_he: רֹעֶ֣ה עֲ֭קָרָה לֹ֣א תֵלֵ֑ד וְ֝אַלְמָנָ֗ה לֹ֣א יְיֵטִֽיב׃

verses.text_en: Though he has the strength to seize bulls, May he live with no assurance of survival.
verses.text_he: וּמָשַׁ֣ךְ אַבִּירִ֣ים בְּכֹח֑וֹ יָ֝ק֗וּם וְֽלֹא־יַאֲמִ֥ין בַּחַיִּֽין׃

verses.text_en: Yet [God] gives him the security on which he relies, And keeps watch over his affairs.
verses.text_he: יִתֶּן־ל֣וֹ לָ֭בֶטַח וְיִשָּׁעֵ֑ן וְ֝עֵינֵ֗יהוּ עַל־דַּרְכֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Exalted for a while, let them be gone; Be brought low, and shrivel like mallows, And wither like the heads of grain.
verses.text_he: ר֤וֹמּוּ מְּעַ֨ט׀ וְֽאֵינֶ֗נּוּ וְֽהֻמְּכ֗וּ כַּכֹּ֥ל יִקָּפְצ֑וּן וּכְרֹ֖אשׁ שִׁבֹּ֣לֶת יִמָּֽלוּ׃

verses.text_en: Surely no one can confute me, Or prove that I am wrong.
verses.text_he: וְאִם־לֹ֣א אֵ֭פוֹ מִ֣י יַכְזִיבֵ֑נִי וְיָשֵׂ֥ם לְ֝אַ֗ל מִלָּתִֽי׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Bildad the Shuhite said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשֻּׁחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: Dominion and dread are His; He imposes peace in His heights.
verses.text_he: הַמְשֵׁ֣ל וָפַ֣חַד עִמּ֑וֹ עֹשֶׂ֥ה שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם בִּמְרוֹמָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: Can His troops be numbered? On whom does His light not shine?
verses.text_he: הֲיֵ֣שׁ מִ֭סְפָּר לִגְדוּדָ֑יו וְעַל־מִ֝֗י לֹא־יָק֥וּם אוֹרֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: How can man be in the right before God? How can one born of woman be cleared of guilt?
verses.text_he: וּמַה־יִּצְדַּ֣ק אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עִם־אֵ֑ל וּמַה־יִּ֝זְכֶּ֗ה יְל֣וּד אִשָּֽׁה׃

verses.text_en: Even the moon is not bright, And the stars are not pure in His sight.
verses.text_he: הֵ֣ן עַד־יָ֭רֵחַ וְלֹ֣א יַאֲהִ֑יל וְ֝כוֹכָבִ֗ים לֹא־זַכּ֥וּ בְעֵינָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: How much less man, a worm, The son-of-man, a maggot.
verses.text_he: אַ֭ף כִּֽי־אֱנ֣וֹשׁ רִמָּ֑ה וּבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם תּוֹלֵעָֽה׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Bildad the Shuhite said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשֻּׁחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: Dominion and dread are His; He imposes peace in His heights.
verses.text_he: הַמְשֵׁ֣ל וָפַ֣חַד עִמּ֑וֹ עֹשֶׂ֥ה שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם בִּמְרוֹמָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: Can His troops be numbered? On whom does His light not shine?
verses.text_he: הֲיֵ֣שׁ מִ֭סְפָּר לִגְדוּדָ֑יו וְעַל־מִ֝֗י לֹא־יָק֥וּם אוֹרֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: How can man be in the right before God? How can one born of woman be cleared of guilt?
verses.text_he: וּמַה־יִּצְדַּ֣ק אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עִם־אֵ֑ל וּמַה־יִּ֝זְכֶּ֗ה יְל֣וּד אִשָּֽׁה׃

verses.text_en: Even the moon is not bright, And the stars are not pure in His sight.
verses.text_he: הֵ֣ן עַד־יָ֭רֵחַ וְלֹ֣א יַאֲהִ֑יל וְ֝כוֹכָבִ֗ים לֹא־זַכּ֥וּ בְעֵינָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: How much less man, a worm, The son-of-man, a maggot.
verses.text_he: אַ֭ף כִּֽי־אֱנ֣וֹשׁ רִמָּ֑ה וּבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם תּוֹלֵעָֽה׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Then Job said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: You would help without having the strength; You would deliver with arms that have no power.
verses.text_he: מֶה־עָזַ֥רְתָּ לְלֹא־כֹ֑חַ ה֝וֹשַׁ֗עְתָּ זְר֣וֹעַ לֹא־עֹֽז׃

verses.text_en: Without having the wisdom, you offer advice And freely give your counsel.
verses.text_he: מַה־יָּ֭עַצְתָּ לְלֹ֣א חׇכְמָ֑ה וְ֝תֻשִׁיָּ֗ה לָרֹ֥ב הוֹדָֽעְתָּ׃

verses.text_en: To whom have you addressed words? Whose breath issued from you?
verses.text_he: אֶת־מִ֭י הִגַּ֣דְתָּ מִלִּ֑ין וְנִשְׁמַת־מִ֝֗י יָצְאָ֥ה מִמֶּֽךָּ׃

verses.text_en: The shades tremble Beneath the waters and their denizens.
verses.text_he: הָרְפָאִ֥ים יְחוֹלָ֑לוּ מִתַּ֥חַת מַ֝֗יִם וְשֹׁכְנֵיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: Sheol is naked before Him; Abaddon has no cover.
verses.text_he: עָר֣וֹם שְׁא֣וֹל נֶגְדּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת לָאֲבַדּֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: He it is who stretched out Zaphon over chaos, Who suspended earth over emptiness.
verses.text_he: נֹטֶ֣ה צָפ֣וֹן עַל־תֹּ֑הוּ תֹּ֥לֶה אֶ֝֗רֶץ עַל־בְּלִי־מָֽה׃

verses.text_en: He wrapped up the waters in His clouds; Yet no cloud burst under their weight.
verses.text_he: צֹרֵֽר־מַ֥יִם בְּעָבָ֑יו וְלֹֽא־נִבְקַ֖ע עָנָ֣ן תַּחְתָּֽם׃

verses.text_en: He shuts off the view of His throne, Spreading His cloud over it.
verses.text_he: מְאַחֵ֥ז פְּנֵֽי־כִסֵּ֑ה פַּרְשֵׁ֖ז עָלָ֣יו עֲנָנֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He drew a boundary on the surface of the waters, At the extreme where light and darkness meet.
verses.text_he: חֹֽק־חָ֭ג עַל־פְּנֵי־מָ֑יִם עַד־תַּכְלִ֖ית א֣וֹר עִם־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃

verses.text_en: The pillars of heaven tremble, Astounded at His blast.
verses.text_he: עַמּוּדֵ֣י שָׁמַ֣יִם יְרוֹפָ֑פוּ וְ֝יִתְמְה֗וּ מִגַּעֲרָתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: By His power He stilled the sea; By His skill He struck down Rahab.
verses.text_he: בְּ֭כֹחוֹ רָגַ֣ע הַיָּ֑ם (ובתובנתו) [וּ֝בִתְבוּנָת֗וֹ] מָ֣חַץ רָֽהַב׃

verses.text_en: By His wind the heavens were calmed; His hand pierced the Elusive Serpent.
verses.text_he: בְּ֭רוּחוֹ שָׁמַ֣יִם שִׁפְרָ֑ה חֹלְלָ֥ה יָ֝ד֗וֹ נָחָ֥שׁ בָּרִֽחַ׃

verses.text_en: These are but glimpses of His rule, The mere whisper that we perceive of Him; Who can absorb the thunder of His mighty deeds?
verses.text_he: הֶן־אֵ֤לֶּה׀ קְצ֬וֹת דְּרָכָ֗ו וּמַה־שֵּׁ֣מֶץ דָּ֭בָר נִשְׁמַע־בּ֑וֹ וְרַ֥עַם גְּ֝בוּרֹתָ֗ו מִ֣י יִתְבּוֹנָֽן׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Job again took up his theme and said:
verses.text_he: וַיֹּ֣סֶף אִ֭יּוֹב שְׂאֵ֥ת מְשָׁל֗וֹ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: By God who has deprived me of justice! By Shaddai who has embittered my life!
verses.text_he: חַי־אֵ֭ל הֵסִ֣יר מִשְׁפָּטִ֑י וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י הֵמַ֥ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃

verses.text_en: As long as there is life in me, And God’s breath is in my nostrils,
verses.text_he: כִּי־כׇל־ע֣וֹד נִשְׁמָתִ֣י בִ֑י וְר֖וּחַ אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּאַפִּֽי׃

verses.text_en: My lips will speak no wrong, Nor my tongue utter deceit.
verses.text_he: אִם־תְּדַבֵּ֣רְנָה שְׂפָתַ֣י עַוְלָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנִ֗י אִם־יֶהְגֶּ֥ה רְמִיָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: Far be it from me to say you are right; Until I die I will maintain my integrity.
verses.text_he: חָלִ֣ילָה לִּי֮ אִם־אַצְדִּ֢יק אֶ֫תְכֶ֥ם עַד־אֶגְוָ֑ע לֹֽא־אָסִ֖יר תֻּמָּתִ֣י מִמֶּֽנִּי׃

verses.text_en: I persist in my righteousness and will not yield; I shall be free of reproach as long as I live.
verses.text_he: בְּצִדְקָתִ֣י הֶ֭חֱזַקְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אַרְפֶּ֑הָ לֹא־יֶחֱרַ֥ף לְ֝בָבִ֗י מִיָּמָֽי׃

verses.text_en: May my enemy be as the wicked; My assailant, as the wrongdoer.
verses.text_he: יְהִ֣י כְ֭רָשָׁע אֹ֣יְבִ֑י וּמִתְקוֹמְמִ֥י כְעַוָּֽל׃

verses.text_en: For what hope has the impious man when he is cut down, When God takes away his life?
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י מַה־תִּקְוַ֣ת חָ֭נֵף כִּ֣י יִבְצָ֑ע כִּ֤י יֵ֖שֶׁל אֱל֣וֹהַּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Will God hear his cry When trouble comes upon him,
verses.text_he: הֲֽ֭צַעֲקָתוֹ יִשְׁמַ֥ע׀אֵ֑ל כִּֽי־תָב֖וֹא עָלָ֣יו צָרָֽה׃

verses.text_en: When he seeks the favor of Shaddai, Calls upon God at all times?
verses.text_he: אִם־עַל־שַׁדַּ֥י יִתְעַנָּ֑ג יִקְרָ֖א אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּכׇל־עֵֽת׃

verses.text_en: I will teach you what is in God’s power, And what is with Shaddai I will not conceal.
verses.text_he: אוֹרֶ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֣ם בְּיַד־אֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִם־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י לֹ֣א אֲכַחֵֽד׃

verses.text_en: All of you have seen it, So why talk nonsense?
verses.text_he: הֵן־אַתֶּ֣ם כֻּלְּכֶ֣ם חֲזִיתֶ֑ם וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֝֗ה הֶ֣בֶל תֶּהְבָּֽלוּ׃

verses.text_en: This is the evil man’s portion from God, The lot that the ruthless receive from Shaddai:
verses.text_he: זֶ֤ה׀ חֵלֶק־אָדָ֖ם רָשָׁ֥ע׀עִם־אֵ֑ל וְֽנַחֲלַ֥ת עָ֝רִיצִ֗ים מִשַּׁדַּ֥י יִקָּֽחוּ׃

verses.text_en: Should he have many sons—they are marked for the sword; His descendants will never have their fill of bread;
verses.text_he: אִם־יִרְבּ֣וּ בָנָ֣יו לְמוֹ־חָ֑רֶב וְ֝צֶאֱצָאָ֗יו לֹ֣א יִשְׂבְּעוּ־לָֽחֶם׃

verses.text_en: Those who survive him will be buried in a plague, And their widows will not weep;
verses.text_he: שְׂ֭רִידָו בַּמָּ֣וֶת יִקָּבֵ֑רוּ וְ֝אַלְמְנֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִבְכֶּֽינָה׃

verses.text_en: Should he pile up silver like dust, Lay up clothing like dirt—
verses.text_he: אִם־יִצְבֹּ֣ר כֶּעָפָ֣ר כָּ֑סֶף וְ֝כַחֹ֗מֶר יָכִ֥ין מַלְבּֽוּשׁ׃

verses.text_en: He may lay it up, but the righteous will wear it, And the innocent will share the silver.
verses.text_he: יָ֭כִין וְצַדִּ֣יק יִלְבָּ֑שׁ וְ֝כֶ֗סֶף נָקִ֥י יַחֲלֹֽק׃

verses.text_en: The house he built is like a bird’s nest, Like the booth a watchman makes.
verses.text_he: בָּנָ֣ה כָעָ֣שׁ בֵּית֑וֹ וּ֝כְסֻכָּ֗ה עָשָׂ֥ה נֹצֵֽר׃

verses.text_en: He lies down, a rich man, with [his wealth] intact; When he opens his eyes it is gone.
verses.text_he: עָשִׁ֣יר יִ֭שְׁכַּב וְלֹ֣א יֵאָסֵ֑ף עֵינָ֖יו פָּקַ֣ח וְאֵינֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: Terror overtakes him like a flood; A storm wind makes off with him by night.
verses.text_he: תַּשִּׂיגֵ֣הוּ כַ֭מַּיִם בַּלָּה֑וֹת לַ֝֗יְלָה גְּנָבַ֥תּוּ סוּפָֽה׃

verses.text_en: The east wind carries him far away, and he is gone; It sweeps him from his place.
verses.text_he: יִשָּׂאֵ֣הוּ קָדִ֣ים וְיֵלַ֑ךְ וִ֝ישָׂעֲרֵ֗הוּ מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Then it hurls itself at him without mercy; He tries to escape from its force.
verses.text_he: וְיַשְׁלֵ֣ךְ עָ֭לָיו וְלֹ֣א יַחְמֹ֑ל מִ֝יָּד֗וֹ בָּר֥וֹחַ יִבְרָֽח׃

verses.text_en: It claps its hands at him, And whistles at him from its place.
verses.text_he: יִשְׂפֹּ֣ק עָלֵ֣ימוֹ כַפֵּ֑ימוֹ וְיִשְׁרֹ֥ק עָ֝לָ֗יו מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: There is a mine for silver, And a place where gold is refined.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י יֵ֣שׁ לַכֶּ֣סֶף מוֹצָ֑א וּ֝מָק֗וֹם לַזָּהָ֥ב יָזֹֽקּוּ׃

verses.text_en: Iron is taken out of the earth, And copper smelted from rock.
verses.text_he: בַּ֭רְזֶל מֵעָפָ֣ר יֻקָּ֑ח וְ֝אֶ֗בֶן יָצ֥וּק נְחוּשָֽׁה׃

verses.text_en: He sets bounds for darkness; To every limit man probes, To rocks in deepest darkness.
verses.text_he: קֵ֤ץ׀ שָׂ֤ם לַחֹ֗שֶׁךְ וּֽלְכׇל־תַּ֭כְלִית ה֣וּא חוֹקֵ֑ר אֶ֖בֶן אֹ֣פֶל וְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃

verses.text_en: They open up a shaft far from where men live, [In places] forgotten by wayfarers, Destitute of men, far removed.
verses.text_he: פָּ֤רַץ נַ֨חַל׀ מֵֽעִם־גָּ֗ר הַֽנִּשְׁכָּחִ֥ים מִנִּי־רָ֑גֶל דַּ֖לּוּ מֵאֱנ֣וֹשׁ נָֽעוּ׃

verses.text_en: Earth, out of which food grows, Is changed below as if into fire.
verses.text_he: אֶ֗רֶץ מִמֶּ֥נָּה יֵֽצֵא־לָ֑חֶם וְ֝תַחְתֶּ֗יהָ נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ כְּמוֹ־אֵֽשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Its rocks are a source of sapphires; It contains gold dust too.
verses.text_he: מְקוֹם־סַפִּ֥יר אֲבָנֶ֑יהָ וְעַפְרֹ֖ת זָהָ֣ב לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: No bird of prey knows the path to it; The falcon’s eye has not gazed upon it.
verses.text_he: נָ֭תִיב לֹא־יְדָ֣עוֹ עָ֑יִט וְלֹ֥א שְׁ֝זָפַ֗תּוּ עֵ֣ין אַיָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: The proud beasts have not reached it; The lion has not crossed it.
verses.text_he: לֹֽא־הִדְרִיכ֥וּהוּ בְנֵי־שָׁ֑חַץ לֹֽא־עָדָ֖ה עָלָ֣יו שָֽׁחַל׃

verses.text_en: Man sets his hand against the flinty rock And overturns mountains by the roots.
verses.text_he: בַּ֭חַלָּמִישׁ שָׁלַ֣ח יָד֑וֹ הָפַ֖ךְ מִשֹּׁ֣רֶשׁ הָרִֽים׃

verses.text_en: He carves out channels through rock; His eyes behold every precious thing.
verses.text_he: בַּ֭צּוּרוֹת יְאֹרִ֣ים בִּקֵּ֑עַ וְכׇל־יְ֝קָ֗ר רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He dams up the sources of the streams So that hidden things may be brought to light.
verses.text_he: מִ֭בְּכִי נְהָר֣וֹת חִבֵּ֑שׁ וְ֝תַעֲלֻמָ֗הּ יֹ֣צִא אֽוֹר׃{פ}

verses.text_en: But where can wisdom be found; Where is the source of understanding?
verses.text_he: וְֽ֭הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַ֣יִן תִּמָּצֵ֑א וְאֵ֥י זֶ֝֗ה מְק֣וֹם בִּינָֽה׃

verses.text_en: No man can set a value on it; It cannot be found in the land of the living.
verses.text_he: לֹא־יָדַ֣ע אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עֶרְכָּ֑הּ וְלֹ֥א תִ֝מָּצֵ֗א בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַחַיִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: The deep says, “It is not in me”; The sea says, “I do not have it.”
verses.text_he: תְּה֣וֹם אָ֭מַר לֹ֣א בִי־הִ֑יא וְיָ֥ם אָ֝מַ֗ר אֵ֣ין עִמָּדִֽי׃

verses.text_en: It cannot be bartered for gold; Silver cannot be paid out as its price.
verses.text_he: לֹא־יֻתַּ֣ן סְג֣וֹר תַּחְתֶּ֑יהָ וְלֹ֥א יִ֝שָּׁקֵ֗ל כֶּ֣סֶף מְחִירָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: The finest gold of Ophir cannot be weighed against it, Nor precious onyx, nor sapphire.
verses.text_he: לֹא־תְ֭סֻלֶּה בְּכֶ֣תֶם אוֹפִ֑יר בְּשֹׁ֖הַם יָקָ֣ר וְסַפִּֽיר׃

verses.text_en: Gold or glass cannot match its value, Nor vessels of fine gold be exchanged for it.
verses.text_he: לֹא־יַעַרְכֶ֣נָּה זָ֭הָב וּזְכוֹכִ֑ית וּתְמ֖וּרָתָ֣הּ כְּלִי־פָֽז׃

verses.text_en: Coral and crystal cannot be mentioned with it; A pouch of wisdom is better than rubies.
verses.text_he: רָאמ֣וֹת וְ֭גָבִישׁ לֹ֣א יִזָּכֵ֑ר וּמֶ֥שֶׁךְ חׇ֝כְמָ֗ה מִפְּנִינִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Topaz from Nubia cannot match its value; Pure gold cannot be weighed against it.
verses.text_he: לֹֽא־יַ֭עַרְכֶנָּה פִּטְדַת־כּ֑וּשׁ בְּכֶ֥תֶם טָ֝ה֗וֹר לֹ֣א תְסֻלֶּֽה׃

verses.text_en: But whence does wisdom come? Where is the source of understanding?
verses.text_he: וְֽ֭הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַ֣יִן תָּב֑וֹא וְאֵ֥י זֶ֝֗ה מְק֣וֹם בִּינָֽה׃

verses.text_en: It is hidden from the eyes of all living, Concealed from the fowl of heaven.
verses.text_he: וְֽ֭נֶעֶלְמָה מֵעֵינֵ֣י כׇל־חָ֑י וּמֵע֖וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם נִסְתָּֽרָה׃

verses.text_en: Abaddon and Death say, “We have only a report of it.”
verses.text_he: אֲבַדּ֣וֹן וָ֭מָוֶת אָ֣מְר֑וּ בְּ֝אׇזְנֵ֗ינוּ שָׁמַ֥עְנוּ שִׁמְעָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: God understands the way to it; He knows its source;
verses.text_he: אֱ֭לֹהִים הֵבִ֣ין דַּרְכָּ֑הּ וְ֝ה֗וּא יָדַ֥ע אֶת־מְקוֹמָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: For He sees to the ends of the earth, Observes all that is beneath the heavens.
verses.text_he: כִּי־ה֭וּא לִקְצוֹת־הָאָ֣רֶץ יַבִּ֑יט תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִרְאֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: When He fixed the weight of the winds, Set the measure of the waters;
verses.text_he: לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לָר֣וּחַ מִשְׁקָ֑ל וּ֝מַ֗יִם תִּכֵּ֥ן בְּמִדָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: When He made a rule for the rain And a course for the thunderstorms,
verses.text_he: בַּעֲשֹׂת֣וֹ לַמָּטָ֣ר חֹ֑ק וְ֝דֶ֗רֶךְ לַחֲזִ֥יז קֹלֽוֹת׃

verses.text_en: Then He saw it and gauged it; He measured it and probed it.
verses.text_he: אָ֣ז רָ֭אָהּ וַֽיְסַפְּרָ֑הּ הֱ֝כִינָ֗הּ וְגַם־חֲקָרָֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: He said to man, “See! Fear of the Lord is wisdom; To shun evil is understanding.”
verses.text_he: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר׀ לָאָדָ֗ם הֵ֤ן יִרְאַ֣ת אֲ֭דֹנָי הִ֣יא חׇכְמָ֑ה וְס֖וּר מֵרָ֣ע בִּינָֽה׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Job again took up his theme and said:
verses.text_he: וַיֹּ֣סֶף אִ֭יּוֹב שְׂאֵ֥ת מְשָׁל֗וֹ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: O that I were as in months gone by, In the days when God watched over me,
verses.text_he: מִֽי־יִתְּנֵ֥נִי כְיַרְחֵי־קֶ֑דֶם כִּ֝ימֵ֗י אֱל֣וֹהַּ יִשְׁמְרֵֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: When His lamp shone over my head, When I walked in the dark by its light,
verses.text_he: בְּהִלּ֣וֹ נֵ֭רוֹ עֲלֵ֣י רֹאשִׁ֑י לְ֝אוֹר֗וֹ אֵ֣לֶךְ חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃

verses.text_en: When I was in my prime, When God’s company graced my tent,
verses.text_he: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר הָ֭יִיתִי בִּימֵ֣י חׇרְפִּ֑י בְּס֥וֹד אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ עֲלֵ֣י אׇהֳלִֽי׃

verses.text_en: When Shaddai was still with me, When my lads surrounded me,
verses.text_he: בְּע֣וֹד שַׁ֭דַּי עִמָּדִ֑י סְבִ֖יבוֹתַ֣י נְעָרָֽי׃

verses.text_en: When my feet were bathed in cream, And rocks poured out streams of oil for me.
verses.text_he: בִּרְחֹ֣ץ הֲלִיכַ֣י בְּחֵמָ֑ה וְצ֥וּר יָצ֥וּק עִ֝מָּדִ֗י פַּלְגֵי־שָֽׁמֶן׃

verses.text_en: When I passed through the city gates To take my seat in the square,
verses.text_he: בְּצֵ֣אתִי שַׁ֣עַר עֲלֵי־קָ֑רֶת בָּ֝רְח֗וֹב אָכִ֥ין מוֹשָׁבִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Young men saw me and hid, Elders rose and stood;
verses.text_he: רָא֣וּנִי נְעָרִ֣ים וְנֶחְבָּ֑אוּ וִ֝ישִׁישִׁ֗ים קָ֣מוּ עָמָֽדוּ׃

verses.text_en: Nobles held back their words; They clapped their hands to their mouths.
verses.text_he: שָׂ֭רִים עָצְר֣וּ בְמִלִּ֑ים וְ֝כַ֗ף יָשִׂ֥ימוּ לְפִיהֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: The voices of princes were hushed; Their tongues stuck to their palates.
verses.text_he: קוֹל־נְגִידִ֥ים נֶחְבָּ֑אוּ וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם לְחִכָּ֥ם דָּבֵֽקָה׃

verses.text_en: The ear that heard me acclaimed me; The eye that saw, commended me.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י אֹ֣זֶן שָׁ֭מְעָה וַֽתְּאַשְּׁרֵ֑נִי וְעַ֥יִן רָ֝אֲתָ֗ה וַתְּעִידֵֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: For I saved the poor man who cried out, The orphan who had none to help him.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־אֲ֭מַלֵּט עָנִ֣י מְשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וְ֝יָת֗וֹם וְֽלֹא־עֹזֵ֥ר לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: I received the blessing of the lost; I gladdened the heart of the widow.
verses.text_he: בִּרְכַּ֣ת אֹ֭בֵד עָלַ֣י תָּבֹ֑א וְלֵ֖ב אַלְמָנָ֣ה אַרְנִֽן׃

verses.text_en: I clothed myself in righteousness and it robed me; Justice was my cloak and turban.
verses.text_he: צֶ֣דֶק לָ֭בַשְׁתִּי וַיִּלְבָּשֵׁ֑נִי כִּֽמְעִ֥יל וְ֝צָנִ֗יף מִשְׁפָּטִֽי׃

verses.text_en: I was eyes to the blind And feet to the lame.
verses.text_he: עֵינַ֣יִם הָ֭יִיתִי לַעִוֵּ֑ר וְרַגְלַ֖יִם לַפִּסֵּ֣חַ אָֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: I was a father to the needy, And I looked into the case of the stranger.
verses.text_he: אָ֣ב אָ֭נֹכִֽי לָאֶבְיוֹנִ֑ים וְרִ֖ב לֹא־יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶחְקְרֵֽהוּ׃

verses.text_en: I broke the jaws of the wrongdoer, And I wrested prey from his teeth.
verses.text_he: וָ֭אֲשַׁבְּרָה מְתַלְּע֣וֹת עַוָּ֑ל וּ֝מִשִּׁנָּ֗יו אַשְׁלִ֥יךְ טָֽרֶף׃

verses.text_en: I thought I would end my days with my family, And be as long-lived as the phoenix,
verses.text_he: וָ֭אֹמַר עִם־קִנִּ֣י אֶגְוָ֑ע וְ֝כַח֗וֹל אַרְבֶּ֥ה יָמִֽים׃

verses.text_en: My roots reaching water, And dew lying on my branches;
verses.text_he: שׇׁרְשִׁ֣י פָת֣וּחַ אֱלֵי־מָ֑יִם וְ֝טַ֗ל יָלִ֥ין בִּקְצִירִֽי׃

verses.text_en: My vigor refreshed, My bow ever new in my hand.
verses.text_he: כְּ֭בוֹדִי חָדָ֣שׁ עִמָּדִ֑י וְ֝קַשְׁתִּ֗י בְּיָדִ֥י תַחֲלִֽיף׃

verses.text_en: Men would listen to me expectantly, And wait for my counsel.
verses.text_he: לִֽי־שָׁמְע֥וּ וְיִחֵ֑לּוּ וְ֝יִדְּמ֗וּ לְמ֣וֹ עֲצָתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: After I spoke they had nothing to say; My words were as drops [of dew] upon them.
verses.text_he: אַחֲרֵ֣י דְ֭בָרִי לֹ֣א יִשְׁנ֑וּ וְ֝עָלֵ֗ימוֹ תִּטֹּ֥ף מִלָּתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: They waited for me as for rain, For the late rain, their mouths open wide.
verses.text_he: וְיִחֲל֣וּ כַמָּטָ֣ר לִ֑י וּ֝פִיהֶ֗ם פָּעֲר֥וּ לְמַלְקֽוֹשׁ׃

verses.text_en: When I smiled at them, they would not believe it; They never expected a sign of my favor.
verses.text_he: אֶשְׂחַ֣ק אֲ֭לֵהֶם לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֑ינוּ וְא֥וֹר פָּ֝נַ֗י לֹ֣א יַפִּילֽוּן׃

verses.text_en: I decided their course and presided over them; I lived like a king among his troops, Like one who consoles mourners.
verses.text_he: אֶ֥בְחַ֣ר דַּרְכָּם֮ וְאֵשֵׁ֢ב רֹ֥֫אשׁ וְ֭אֶשְׁכּוֹן כְּמֶ֣לֶךְ בַּגְּד֑וּד כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲבֵלִ֣ים יְנַחֵֽם׃

verses.text_en: But now those younger than I deride me, [Men] whose fathers I would have disdained to put among my sheep dogs.
verses.text_he: וְעַתָּ֤ה׀ שָׂ֥חֲק֣וּ עָלַי֮ צְעִירִ֥ים מִמֶּ֗נִּי לְיָ֫מִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־מָאַ֥סְתִּי אֲבוֹתָ֑ם לָ֝שִׁ֗ית עִם־כַּלְבֵ֥י צֹאנִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Of what use to me is the strength of their hands? All their vigor is gone.
verses.text_he: גַּם־כֹּ֣חַ יְ֭דֵיהֶם לָ֣מָּה לִּ֑י עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ אָ֣בַד כָּֽלַח׃

verses.text_en: Wasted from want and starvation, They flee to a parched land, To the gloom of desolate wasteland.
verses.text_he: בְּחֶ֥סֶר וּבְכָפָ֗ן גַּ֫לְמ֥וּד הַעֹרְקִ֥ים צִיָּ֑ה אֶ֝֗מֶשׁ שׁוֹאָ֥ה וּמְשֹׁאָֽה׃

verses.text_en: They pluck saltwort and wormwood; The roots of broom are their food.
verses.text_he: הַקֹּטְפִ֣ים מַלּ֣וּחַ עֲלֵי־שִׂ֑יחַ וְשֹׁ֖רֶשׁ רְתָמִ֣ים לַחְמָֽם׃

verses.text_en: Driven out from society, They are cried at like a thief.
verses.text_he: מִן־גֵּ֥ו יְגֹרָ֑שׁוּ יָרִ֥יעוּ עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ כַּגַּנָּֽב׃

verses.text_en: They live in the gullies of wadis, In holes in the ground, and in rocks,
verses.text_he: בַּעֲר֣וּץ נְחָלִ֣ים לִשְׁכֹּ֑ן חֹרֵ֖י עָפָ֣ר וְכֵפִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Braying among the bushes, Huddling among the nettles,
verses.text_he: בֵּין־שִׂיחִ֥ים יִנְהָ֑קוּ תַּ֖חַת חָר֣וּל יְסֻפָּֽחוּ׃

verses.text_en: Scoundrels, nobodies, Stricken from the earth.
verses.text_he: בְּֽנֵי־נָ֭בָל גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י בְלִי־שֵׁ֑ם נִ֝כְּא֗וּ מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃

verses.text_en: Now I am the butt of their gibes; I have become a byword to them.
verses.text_he: וְ֭עַתָּה נְגִינָתָ֣ם הָיִ֑יתִי וָאֱהִ֖י לָהֶ֣ם לְמִלָּֽה׃

verses.text_en: They abhor me; they keep their distance from me; They do not withhold spittle from my face.
verses.text_he: תִּ֭עֲבוּנִי רָ֣חֲקוּ מֶ֑נִּי וּ֝מִפָּנַ֗י לֹא־חָ֥שְׂכוּ רֹֽק׃

verses.text_en: Because God has disarmed and humbled me, They have thrown off restraint in my presence.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־[יִתְרִ֣י] (יתרו) פִ֭תַּח וַיְעַנֵּ֑נִי וְ֝רֶ֗סֶן מִפָּנַ֥י שִׁלֵּֽחוּ׃

verses.text_en: Mere striplings assail me at my right hand: They put me to flight; They build their roads for my ruin.
verses.text_he: עַל־יָמִין֮ פִּרְחַ֢ח יָ֫ק֥וּמוּ רַגְלַ֥י שִׁלֵּ֑חוּ וַיָּסֹ֥לּוּ עָ֝לַ֗י אׇרְח֥וֹת אֵידָֽם׃

verses.text_en: They tear up my path; They promote my fall, Although it does them no good.
verses.text_he: נָֽתְס֗וּ נְֽתִיבָ֫תִ֥י לְהַוָּתִ֥י יֹעִ֑ילוּ לֹ֖א עֹזֵ֣ר לָֽמוֹ׃

verses.text_en: They come as through a wide breach; They roll in like raging billows.
verses.text_he: כְּפֶ֣רֶץ רָחָ֣ב יֶאֱתָ֑יוּ תַּ֥חַת שֹׁ֝אָ֗ה הִתְגַּלְגָּֽלוּ׃

verses.text_en: Terror tumbles upon me; It sweeps away my honor like the wind; My dignity vanishes like a cloud.
verses.text_he: הׇהְפַּ֥ךְ עָלַ֗י בַּלָּ֫ה֥וֹת תִּרְדֹּ֣ף כָּ֭רוּחַ נְדִבָתִ֑י וּ֝כְעָ֗ב עָבְרָ֥ה יְשֻׁעָתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: So now my life runs out; Days of misery have taken hold of me.
verses.text_he: וְעַתָּ֗ה עָ֭לַי תִּשְׁתַּפֵּ֣ךְ נַפְשִׁ֑י יֹ֖אחֲז֣וּנִי יְמֵי־עֹֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: By night my bones feel gnawed; My sinews never rest.
verses.text_he: לַ֗יְלָה עֲ֭צָמַי נִקַּ֣ר מֵעָלָ֑י וְ֝עֹרְקַ֗י לֹ֣א יִשְׁכָּבֽוּן׃

verses.text_en: With great effort I change clothing; The neck of my tunic fits my waist.
verses.text_he: בְּרׇב־כֹּ֭חַ יִתְחַפֵּ֣שׂ לְבוּשִׁ֑י כְּפִ֖י כֻתׇּנְתִּ֣י יַאַזְרֵֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: He regarded me as clay, I have become like dust and ashes.
verses.text_he: הֹרָ֥נִי לַחֹ֑מֶר וָ֝אֶתְמַשֵּׁ֗ל כֶּעָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃

verses.text_en: I cry out to You, but You do not answer me; I wait, but You do [not] consider me.
verses.text_he: אֲשַׁוַּ֣ע אֵ֭לֶיךָ וְלֹ֣א תַעֲנֵ֑נִי עָ֝מַ֗דְתִּי וַתִּתְבֹּ֥נֶן בִּֽי׃

verses.text_en: You have become cruel to me; With Your powerful hand You harass me.
verses.text_he: תֵּהָפֵ֣ךְ לְאַכְזָ֣ר לִ֑י בְּעֹ֖צֶם יָדְךָ֣ תִשְׂטְמֵֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: You lift me up and mount me on the wind; You make my courage melt.
verses.text_he: תִּשָּׂאֵ֣נִי אֶל־ר֭וּחַ תַּרְכִּיבֵ֑נִי וּ֝תְמֹגְגֵ֗נִי (תשוה) [תּוּשִׁיָּֽה]׃

verses.text_en: I know You will bring me to death, The house assigned for all the living.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־יָ֭דַעְתִּי מָ֣וֶת תְּשִׁיבֵ֑נִי וּבֵ֖ית מוֹעֵ֣ד לְכׇל־חָֽי׃

verses.text_en: Surely He would not strike at a ruin If, in calamity, one cried out to Him.
verses.text_he: אַ֣ךְ לֹֽא־בְ֭עִי יִשְׁלַח־יָ֑ד אִם־בְּ֝פִיד֗וֹ לָהֶ֥ן שֽׁוּעַ׃

verses.text_en: Did I not weep for the unfortunate? Did I not grieve for the needy?
verses.text_he: אִם־לֹ֣א בָ֭כִיתִי לִקְשֵׁה־י֑וֹם עָֽגְמָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: I looked forward to good fortune, but evil came; I hoped for light, but darkness came.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י ט֣וֹב קִ֭וִּיתִי וַיָּ֣בֹא רָ֑ע וַאֲיַחֲלָ֥ה לְ֝א֗וֹר וַיָּ֥בֹא אֹֽפֶל׃

verses.text_en: My bowels are in turmoil without respite; Days of misery confront me.
verses.text_he: מֵעַ֖י רֻתְּח֥וּ וְלֹא־דָ֗מּוּ קִדְּמֻ֥נִי יְמֵי־עֹֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: I walk about in sunless gloom; I rise in the assembly and cry out.
verses.text_he: קֹדֵ֣ר הִ֭לַּכְתִּי בְּלֹ֣א חַמָּ֑ה קַ֖מְתִּי בַקָּהָ֣ל אֲשַׁוֵּֽעַ׃

verses.text_en: I have become a brother to jackals, A companion to ostriches.
verses.text_he: אָ֭ח הָיִ֣יתִי לְתַנִּ֑ים וְ֝רֵ֗עַ לִבְנ֥וֹת יַעֲנָֽה׃

verses.text_en: My skin, blackened, is peeling off me; My bones are charred by the heat.
verses.text_he: ע֭וֹרִי שָׁחַ֣ר מֵעָלָ֑י וְעַצְמִי־חָ֝֗רָה מִנִּי־חֹֽרֶב׃

verses.text_en: So my lyre is given over to mourning, My pipe, to accompany weepers.
verses.text_he: וַיְהִ֣י לְ֭אֵבֶל כִּנֹּרִ֑י וְ֝עֻגָבִ֗י לְק֣וֹל בֹּכִֽים׃

verses.text_en: I have covenanted with my eyes Not to gaze on a maiden.
verses.text_he: בְּ֭רִית כָּרַ֣תִּי לְעֵינָ֑י וּמָ֥ה אֶ֝תְבּוֹנֵ֗ן עַל־בְּתוּלָֽה׃

verses.text_en: What fate is decreed by God above? What lot, by Shaddai in the heights?
verses.text_he: וּמֶ֤ה חֵ֣לֶק אֱל֣וֹהַּ מִמָּ֑עַל וְֽנַחֲלַ֥ת שַׁ֝דַּ֗י מִמְּרֹמִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Calamity is surely for the iniquitous; Misfortune, for the worker of mischief.
verses.text_he: הֲלֹא־אֵ֥יד לְעַוָּ֑ל וְ֝נֵ֗כֶר לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃

verses.text_en: Surely He observes my ways, Takes account of my every step.
verses.text_he: הֲלֹא־ה֭וּא יִרְאֶ֣ה דְרָכָ֑י וְֽכׇל־צְעָדַ֥י יִסְפּֽוֹר׃

verses.text_en: Have I walked with worthless men, Or my feet hurried to deceit?
verses.text_he: אִם־הָלַ֥כְתִּי עִם־שָׁ֑וְא וַתַּ֖חַשׁ עַל־מִרְמָ֣ה רַגְלִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Let Him weigh me on the scale of righteousness; Let God ascertain my integrity.
verses.text_he: יִשְׁקְלֵ֥נִי בְמֹֽאזְנֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וְיֵדַ֥ע אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ תֻּמָּתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: If my feet have strayed from their course, My heart followed after my eyes, And a stain sullied my hands,
verses.text_he: אִ֥ם־תִּטֶּ֣ה אַשֻּׁרִי֮ מִנִּ֢י הַ֫דָּ֥רֶךְ וְאַחַ֣ר עֵ֭ינַי הָלַ֣ךְ לִבִּ֑י וּ֝בְכַפַּ֗י דָּ֣בַק מֽאוּם׃

verses.text_en: May I sow, but another reap, May the growth of my field be uprooted!
verses.text_he: אֶ֭זְרְעָה וְאַחֵ֣ר יֹאכֵ֑ל וְֽצֶאֱצָאַ֥י יְשֹׁרָֽשׁוּ׃

verses.text_en: If my heart was ravished by the wife of my neighbor, And I lay in wait at his door,
verses.text_he: אִם־נִפְתָּ֣ה לִ֭בִּי עַל־אִשָּׁ֑ה וְעַל־פֶּ֖תַח רֵעִ֣י אָרָֽבְתִּי׃

verses.text_en: May my wife grind for another, May others kneel over her!
verses.text_he: תִּטְחַ֣ן לְאַחֵ֣ר אִשְׁתִּ֑י וְ֝עָלֶ֗יהָ יִכְרְע֥וּן אֲחֵרִֽין׃

verses.text_en: For that would have been debauchery, A criminal offense,
verses.text_he: כִּי־[הִ֥יא] (הוא) זִמָּ֑ה (והיא) [וְ֝ה֗וּא] עָוֺ֥ן פְּלִילִֽים׃

verses.text_en: A fire burning down to Abaddon, Consuming the roots of all my increase.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י אֵ֣שׁ הִ֭יא עַד־אֲבַדּ֣וֹן תֹּאכֵ֑ל וּֽבְכׇל־תְּב֖וּאָתִ֣י תְשָׁרֵֽשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Did I ever brush aside the case of my servants, man or maid, When they made a complaint against me?
verses.text_he: אִם־אֶמְאַ֗ס מִשְׁפַּ֣ט עַ֭בְדִּי וַאֲמָתִ֑י בְּ֝רִבָ֗ם עִמָּדִֽי׃

verses.text_en: What then should I do when God arises; When He calls me to account, what should I answer Him?
verses.text_he: וּמָ֣ה אֶ֭עֱשֶׂה כִּֽי־יָק֣וּם אֵ֑ל וְכִי־יִ֝פְקֹ֗ד מָ֣ה אֲשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: Did not He who made me in my mother’s belly make him? Did not One form us both in the womb?
verses.text_he: הֲֽלֹא־בַ֭בֶּטֶן עֹשֵׂ֣נִי עָשָׂ֑הוּ וַ֝יְכֻנֶ֗נּוּ בָּרֶ֥חֶם אֶחָֽד׃

verses.text_en: Did I deny the poor their needs, Or let a widow pine away,
verses.text_he: אִם־אֶ֭מְנַע מֵחֵ֣פֶץ דַּלִּ֑ים וְעֵינֵ֖י אַלְמָנָ֣ה אֲכַלֶּֽה׃

verses.text_en: By eating my food alone, The fatherless not eating of it also?
verses.text_he: וְאֹכַ֣ל פִּתִּ֣י לְבַדִּ֑י וְלֹֽא־אָכַ֖ל יָת֣וֹם מִמֶּֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: Why, from my youth he grew up with me as though I were his father; Since I left my mother’s womb I was her guide.
verses.text_he: כִּ֣י מִ֭נְּעוּרַי גְּדֵלַ֣נִי כְאָ֑ב וּמִבֶּ֖טֶן אִמִּ֣י אַנְחֶֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: I never saw an unclad wretch, A needy man without clothing,
verses.text_he: אִם־אֶרְאֶ֣ה א֭וֹבֵד מִבְּלִ֣י לְב֑וּשׁ וְאֵ֥ין כְּ֝ס֗וּת לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃

verses.text_en: Whose loins did not bless me As he warmed himself with the shearings of my sheep.
verses.text_he: אִם־לֹ֣א בֵרְכ֣וּנִי חֲלָצָ֑ו וּמִגֵּ֥ז כְּ֝בָשַׂ֗י יִתְחַמָּֽם׃

verses.text_en: If I raised my hand against the fatherless, Looking to my supporters in the gate,
verses.text_he: אִם־הֲנִיפ֣וֹתִי עַל־יָת֣וֹם יָדִ֑י כִּֽי־אֶרְאֶ֥ה בַ֝שַּׁ֗עַר עֶזְרָתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: May my arm drop off my shoulder; My forearm break off at the elbow.
verses.text_he: כְּ֭תֵפִי מִשִּׁכְמָ֣הֿ תִפּ֑וֹל וְ֝אֶזְרֹעִ֗י מִקָּנָ֥הֿ תִשָּׁבֵֽר׃

verses.text_en: For I am in dread of God-sent calamity; I cannot bear His threat.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י פַ֣חַד אֵ֭לַי אֵ֣יד אֵ֑ל וּ֝מִשְּׂאֵת֗וֹ לֹ֣א אוּכָֽל׃

verses.text_en: Did I put my reliance on gold, Or regard fine gold as my bulwark?
verses.text_he: אִם־שַׂ֣מְתִּי זָהָ֣ב כִּסְלִ֑י וְ֝לַכֶּ֗תֶם אָמַ֥רְתִּי מִבְטַחִֽי׃

verses.text_en: Did I rejoice in my great wealth, In having attained plenty?
verses.text_he: אִם־אֶ֭שְׂמַח כִּֽי־רַ֣ב חֵילִ֑י וְכִֽי־כַ֝בִּ֗יר מָצְאָ֥ה יָדִֽי׃

verses.text_en: If ever I saw the light shining, The moon on its course in full glory,
verses.text_he: אִם־אֶרְאֶ֣ה א֭וֹר כִּ֣י יָהֵ֑ל וְ֝יָרֵ֗חַ יָקָ֥ר הֹלֵֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: And I secretly succumbed, And my hand touched my mouth in a kiss,
verses.text_he: וַיִּ֣פְתְּ בַּסֵּ֣תֶר לִבִּ֑י וַתִּשַּׁ֖ק יָדִ֣י לְפִֽי׃

verses.text_en: That, too, would have been a criminal offense, For I would have denied God above.
verses.text_he: גַּם־ה֭וּא עָוֺ֣ן פְּלִילִ֑י כִּֽי־כִחַ֖שְׁתִּי לָאֵ֣ל מִמָּֽעַל׃

verses.text_en: Did I rejoice over my enemy’s misfortune? Did I thrill because evil befell him?
verses.text_he: אִם־אֶ֭שְׂמַח בְּפִ֣יד מְשַׂנְאִ֑י וְ֝הִתְעֹרַ֗רְתִּי כִּֽי־מְצָ֥אוֹ רָֽע׃

verses.text_en: I never let my mouth sin By wishing his death in a curse.
verses.text_he: וְלֹא־נָתַ֣תִּי לַחֲטֹ֣א חִכִּ֑י לִשְׁאֹ֖ל בְּאָלָ֣ה נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃

verses.text_en: (Indeed, the men of my clan said, “We would consume his flesh insatiably!”)
verses.text_he: אִם־לֹ֣א אָ֭מְרוּ מְתֵ֣י אׇהֳלִ֑י מִי־יִתֵּ֥ן מִ֝בְּשָׂר֗וֹ לֹ֣א נִשְׂבָּֽע׃

verses.text_en: No sojourner spent the night in the open; I opened my doors to the road.
verses.text_he: בַּ֭חוּץ לֹא־יָלִ֣ין גֵּ֑ר דְּ֝לָתַ֗י לָאֹ֥רַח אֶפְתָּֽח׃

verses.text_en: Did I hide my transgressions like Adam, Bury my wrongdoing in my bosom,
verses.text_he: אִם־כִּסִּ֣יתִי כְאָדָ֣ם פְּשָׁעָ֑י לִטְמ֖וֹן בְּחֻבִּ֣י עֲוֺנִֽי׃

verses.text_en: That I should [now] fear the great multitude, And am shattered by the contempt of families, So that I keep silent and do not step outdoors?
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י אֶעֱר֨וֹץ׀ הָ֘מ֤וֹן רַבָּ֗ה וּבוּז־מִשְׁפָּח֥וֹת יְחִתֵּ֑נִי וָ֝אֶדֹּ֗ם לֹא־אֵ֥צֵא פָֽתַח׃

verses.text_en: O that I had someone to give me a hearing; O that Shaddai would reply to my writ, Or my accuser draw up a true bill!
verses.text_he: מִ֤י יִתֶּן־לִ֨י׀ שֹׁ֘מֵ֤עַֽ לִ֗י הֶן־תָּ֭וִי שַׁדַּ֣י יַעֲנֵ֑נִי וְסֵ֥פֶר כָּ֝תַ֗ב אִ֣ישׁ רִיבִֽי׃

verses.text_en: I would carry it on my shoulder; Tie it around me for a wreath.
verses.text_he: אִם־לֹ֣א עַל־שִׁ֭כְמִי אֶשָּׂאֶ֑נּוּ אֶעֶנְדֶ֖נּוּ עֲטָר֣וֹת לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: I would give him an account of my steps, Offer it as to a commander.
verses.text_he: מִסְפַּ֣ר צְ֭עָדַי אַגִּידֶ֑נּוּ כְּמוֹ־נָ֝גִ֗יד אֲקָֽרְבֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: If my land cries out against me, Its furrows weep together;
verses.text_he: אִם־עָ֭לַי אַדְמָתִ֣י תִזְעָ֑ק וְ֝יַ֗חַד תְּלָמֶ֥יהָ יִבְכָּיֽוּן׃

verses.text_en: If I have eaten its produce without payment, And made its [rightful] owners despair,
verses.text_he: אִם־כֹּ֭חָהּ אָכַ֣לְתִּי בְלִי־כָ֑סֶף וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ בְּעָלֶ֣יהָ הִפָּֽחְתִּי׃

verses.text_en: May nettles grow there instead of wheat; Instead of barley, stinkweed! The words of Job are at an end.
verses.text_he: תַּ֤חַת חִטָּ֨ה׀ יֵ֥צֵא ח֗וֹחַ וְתַֽחַת־שְׂעֹרָ֥ה בׇאְשָׁ֑ה תַּ֝֗מּוּ דִּבְרֵ֥י אִיּֽוֹב׃{פ}

verses.text_en: These three men ceased replying to Job, for he considered himself right.
verses.text_he: וַֽיִּשְׁבְּת֡וּ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָ֭אֵלֶּה מֵעֲנ֣וֹת אֶת־אִיּ֑וֹב כִּ֤י ה֖וּא צַדִּ֣יק בְּעֵינָֽיו׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was angry—angry at Job because he thought himself right against God.
verses.text_he: וַיִּ֤חַר אַ֨ף׀ אֱלִיה֣וּא בֶן־בַּרַכְאֵ֣ל הַבּוּזִי֮ מִמִּשְׁפַּ֢חַ֫ת רָ֥ם בְּ֭אִיּוֹב חָרָ֣ה אַפּ֑וֹ עַֽל־צַדְּק֥וֹ נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ מֵאֱלֹהִֽים׃

verses.text_en: He was angry as well at his three friends, because they found no reply, but merely condemned Job.
verses.text_he: וּבִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת רֵעָיו֮ חָרָ֢ה אַ֫פּ֥וֹ עַ֤ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־מָצְא֣וּ מַעֲנֶ֑ה וַ֝יַּרְשִׁ֗יעוּ אֶת־אִיּֽוֹב׃

verses.text_en: Elihu waited out Job’s speech, for they were all older than he.
verses.text_he: וֶאֱלִיה֗וּ חִכָּ֣ה אֶת־אִ֭יּוֹב בִּדְבָרִ֑ים כִּ֤י זְֽקֵנִים־הֵ֖מָּה מִמֶּ֣נּוּ לְיָמִֽים׃

verses.text_en: But when Elihu saw that the three men had nothing to reply, he was angry.
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֤רְא אֱלִיה֗וּא כִּ֘י־אֵ֤ין מַעֲנֶ֗ה בְּ֭פִי שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים וַיִּ֥חַר אַפּֽוֹ׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite said in reply: I have but few years, while you are old; Therefore I was too awestruck and fearful To hold forth among you.
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֤עַן׀ אֱלִיה֖וּא בֶן־בַּרַכְאֵ֥ל הַבּוּזִ֗י וַיֹּ֫אמַ֥ר צָ֘עִ֤יר אֲנִ֣י לְ֭יָמִים וְאַתֶּ֣ם יְשִׁישִׁ֑ים עַל־כֵּ֖ן זָחַ֥לְתִּי וָאִירָ֓א׀ מֵחַוֺּ֖ת דֵּעִ֣י אֶתְכֶֽם׃

verses.text_en: I thought, “Let age speak; Let advanced years declare wise things.”
verses.text_he: אָ֭מַרְתִּי יָמִ֣ים יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ וְרֹ֥ב שָׁ֝נִ֗ים יֹדִ֥יעוּ חׇכְמָֽה׃

verses.text_en: But truly it is the spirit in men, The breath of Shaddai, that gives them understanding.
verses.text_he: אָ֭כֵן רוּחַ־הִ֣יא בֶאֱנ֑וֹשׁ וְנִשְׁמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י תְּבִינֵֽם׃

verses.text_en: It is not the aged who are wise, The elders, who understand how to judge.
verses.text_he: לֹא־רַבִּ֥ים יֶחְכָּ֑מוּ וּ֝זְקֵנִ֗ים יָבִ֥ינוּ מִשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: Therefore I say, “Listen to me; I too would hold forth.”
verses.text_he: לָכֵ֣ן אָ֭מַרְתִּי שִׁמְעָה־לִּ֑י אֲחַוֶּ֖ה דֵעִ֣י אַף־אָֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: Here I have waited out your speeches, I have given ear to your insights, While you probed the issues;
verses.text_he: הֵ֤ן הוֹחַ֨לְתִּי׀ לְֽדִבְרֵיכֶ֗ם אָ֭זִין עַד־תְּב֥וּנֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם עַֽד־תַּחְקְר֥וּן מִלִּֽין׃

verses.text_en: But as I attended to you, I saw that none of you could argue with Job, Or offer replies to his statements.
verses.text_he: וְעָ֥דֵיכֶ֗ם אֶתְבּ֫וֹנָ֥ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵ֣ין לְאִיּ֣וֹב מוֹכִ֑יחַ עוֹנֶ֖ה אֲמָרָ֣יו מִכֶּֽם׃

verses.text_en: I fear you will say, “We have found the wise course; God will defeat him, not man.”
verses.text_he: פֶּן־תֹּ֣֭אמְרוּ מָצָ֣אנוּ חׇכְמָ֑ה אֵ֖ל יִדְּפֶ֣נּוּ לֹא־אִֽישׁ׃

verses.text_en: He did not set out his case against me, Nor shall I use your reasons to reply to him.
verses.text_he: וְלֹא־עָרַ֣ךְ אֵלַ֣י מִלִּ֑ין וּ֝בְאִמְרֵיכֶ֗ם לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: They have been broken and can no longer reply; Words fail them.
verses.text_he: חַ֭תּוּ לֹא־עָ֣נוּ ע֑וֹד הֶעְתִּ֖יקוּ מֵהֶ֣ם מִלִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: I have waited till they stopped speaking, Till they ended and no longer replied.
verses.text_he: וְ֭הוֹחַלְתִּי כִּי־לֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ כִּ֥י עָ֝מְד֗וּ לֹא־עָ֥נוּ עֽוֹד׃

verses.text_en: Now I also would have my say; I too would like to hold forth,
verses.text_he: אַעֲנֶ֣ה אַף־אֲנִ֣י חֶלְקִ֑י אֲחַוֶּ֖ה דֵעִ֣י אַף־אָֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: For I am full of words; The wind in my belly presses me.
verses.text_he: כִּ֭י מָלֵ֣תִי מִלִּ֑ים הֱ֝צִיקַ֗תְנִי ר֣וּחַ בִּטְנִֽי׃

verses.text_en: My belly is like wine not yet opened, Like jugs of new wine ready to burst.
verses.text_he: הִנֵּֽה־בִטְנִ֗י כְּיַ֥יִן לֹֽא־יִפָּתֵ֑חַ כְּאֹב֥וֹת חֲ֝דָשִׁ֗ים יִבָּקֵֽעַ׃

verses.text_en: Let me speak, then, and get relief; Let me open my lips and reply.
verses.text_he: אֲדַבְּרָ֥ה וְיִֽרְוַֽח־לִ֑י אֶפְתַּ֖ח שְׂפָתַ֣י וְאֶעֱנֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: I would not show regard for any man, Or temper my speech for anyone’s sake;
verses.text_he: אַל־נָ֭א אֶשָּׂ֣א פְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְאֶל־אָ֝דָ֗ם לֹ֣א אֲכַנֶּֽה׃

verses.text_en: For I do not know how to temper my speech— My Maker would soon carry me off!
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֲכַנֶּ֑ה כִּ֝מְעַ֗ט יִשָּׂאֵ֥נִי עֹשֵֽׂנִי׃

verses.text_en: But now, Job, listen to my words, Give ear to all that I say.
verses.text_he: וְֽאוּלָ֗ם שְׁמַֽע־נָ֣א אִיּ֣וֹב מִלָּ֑י וְֽכׇל־דְּבָרַ֥י הַאֲזִֽינָה׃

verses.text_en: Now I open my lips; My tongue forms words in my mouth.
verses.text_he: הִנֵּה־נָ֭א פָּתַ֣חְתִּי פִ֑י דִּבְּרָ֖ה לְשׁוֹנִ֣י בְחִכִּֽי׃

verses.text_en: My words bespeak the uprightness of my heart; My lips utter insight honestly.
verses.text_he: יֹשֶׁר־לִבִּ֥י אֲמָרָ֑י וְדַ֥עַת שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י בָּר֥וּר מִלֵּֽלוּ׃

verses.text_en: The spirit of God formed me; The breath of Shaddai sustains me.
verses.text_he: רֽוּחַ־אֵ֥ל עָשָׂ֑תְנִי וְנִשְׁמַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י תְּחַיֵּֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: If you can, answer me; Argue against me, take your stand.
verses.text_he: אִם־תּוּכַ֥ל הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נִי עֶרְכָ֥הֿ לְ֝פָנַ֗י הִתְיַצָּֽבָה׃

verses.text_en: You and I are the same before God; I too was nipped from clay.
verses.text_he: הֵן־אֲנִ֣י כְפִ֣יךָ לָאֵ֑ל מֵ֝חֹ֗מֶר קֹרַ֥צְתִּי גַם־אָֽנִי׃

verses.text_en: You are not overwhelmed by fear of me; My pressure does not weigh heavily on you.
verses.text_he: הִנֵּ֣ה אֵ֭מָתִי לֹ֣א תְבַעֲתֶ֑ךָּ וְ֝אַכְפִּ֗י עָלֶ֥יךָ לֹֽא־יִכְבָּֽד׃

verses.text_en: Indeed, you have stated in my hearing, I heard the words spoken,
verses.text_he: אַ֭ךְ אָמַ֣רְתָּ בְאׇזְנָ֑י וְק֖וֹל מִלִּ֣ין אֶשְׁמָֽע׃

verses.text_en: “I am guiltless, free from transgression; I am innocent, without iniquity.
verses.text_he: זַ֥ךְ אֲנִ֗י בְּֽלִ֫י־פָ֥שַׁע חַ֥ף אָנֹכִ֑י וְלֹ֖א עָוֺ֣ן לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: But He finds reasons to oppose me, Considers me His enemy.
verses.text_he: הֵ֣ן תְּ֭נוּאוֹת עָלַ֣י יִמְצָ֑א יַחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי לְאוֹיֵ֣ב לֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He puts my feet in stocks, Watches all my ways.”
verses.text_he: יָשֵׂ֣ם בַּסַּ֣ד רַגְלָ֑י יִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר כׇּל־אׇרְחֹתָֽי׃

verses.text_en: In this you are not right; I will answer you: God is greater than any man.
verses.text_he: הֶן־זֹ֣את לֹא־צָדַ֣קְתָּ אֶעֱנֶ֑ךָּ כִּי־יִרְבֶּ֥ה אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַּ מֵאֱנֽוֹשׁ׃

verses.text_en: Why do you complain against Him That He does not reply to any of man’s charges?
verses.text_he: מַ֭דּוּעַ אֵלָ֣יו רִיב֑וֹתָ כִּ֥י כׇל־דְּ֝בָרָ֗יו לֹ֣א יַעֲנֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: For God speaks time and again— Though man does not perceive it—
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־בְאַחַ֥ת יְדַבֶּר־אֵ֑ל וּ֝בִשְׁתַּ֗יִם לֹ֣א יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃

verses.text_en: In a dream, a night vision, When deep sleep falls on men, While they slumber on their beds.
verses.text_he: בַּחֲל֤וֹם׀ חֶזְי֬וֹן לַ֗יְלָה בִּנְפֹ֣ל תַּ֭רְדֵּמָה עַל־אֲנָשִׁ֑ים בִּ֝תְנוּמ֗וֹת עֲלֵ֣י מִשְׁכָּֽב׃

verses.text_en: Then He opens men’s understanding, And by disciplining them leaves His signature
verses.text_he: אָ֣ז יִ֭גְלֶה אֹ֣זֶן אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וּבְמֹ֖סָרָ֣ם יַחְתֹּֽם׃

verses.text_en: To turn man away from an action, To suppress pride in man.
verses.text_he: לְ֭הָסִיר אָדָ֣ם מַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְגֵוָ֖ה מִגֶּ֣בֶר יְכַסֶּֽה׃

verses.text_en: He spares him from the Pit, His person, from perishing by the sword.
verses.text_he: יַחְשֹׂ֣ךְ נַ֭פְשׁוֹ מִנִּי־שָׁ֑חַת וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ מֵעֲבֹ֥ר בַּשָּֽׁלַח׃

verses.text_en: He is reproved by pains on his bed, And the trembling in his bones is constant.
verses.text_he: וְהוּכַ֣ח בְּ֭מַכְאוֹב עַל־מִשְׁכָּב֑וֹ (וריב) [וְר֖וֹב] עֲצָמָ֣יו אֵתָֽן׃

verses.text_en: He detests food; Fine food [is repulsive] to him.
verses.text_he: וְזִהֲמַ֣תּוּ חַיָּת֣וֹ לָ֑חֶם וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ מַאֲכַ֥ל תַּאֲוָֽה׃

verses.text_en: His flesh wastes away till it cannot be seen, And his bones are rubbed away till they are invisible.
verses.text_he: יִ֣כֶל בְּשָׂר֣וֹ מֵרֹ֑אִי (ושפי) [וְשֻׁפּ֥וּ] עַ֝צְמֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א רֻאּֽוּ׃

verses.text_en: He comes close to the Pit, His life [verges] on death.
verses.text_he: וַתִּקְרַ֣ב לַשַּׁ֣חַת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ לַֽמְמִתִֽים׃

verses.text_en: If he has a representative, One advocate against a thousand To declare the man’s uprightness,
verses.text_he: אִם־יֵ֤שׁ עָלָ֨יו׀ מַלְאָ֗ךְ מֵלִ֗יץ אֶחָ֥ד מִנִּי־אָ֑לֶף לְהַגִּ֖יד לְאָדָ֣ם יׇשְׁרֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: Then He has mercy on him and decrees, “Redeem him from descending to the Pit, For I have obtained his ransom;
verses.text_he: וַיְחֻנֶּ֗נּוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר פְּ֭דָעֵהוּ מֵרֶ֥דֶת שָׁ֗חַת מָצָ֥אתִי כֹֽפֶר׃

verses.text_en: Let his flesh be healthier than in his youth; Let him return to his younger days.”
verses.text_he: רֻֽטְפַ֣שׁ בְּשָׂר֣וֹ מִנֹּ֑עַר יָ֝שׁ֗וּב לִימֵ֥י עֲלוּמָֽיו׃

verses.text_en: He prays to God and is accepted by Him; He enters His presence with shouts of joy, For He requites a man for his righteousness.
verses.text_he: יֶעְתַּ֤ר אֶל־אֱל֨וֹהַּ׀ וַיִּרְצֵ֗הוּ וַיַּ֣רְא פָּ֭נָיו בִּתְרוּעָ֑ה וַיָּ֥שֶׁב לֶ֝אֱנ֗וֹשׁ צִדְקָתֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: He declares to men, “I have sinned; I have perverted what was right; But I was not paid back for it.”
verses.text_he: יָשֹׁ֤ר׀ עַל־אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וַיֹּ֗אמֶר חָ֭טָאתִי וְיָשָׁ֥ר הֶעֱוֵ֗יתִי וְלֹא־שָׁ֥וָה לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: He redeemed him from passing into the Pit; He will enjoy the light.
verses.text_he: פָּדָ֣ה (נפשי) [נַ֭פְשׁוֹ] מֵעֲבֹ֣ר בַּשָּׁ֑חַת (וחיתי) [וְ֝חַיָּת֗וֹ] בָּא֥וֹר תִּרְאֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: Truly, God does all these things Two or three times to a man,
verses.text_he: הֶן־כׇּל־אֵ֭לֶּה יִפְעַל־אֵ֑ל פַּעֲמַ֖יִם שָׁל֣וֹשׁ עִם־גָּֽבֶר׃

verses.text_en: To bring him back from the Pit, That he may bask in the light of life.
verses.text_he: לְהָשִׁ֣יב נַ֭פְשׁוֹ מִנִּי־שָׁ֑חַת לֵ֝א֗וֹר בְּא֣וֹר הַחַיִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: Pay heed, Job, and hear me; Be still, and I will speak;
verses.text_he: הַקְשֵׁ֖ב אִיּ֥וֹב שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י הַ֝חֲרֵ֗שׁ וְאָנֹכִ֥י אֲדַבֵּֽר׃

verses.text_en: If you have what to say, answer me; Speak, for I am eager to vindicate you.
verses.text_he: אִם־יֵשׁ־מִלִּ֥ין הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נִי דַּ֝בֵּ֗ר כִּֽי־חָפַ֥צְתִּי צַדְּקֶֽךָּ׃

verses.text_en: But if not, you listen to me; Be still, and I will teach you wisdom.
verses.text_he: אִם־אַ֭יִן אַתָּ֥ה שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י הַ֝חֲרֵ֗שׁ וַאֲאַלֶּפְךָ֥ חׇכְמָֽה׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Elihu said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֥עַן אֱלִיה֗וּא וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: Listen, O wise men, to my words; You who have knowledge, give ear to me.
verses.text_he: שִׁמְע֣וּ חֲכָמִ֣ים מִלָּ֑י וְ֝יֹדְעִ֗ים הַאֲזִ֥ינוּ לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: For the ear tests arguments As the palate tastes food.
verses.text_he: כִּי־אֹ֭זֶן מִלִּ֣ין תִּבְחָ֑ן וְ֝חֵ֗ךְ יִטְעַ֥ם לֶאֱכֹֽל׃

verses.text_en: Let us decide for ourselves what is just; Let us know among ourselves what is good.
verses.text_he: מִשְׁפָּ֥ט נִבְחֲרָה־לָּ֑נוּ נֵדְעָ֖ה בֵינֵ֣ינוּ מַה־טּֽוֹב׃

verses.text_en: For Job has said, “I am right; God has deprived me of justice.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־אָמַ֣ר אִיּ֣וֹב צָדַ֑קְתִּי וְ֝אֵ֗ל הֵסִ֥יר מִשְׁפָּטִֽי׃

verses.text_en: I declare the judgment against me false; My arrow-wound is deadly, though I am free from transgression.”
verses.text_he: עַל־מִשְׁפָּטִ֥י אֲכַזֵּ֑ב אָנ֖וּשׁ חִצִּ֣י בְלִי־פָֽשַׁע׃

verses.text_en: What man is like Job, Who drinks mockery like water;
verses.text_he: מִי־גֶ֥בֶר כְּאִיּ֑וֹב יִֽשְׁתֶּה־לַּ֥עַג כַּמָּֽיִם׃

verses.text_en: Who makes common cause with evildoers, And goes with wicked men?
verses.text_he: וְאָרַ֣ח לְ֭חֶבְרָה עִם־פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן וְ֝לָלֶ֗כֶת עִם־אַנְשֵׁי־רֶֽשַׁע׃

verses.text_en: For he says, “Man gains nothing When he is in God’s favor.”
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־אָ֭מַר לֹ֣א יִסְכׇּן־גָּ֑בֶר בִּ֝רְצֹת֗וֹ עִם־אֱלֹהִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Therefore, men of understanding, listen to me; Wickedness be far from God, Wrongdoing, from Shaddai!
verses.text_he: לָכֵ֤ן׀ אַ֥נְשֵׁ֥י לֵבָ֗ב שִׁמְע֫וּ־לִ֥י חָלִ֖לָה לָאֵ֥ל מֵרֶ֗שַׁע וְשַׁדַּ֥י מֵעָֽוֶל׃

verses.text_en: For He pays a man according to his actions, And provides for him according to his conduct;
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י פֹ֣עַל אָ֭דָם יְשַׁלֶּם־ל֑וֹ וּֽכְאֹ֥רַח אִ֝֗ישׁ יַמְצִאֶֽנּוּ׃

verses.text_en: For God surely does not act wickedly; Shaddai does not pervert justice.
verses.text_he: אַף־אׇמְנָ֗ם אֵ֥ל לֹֽא־יַרְשִׁ֑יעַ וְ֝שַׁדַּ֗י לֹא־יְעַוֵּ֥ת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: Who placed the earth in His charge? Who ordered the entire world?
verses.text_he: מִֽי־פָקַ֣ד עָלָ֣יו אָ֑רְצָה וּמִ֥י שָׂ֝֗ם תֵּבֵ֥ל כֻּלָּֽהּ׃

verses.text_en: If He but intends it, He can call back His spirit and breath;
verses.text_he: אִם־יָשִׂ֣ים אֵלָ֣יו לִבּ֑וֹ רוּח֥וֹ וְ֝נִשְׁמָת֗וֹ אֵלָ֥יו יֶאֱסֹֽף׃

verses.text_en: All flesh would at once expire, And mankind return to dust.
verses.text_he: יִגְוַ֣ע כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֣ר יָ֑חַד וְ֝אָדָ֗ם עַל־עָפָ֥ר יָשֽׁוּב׃

verses.text_en: If you would understand, listen to this; Give ear to what I say.
verses.text_he: וְאִם־בִּ֥ינָה שִׁמְעָה־זֹּ֑את הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינָה לְק֣וֹל מִלָּֽי׃

verses.text_en: Would one who hates justice govern? Would you condemn the Just Mighty One?
verses.text_he: הַאַ֬ף שׂוֹנֵ֣א מִשְׁפָּ֣ט יַחֲב֑וֹשׁ וְאִם־צַדִּ֖יק כַּבִּ֣יר תַּרְשִֽׁיעַ׃

verses.text_en: Would you call a king a scoundrel, Great men, wicked?
verses.text_he: הַאֲמֹ֣ר לְמֶ֣לֶךְ בְּלִיָּ֑עַל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע אֶל־נְדִיבִֽים׃

verses.text_en: He is not partial to princes; The noble are not preferred to the wretched; For all of them are the work of His hands.
verses.text_he: אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־נָשָׂ֨א׀ פְּנֵ֥י שָׂרִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א נִכַּר־שׁ֭וֹעַ לִפְנֵי־דָ֑ל כִּֽי־מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדָ֣יו כֻּלָּֽם׃

verses.text_en: Some die suddenly in the middle of the night; People are in turmoil and pass on; Even great men are removed—not by human hands.
verses.text_he: רֶ֤גַע׀ יָמֻתוּ֮ וַחֲצ֢וֹת לָ֥֫יְלָה יְגֹעֲשׁ֣וּ עָ֣ם וְיַעֲבֹ֑רוּ וְיָסִ֥ירוּ אַ֝בִּ֗יר לֹ֣א בְיָֽד׃

verses.text_en: For His eyes are upon a man’s ways; He observes his every step.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־עֵ֭ינָיו עַל־דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְֽכׇל־צְעָדָ֥יו יִרְאֶֽה׃

verses.text_en: Neither darkness nor gloom offers A hiding-place for evildoers.
verses.text_he: אֵֽין־חֹ֭שֶׁךְ וְאֵ֣ין צַלְמָ֑וֶת לְהִסָּ֥תֶר שָׁ֝֗ם פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃

verses.text_en: He has no set time for man To appear before God in judgment.
verses.text_he: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א עַל־אִ֭ישׁ יָשִׂ֣ים ע֑וֹד לַהֲלֹ֥ךְ אֶל־אֵ֝֗ל בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃

verses.text_en: He shatters mighty men without number And sets others in their place.
verses.text_he: יָרֹ֣עַ כַּבִּירִ֣ים לֹא־חֵ֑קֶר וַיַּעֲמֵ֖ד אֲחֵרִ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽם׃

verses.text_en: Truly, He knows their deeds; Night is over, and they are crushed.
verses.text_he: לָכֵ֗ן יַ֭כִּיר מַעְבָּדֵיהֶ֑ם וְהָ֥פַךְ לַ֝֗יְלָה וְיִדַּכָּֽאוּ׃

verses.text_en: He strikes them down with the wicked Where people can see,
verses.text_he: תַּֽחַת־רְשָׁעִ֥ים סְפָקָ֗ם בִּמְק֥וֹם רֹאִֽים׃

verses.text_en: Because they have been disloyal to Him And have not understood any of His ways;
verses.text_he: אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כֵּ֭ן סָ֣רוּ מֵאַחֲרָ֑יו וְכׇל־דְּ֝רָכָ֗יו לֹ֣א הִשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃

verses.text_en: Thus He lets the cry of the poor come before Him; He listens to the cry of the needy.
verses.text_he: לְהָבִ֣יא עָ֭לָיו צַעֲקַת־דָּ֑ל וְצַעֲקַ֖ת עֲנִיִּ֣ים יִשְׁמָֽע׃

verses.text_en: When He is silent, who will condemn? If He hides His face, who will see Him, Be it nation or man?
verses.text_he: וְה֤וּא יַשְׁקִ֨ט׀ וּמִ֥י יַרְשִׁ֗עַ וְיַסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נִים וּמִ֣י יְשׁוּרֶ֑נּוּ וְעַל־גּ֖וֹי וְעַל־אָדָ֣ם יָֽחַד׃

verses.text_en: The impious man rules no more, Nor do those who ensnare the people.
verses.text_he: מִ֭מְּלֹךְ אָדָ֥ם חָנֵ֗ף מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי עָֽם׃

verses.text_en: Has he said to God, “I will bear [my punishment] and offend no more.
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־אֶל־אֵ֭ל הֶאָמַ֥ר נָשָׂ֗אתִי לֹ֣א אֶחְבֹּֽל׃

verses.text_en: What I cannot see You teach me. If I have done iniquity, I shall not do so again”?
verses.text_he: בִּלְעֲדֵ֣י אֶ֭חֱזֶה אַתָּ֣ה הֹרֵ֑נִי אִֽם־עָ֥וֶל פָּ֝עַ֗לְתִּי לֹ֣א אֹסִֽיף׃

verses.text_en: Should He requite as you see fit? But you have despised [Him]! You must decide, not I; Speak what you know.
verses.text_he: הֲֽמֵעִמְּךָ֬ יְשַׁלְּמֶ֨נָּה׀ כִּֽי־מָאַ֗סְתָּ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה תִבְחַ֣ר וְלֹא־אָ֑נִי וּֽמַה־יָּדַ֥עְתָּ דַבֵּֽר׃

verses.text_en: Men of understanding say to me, Wise men who hear me,
verses.text_he: אַנְשֵׁ֣י לֵ֭בָב יֹ֣אמְרוּ לִ֑י וְגֶ֥בֶר חָ֝כָ֗ם שֹׁמֵ֥עַֽ לִֽי׃

verses.text_en: “Job does not speak with knowledge; His words lack understanding.”
verses.text_he: אִ֭יּוֹב לֹא־בְדַ֣עַת יְדַבֵּ֑ר וּ֝דְבָרָ֗יו לֹ֣א בְהַשְׂכֵּֽיל׃

verses.text_en: Would that Job were tried to the limit For answers which befit sinful men.
verses.text_he: אָבִ֗י יִבָּחֵ֣ן אִיּ֣וֹב עַד־נֶ֑צַח עַל־תְּ֝שֻׁבֹ֗ת בְּאַנְשֵׁי־אָֽוֶן׃

verses.text_en: He adds to his sin; He increases his transgression among us; He multiplies his statements against God.
verses.text_he: כִּ֥י־יֹ֘סִ֤יף עַֽל־חַטָּאת֣וֹ פֶ֭שַׁע בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ יִשְׂפּ֑וֹק וְיֶ֖רֶב אֲמָרָ֣יו לָאֵֽל׃{פ}

verses.text_en: Elihu said in reply:
verses.text_he: וַיַּ֥עַן אֱלִיה֗וּ וַיֹּאמַֽר׃

verses.text_en: Do you think it just To say, “I am right against God”?
verses.text_he: הֲ֭זֹאת חָשַׁ֣בְתָּ לְמִשְׁפָּ֑ט אָ֝מַ֗רְתָּ צִדְקִ֥י מֵאֵֽל׃

verses.text_en: If you ask how it benefits you, “What have I gained from not sinning?”
verses.text_he: כִּֽי־תֹ֭אמַר מַה־יִּסְכׇּן־לָ֑ךְ מָה־אֹ֝עִ֗יל מֵחַטָּאתִֽי׃

verses.text_en: I shall give you a reply, You, along with your friends.
verses.text_he: אֲ֭נִי אֲשִֽׁיבְךָ֣ מִלִּ֑ין וְֽאֶת־רֵעֶ֥יךָ עִמָּֽךְ׃

verses.text_en: Behold the heavens and see; Look at the skies high above you.
verses.text_he: הַבֵּ֣ט שָׁמַ֣יִם וּרְאֵ֑ה וְשׁ֥וּר שְׁ֝חָקִ֗ים גָּבְה֥וּ מִמֶּֽךָּ׃

verses.text_en: If you sin, what do you do to Him? If your transgressions are many, How do you affect Him?
verses.text_he: אִם־חָ֭טָאתָ מַה־תִּפְעׇל־בּ֑וֹ וְרַבּ֥וּ פְ֝שָׁעֶ֗יךָ מַה־תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּֽוֹ׃

verses.text_en: If you are righteous, What do you give Him; What does He receive from your hand?
verses.text_he: אִם־צָ֭דַקְתָּ מַה־תִּתֶּן־ל֑וֹ א֥וֹ מַה־מִּיָּדְךָ֥ יִקָּֽח׃

verses.text_en: Your wickedness affects men like yourself; Your righteousness, mortals.
verses.text_he: לְאִישׁ־כָּמ֥וֹךָ רִשְׁעֶ֑ךָ וּלְבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם צִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃

verses.text_en: Because of contention the oppressed cry out; They shout because of the power of the great.
verses.text_he: מֵ֭רֹב עֲשׁוּקִ֣ים יַזְעִ֑יקוּ יְשַׁוְּע֖וּ מִזְּר֣וֹעַ רַבִּֽים׃

verses.text_en: But none says, “Where is my God, my Maker, Who gives strength in the night;
verses.text_he: וְֽלֹא־אָמַ֗ר אַ֭יֵּה אֱל֣וֹהַּ עֹשָׂ֑י נֹתֵ֖ן זְמִר֣וֹת בַּלָּֽיְלָה׃

verses.text_en: Who gives us more knowledge than the beasts of the earth, Makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?”
